text: Hands down the BEST sushi I have ever had with a lot of great options to choose from, and the customer service to match it... but you will pay for it

Come by and see the owner June for an amazingly delectable experience. We stopped in for the all you can eat sushi for lunch and told him to surprise us! It was delicious and had some great conversations. Highly recommend fresh fish and great atmosphere.

Came here on a whim,  man it was good.  Despite it being Friday night it was slow and sat at the sushi bar and the chef on duty was making me roll after roll of the popular ones.  I ordered a few more off the menu and everything was fantastic. Would definitely return.  Favorite was the big easy roll and spicy garlic edamame.

My family decided to come here after looking at  the Yelp reviews. We were looking for a all you can eat sushi place with fresh sushi and reasonable pricing. We have 3 young kids. Financial standpoint, it doesn't make sense for us to go eat all you can eat expansive buffet at hotels. We were happy we came. There was many choices on the menu such as rolls, nigiri, cooked appetizers. Sushi was pretty fresh and we enjoyed our dinner.Service was good as well. We will come back again next time we visit Vegas!

Horrible service! Paid for all you can eat and the wait staff was never there. 

There is a million sushi places in this town, don't waste your time here.
What a great experience!  Food was delicious, employees are very professional and helpful with picking meal choices.  Definitely will be coming back!
Awesome awesome place!  I am a vegetarian, they had so many options for me as well. So many choices. Great friendly staff. Definitely will be back.

Ordered from here for lunch today.  Got super white tuna, miso, seared tuna, seaweed salad and fat ass roll. They gave me NO wasabi and no utensils, and no napkins. The food was GROSS. Inedible. I only ended up eating the miso. Everything else was too foul smelling and disgusting. Waste of money. Won't be back.

just opened, great sushi! great service! recommend the" hot n juicy", "carrot top " , and spicy edamame, ..Sake Bomb!  well it's been about 12 things tried so far and everything has been awesome , n in picky sushi eater, I never do all you can eat but this will be a repeat for sure , gets a 5
We stay in the Wynn and walk to here to have Sushi, worth it! So delicious! The dinner buffet is $26.96. Love ink, salmon! Nice
Was told last call was at 130 at 120 and not served. Luckily other places inside the complex were open. Unfortunate cause of the really good reviews.

This is hands down the BEST sushi restaurant I've been to thus far. We're talking better than Yama, Kaizen, Sushi Mon and Jjanga. They are fairly new in town so I can only hope this continues to be the case after they've become more popular. 

The friendly, warm service was better than expected. This one guy Richard, who seemed to be the manager, constantly came over to check on me and other guests. Based on my initial orders, he asked if he could recommend a couple dishes which were the specials of the evening. I've never had this happen before during an ayce experience.

There is soft lighting, dark tables and chairs and music that wasn't loud enough to get annoying. This would make a good place for a date. The sushi bar was the most spacious I've seen to date and with plenty of elbow room between chairs.

My picks for the evening:

*Screaming Orgasm: Lightly seared tuna over a bed of radish with some "O" sauce.
*Salmon Tar Tare
*Poke Salad
*Evening specials (sashimi): Super white tuna & yellowtail. Both with jalapenos. 
*Rolls: Big Easy, Dancing Eel, Kiss of Fire, Burning Your Stomach 

After demolishing said dishes, I polished off the meal with a refreshing order of their Yuzu Sorbet. Part of me wanted the honey bread but nobody needed to see me get assisted out the door. 

For $26 buckaroos for dinner, it can't get better than this. Also, don't forget your stamp card. Your 11th ayce is on them. I will be back at least once before the end of this month.
Sooo delicious! They're all you can eat is the best I've had in Vegas! You have to try the coconut shrimp tempura & the sexy lazy roll.. the staff is great, super friendly :)
Great quality! The sushi is really fresh. Off the strip so no need to worry about parking. We are on vacation and will definitely keep coming when in town!

Fish was fresh and delicious! Service was super friendly; Richard was my server and he did a great job recommending rolls based on what I liked. Price for the all you can eat is very reasonable! I loved that you can order 1/2 rolls (4 pieces) instead of full rolls (8 pieces) that way you get to try more of the different rolls/flavors. Great place, I will definitely be coming back.

We went to a couple of all u can eat sushi bars & this is definitely the best. 
1) anything you order from 'today special' is Exellent 
2) seaweed salad, baked mussel & salmon roe are very fresh 
3) dinner includes Korean Kalbi, Sea urchin, oyster , sweet shrimp & Tuna sashimi - for extra $5 is a steal 
4) ask for waitress Sun - she is thoughtful & delivers orders so much faster

Good sushi! Service was excellent! There's only 1 host and he's also the waiter...he's very efficient!  The place is clean and modern. 

*you can make your own rolls
*you can order half rolls
*dessert is only 1 per person
*open late!

We will back!

Wow, we come here at least once every two weeks. The sushi is extremely fresh and their extended menu which includes fried rice, gyoza, salmon wrapped in bacon, galbi, screaming orgasm and at least 20 other dishes by far makes it the best AYCE sushi in Vegas. It is $21.95 for lunch and $26.95 for dinner and they always have amazing specials. I just tried the Salmon Kama which is a fried half of fish is incredibly good!!!!! I highly recommend you give this place a try it is centrally located and 2 min drive from the strip by car of 7-10 min walking.
Damn good sushi..... i expect huge lines in this little hidden gem.  Recommend the orgamsic roll.... to die for!

Great Sushi! Unbelievably fast enormous variety...service was excellent friendly and hospitable.
0 complaints All Great!
Everything I tired here was great. The only thing I didn't like was I ate to much. I will definitely be coming back here again.
Just got into Vegas and made a quick stop for sushi. Reviews were right. I don't usually like all you can eat sushi but this was good!  Definitely coming back next time we are in town.

Sushi way wasn't bad but it wasn't mind blowing, either. It was so-so. 

I wish they had a half star. I think three stars is too low but four stars rating is a bit high. I give them 3.5 stars. 

The sushi nigiris were okay. I think, the best one would be the super white. However, the consistency in making it isn't constant. My first nigiri had just a bit of spicy drizzle on top. My second nigiri was soaking in sauce. :/

In terms of freshness... the fish on the sushi nigiris did taste like they kinda had been on ice for a few hours. For ex. the salmon nigiri was kinda dull in complexion, it wasn't shiny. It tasted a bit milky but wasn't as milky as the other ones I've tried in other Ayce. 

The tuna in the tuna salad had a weird consistency. Unlike chopped tuna I've tried before... their tuna was kinda gelatin in consistency. It didn't taste bad but the consistency was throwing me off.

I also tried their sushi nachos. I think that's my favorite out of everything I've tried. However, they soaked it too much with sauce. :/ They should just have a side sauce for the sushi nachos. 

Because of reviews online... I ended up wanting to try their honey bread. OMG. It was super sweet. They shouldn't have drizzled it with honey and then chocolate syrup. The bread itself was already sweet. I should have just ordered a scoop of green tea ice cream. Sigh. 

Service was fast, which I was happy about. However, they weren't that busy that day.
Place is solid- sushi is of a high quality for AYCE. Lunch price is 21.95 very reasonable. Service is fast and courteous. Go with the oh! Jenna roll.
Great Sushi off the strip. Ivan does an unbelievable job, friendly and amazing sushi. Will be back on my next Vegas visit.

Excelent and fresh fish, super nice service, not expensive at all. We forgot our credit card and they were super effective when giving it back. 
I loved the dinner all together a lot!

This is my first Yelp review. The service here is that miserable that I feel the need to share. On a tight schedule, our party of 8 showed up at 8:05 PM for an 8 PM reservation. We came to find a completely full restaurant and no host at the stand. When I could finally get the attention of a staff member, we were told a party had come in 5 mins before us claiming to be me and swiped our reservation. The restaurant was unwilling to move the party even though they had not placed any orders, and we were forced to wait. After 30 minutes of waiting, we were told again we couldn't be helped. We were never offered any compensation (discount, free drinks, etc) or even a simple apology for the inconvenience. The restaurant staff was unwilling to accept any blame for the incident and did 0 to alleviate the situation. We eventually were forced to leave hungry due to our tight schedule. 

Although I live close, I will never return to this restaurant, and I will do my best to make sure no one I know goes there either.

Being from Reno, I thought that i had eaten a lot of Sushi, especially AYCE, while traveling on business I stopped in at Sushi Way, WOW, great service great atmosphere and vibe, Great Value, huge list of cooked rolls and apettizers for your friends that dont like raw stuff. Most places that do AYCE have a limited menu, not here, everything was on the menu!  I sat at the bar and got great service . a lot of the nigiri that i tried had some small tweaks that made it that much better.  Will come here again next time i am in town. my new favorite place!

This place is pricey but i completely understand why! Everything is so tasty and fresh! I suggest the OYSTERS u can never ever ever go wrong with AYCE OYSTERS! Its sooooo GOOD! Doesnt have that fishy taste they wash it thoroughly! Friendly and veey welcoming atmosphere. our waitress Jane was delightful and very attentive to our needs! Y'all betta get over here and try this joint!

So far this is the best AYCE sushi place I have ever tried. (I've been to almost everywhere in Vegas.) Foods are good service is good too. Ratio of fish and rice is fantastic. Not too much rice, fish is thick. Love this place.

There are times in your life when about every other week you crave for sushi and carefully ask your stomach which location you want to go to to fill this void. Well today we ended up here today because of the dericious selections they have. 
If you luckily make it here you must order these following items to experience the "sushi way" of life =]
Sweet shrimp
Sea urchin (very sweet here. Not all you can eat have it like this)
Seard salmon nigiri
Tuna Nigiri 
Fresh oysters
Salmon skin salad 
Fresh water eel 
Miso soup 
Poki
Japanese lasagna 
They also have 2 things I order that's not on the menu that you should try.
Hamachi kama and fresh Wasabi which I put on everything. 
And for Desert 
Tempura ice cream and HONEY BREAD! 
ENJOY!!!
Great service and great sushi. Always a fantastic experience here with friendly service and fresh sushi. Tried a bunch of AYCE and this is the best.

Just because I'm "white" doesn't mean I don't enjoy flavorful spices. Please don't skimp out on the sauces. I know what I'm ordering. 
Also, I was kind of offended that my chopsticks were wrapped with cheaters and no one else's were.

Stumbled upon this little gem by accident and I'm so glad that I did. Their food quality is amazing. service is great. The atmosphere is casual and welcoming. The fish itself is fresh and on point. I haven't even talked about the most amazing deal that any wallet loving individual has yet to see. The all you can eat sushi menu. There are few places far and wide who are able to offer their costumers an all you can eat menu without limiting the individuals to certain roles and quality. Not this place. you literally have the whole freaking menu at your will to devour without hesitation. COME WITH AN APPETITE. Time is your only enemy as this amazing deal has restrictions of 1 hour for lunch and 90 minutes for dinner. But that is more than enough time to eat 7-8 rolls each.

Everything was wonderful.  My only complaint is that I can no longer see my toes, but that's my fault for eating too much awesome food.

The service was amazing,  everyone was so nice and helpful.  I never saw the bottom of my hot tea. :)

Awesome food ... all you can eat with a great variety choices. 

Definitely a go to spot when in Las Vegas. Great family environment and experience. Service was great and quick ...

AYCE. Very slow.. I was the only customer and literally the each order came out past 7 to 9 minutes apart and I was already half full on 3rd order, usually I don't order many at a time cause I hate to waste food but this place, but if I have to go back, will order as many as I can in first order. 
The server was nice guy but forgot my , salmon roe roll, tuna roll.
The worst thing of last visit was uncooked pork cheese roll.
First time trying this place and it is my new favorite sushi spot in Vegas! It's delicious! Freshest fish I've had in awhile and the chefs are amazing!
All you can eat at a great price. Sat at the bar and had fantastic service, chefs were very fun and attentive. The sushi I had was better than many places with much higher prices highly recommend!
We have been to many sushi all you can eat sushi restaurant in the past, but this is the best one so far. Excellent service, sushi and desserts.

Dropped in based on previous Yelp reviews and was not disappointed!  Worked our way through Tuna, Salmon skin and JJ roll, also had the fried rice excellent! Jun and Monica are great hosts, we'll be back.

The owner is very friendly even after it being our second time he recognized us and thanked us for coming back. We went once and loved it the second time was just as wonderful. It's great to see someone so passionate about his place. He also make great sushi :)
Definitely recommend this place fresh fish great dishes really clean and friendly staff ..... Alaska roll is a must for me ..... Please visit sushi way and enjoy their sushi
The service is great and very fast. Hospitality is great and so is the food. The fish is not low grade. Food comes out in a reasonable time and is very delicious

The variety of rolls and appetizers are endless here. Waiter was pretty attentive even though it's busy. Sushi chef was very nice and polite; super plus! The rolls are amazing here. The spice was right, no need for soy sauce. Shrimp tempura was kind of rough; the batter taste like McDonald chicken nuggets. All and all it was a good experience.
Do yourself a favor and EAT HERE! They have so many unique and fresh options on their menu. My friend and I passed through on vacation and this will be our spot from now on!!!
Food was ok, we got several rolls and nothing was outstanding. Service was crappy, not a busy night and they still didn't serve our  refills. I would not come back again,

AYCE is the best here. Fish is super fresh. Service is amazing. Normally with all you can eat, you are limited to very few rice filled basic rolls, not here, you get to choose basically anything you want. The rolls are made with attention to detail with extremely fresh fish. Will be back for sure.

I'm not sure why this place has received such good reviews.  Frankly, my experience was underwhelming, to say the least.  The appetizers selection was fairly wide, though the few good items were limited to one order per person (like oysters, and random for a sushi restaurant, galbi).  Nigiri selection was overall decent, though the uni was suspect (had a weird dark mustard color and sure enough, tasted odd).  Overall, fish was OK, though the salmon belly did stand out. 

I'd be willing to come back here again, until I realized there are better and more affordable options (read: Goyemon Sushi, despite the always long wait).  Service was probably the deal breaker.  I basically had to stack all the empty plates to the edge of the table for someone to notice and come remove them/take new orders.  For an AYCE sushi place, there seemed to be a lot of resistance to our party ordering more food.  After our first initial order, we wanted more food, but was met with the waitress asking if we're gonna "finish all that food"?  Uh.. YEAH, we just barely started!  Another time we ordered, the waitress warned us that we have to eat all the rice that comes with the nigiri sushi.  She must have spotted the roll of rice that was left on my friend's plate.. the same one that dropped on the table beyond the five-second rule and she decided to not eat.  Thought that comment was unnecessarily passive aggressive.  Lastly, when it came time to dessert, it was only one order per person.  Good thing there were a few of us so we were able to each order different things and share.  

Funny "AYCE" place.

I came in with a party of 5 around 8pm on a Friday night and was helped immediately. The servers worked quickly to put a table together for all of us. We all got AYCE and ordered a shit ton on our first round and the server got everything down with ease and no mistakes were found when our orders came through. 

The place was fairly crowded but the three servers all worked together to get everything done quickly. I'm pretty sure I experienced the best customer service ever here so I'm very impressed. The three girls were very attentive to every customer and made sure we had no issues with anything. Whenever we asked for extras like more ginger etc. they promptly did so without showing irritation. I get that being a server isn't the best job out there, but as the millennial I am, I feel bad constantly asking serves to do their job lol and it was nice not to feel like a burden. I didn't have to ask for anything twice (god forbid) and they were all just sweethearts about everything. 

The atmosphere of the place itself was nice. It was fairly calm and not too big. It is a spacious but cozy place. Definitely a new go to spot for sushi in Vegas.

Excellent in every way. Close to work, which is great. Very quick, strong service (which is a huge exception to your average AYCE place). The sushi nachos are bomb. Only suggestion is more rolls with that tasty orgasm sauce!

The food is great. Some of the best a.y.c.e. I've had. Unfortunately this is not the place to go for lunch if you work at the offices at Howard Hughes as the service is very slow. They are no where near ready to handle a lunch crowd. If you have a lot of time it's delicious!

This place has Amazing sushi. Such a great variety. Everything tastes so fresh. Definitely get all you can eat. It is the best "bang for your buck". The staff was extremely helpful and super friendly. The absolute best service. Highly recommend this place. You must go.

My girlfriends & I yelped this place since we're from outta town & were craving some sushi. The food was amazing & the service was good too. The owner (a young woman I think?) even gave us ice cream. The only thing is when my friend & I ordered our bento boxes we didn't get the miso soup & when I asked about it the male server said I had to request it, & also my bento came with no salad. I thought that was a little odd since the menu said it came with it, but no biggie, then fish was fresh & rolls were amazing anyways! :)
Very good sushi the hostess was awesome! Eat here! AAA grade fish! Super awesome pricing I had the the eel and yellow tail 2 roll special it was delicious.

It very very rare I attempt to write a review, however this place is very clean nice atmosphere  very reasonably priced. They are kind an friendly they are also very attentive 

I decided on the all you can eat sushi the selection is crazy you will not be disappointed. Try the spicy tuna seaweed salad worth coming back for daily. 

A must visit while in Vegas

Mmmmmmmm it's ok !!
Decent sushi AYCE place

Service was ok !!
Appetizer was pretty good
Mini udon , baked green massless , shrimp tempra Etc........

Sushi was lil bit disappointed to me tho 
Cuz some of fish was still frozen ...
I'm Japanese so I can't really understand sushi chef serve frozen sushi to customer ok ??????? 

I've been trying to many AYCE sushi in Las Vegas ... I think I still like goyemon or sushi mon better ...

Excellent. Am not accustomed to AYCE sushi and I was a little skeptical. But everything I had was great. Sit at the sushi bar and the sushi chefs will take care of you. Service was friendly and very good. I had the Galbi and it was amazing. They will do half rolls for you if wish to try a variety and not get too stuffed too quickly. My only regret is that I didn't come here sooner. But I will be back for sure.

This restaurant feels good from the moment you walk in. The staff is wonderful, fast and friendly. The food is very well prepared and reasonably priced. The whole restaurant is immaculately clean and inviting. I highly recommend...
Service was great but the sushi was hit or miss. The Big Easy was awesome, but the Viva Las Vegas looked much better than it actually tasted
Don't miss this if you love sushi. It has to be the best sushi value in Vegas. Great service and terrific food.

Highest quality fish & seafood out of any Vegas AYCE Sushi joints I've been to, including yama, sakana, twister, goyemon, and kaya. Super fast service. The Salmon Tare Tare is delicious. Sushi Nacho is killer. All nigiri is of the highest quality/freshness. Large selection of flavored japanese sake and beer. Order the "sake cooler." Also has great lunch specials if you are on the go. New favorite sushi place.
Free wifi. Don't forget to ask for a stamp card!!
Simply amazing! If you love sushi come here they treat you great and have AMAZING food hands down favorite place I've been to.

Absolutely amazing place. We actually originally showed up to a neighboring Japanese restaurant but left due to the odd smell and unfriendly guests and employees. We wandered into Sushi Way randomlly and man were we impressed. The fish quality was fantastic! Thick slices of fish. GREAT price with the all you can eat. Me and my girlfriend must have sat there and ate for 6 people. The host/Server was very nice and our sushi bar man Juno was so nice. Gave us his full attention, recommending dishes, making them promptly. We had some great food and will be coming back next time we're in town.

Some of the best sushi I've ever had! The All You Can Eat menu is a rediculiously good value because it includes the entire menu. I ate about $50 worth of food for $26. The chefs really know what they are doing and you can tell that they love their jobs. Extremely fast service too. It was moderately busy the night we went. We got our rolls in less than 5 minutes each time we ordered. I HIGHLY recommend this place if you are out in Vegas. It is on par with the high end sushi restaurants out here.
Very accommodating that we were in a hurry. Food came out super fast and it was all very fresh and delicious! Highly recommended.

Thrilled we tried this place before we left Vegas. We come in often for conventions and will be back for sure. The fish is fresh, beautiful and tasty. Place is clean, including bathroom.

We sat down around 5:20 p.m. and service was lacking with only one waiter. 20 minutes in and more staff showed up and service became good.

Will be back!!

I am such a sushi snob and when I saw the all you can eat sign thinking there was no way it could meet my standards. Boy was I wrong! WE ATE SO MUCH!! Great food, great service, the tap water is even really good!  So happy we stuck around!!

provavelmente o melhor rodízio de sushi que já fui aqui na Califórnia. tudo muito fresquinho e sem arroz demais - e o arroz é soltinho e no ponto!! não tem sashimi mas os niguiris são pequenos e matam a vontade! os rolls são muito bem feitos!!

Called Saturday afternoon to make a reservation. The lady on the phone asked me how many people and what time. She then asked me to hold for a second after I answered her. I felt odd because she was one question away to complete my reservation (my name) but anyway. I eventually hanged up after 6 minutes of hold. I waited for 15 minutes to call again. Again, I was asked how many and what time and "hold a second". I was like again?? wth??!! Good that a second lady came to the phone and took my reservation this time.

Our waiter was nice enough but they are definitely short staffed. There were only 2 waitstaff on a Saturday night. We had hard times getting help for anything.

The food. It's not super bad per se as none of us got sick after. But for sure it's not 4 1/2 stars worth. The rice are a bit dry. The fish tasted obviously frozen and thawed. The rolls were lack of flavor. They are all so bland even with different sauces. One of the rolls we had was called "Burn your Ass" of something like that. It wasn't even spicy at all. 

I had hot tea to start with. Since the service was so slow and I never got my tea refilled, I decided to order a soda. When the bill came, I was shocked to find out they charge $2.50 for hot tea. Mind you it's only some generic luke warm green tea. Well, the soda was also $2.50 which I expected. But generic green tea, which they were too busy to refill, for $2.50?? 

I suspected most of the good reviews are from out of towners. Most of the cities in the US do not have as many AYCE sushi restaurants as Vegas. With 90% of the sushi restaurants in Vegas are AYCE, we are spoiled and picky. I'll stick with my favorite Sushi Neko from now on.

Sushi Way is an amazing sushi bar/restaurant.  The sushi is fresh with daily specials.  The service is excellent and the staff are friendly which makes you feel like part of the restaurants family. The Cherry Blossom is the ultimate!!!!

I just ate there tonight and the other positive reviews are on target.  I dont' give out 5 star reviews often but this place deserves it.  This is not like other All you can Eat Sushi places where they give you lots of rice and small pieces of fish.  Each dish is prepared with a noticeable attention to detail that is normally reserved for high-end Sushi Bars.  I opted for Chef's Choice tonight and i was not dissaponted.  The Chef brought me some very good Sushi dishes that I would never have thought of ordering on my own.  Some of the other reviews have complained about slow service.  I can see where some impatient people would say that but remember this is not a buffet and it is not fast food.  Quality and attentions to detail does take a little longer.  So relax, enjoy the company you came with and enjoy some excellent Sushi.  I will be back and I will be bringing firends.
Great sushi. Quick service. All you can eat is good price with quality sushi.  Location is close to strip but off strip so not as busy!
Aaaaaamazing! I'm a Vegas local and this is the spot good prices great sushi awesome staff!!!

In Las Vegas on a business trip and wanted GOOD sushi at a fair price. After my coworkers and I talked about it, we decided to try Sushi Way. In a nutshell, we weren't dissapointed. The sushi was made to order and the selection was broad. If you had something you wanted that wasn't on the menu, they will make it for you. Also included was a nice selection of hot items like tempura. All you can eat for $27 or the price of 2 rolls. Enjoy!

Best sushi I had in my life. I'm from Jersey but this place makes want to come back to vegas just to eat this place again. Exceeded all my expectations. Interior is not like wow but the food is unreal. Combinations of ingredients send your taste buds into cloud nine. I can't believe this place could get anything other than a five.

As soon as I walked, in my excitement for this place grew and grew! All you can eat: challenge accepted. Their menu was endless and their service was excellent. A great place to try new types of sushi. 

Update: 2 years later and I still love it.

Came here last night (Wednesday) for the All You Can Eat (AYCE) offering. It was $26.99/person. 

Service was very good. They were attentive and took my order quickly. There were minor mistakes (salmon hand roll wasn't placed the first time and they split up the check wrong but both were corrected quickly). 

The oysters, galbi, seared tuna slices, uni nigiri, and sweet shrimp nigiri are only allowed 1 order per person which was ok due to price.

Oysters were decent (fresh enough, flavor good) but considering place and price, I'll say it's very good when it comes to bang for buck. 

Uni and sweet shrimp was excellent in freshness and flavor. 

Galbi was a lil over cooked (I like my beef bloody) for my taste but still very good. 

The seared tuna slices was called Mouth Orgasm. I find it ok. Flavor was fair. Found the sear good enough. 

Nigiri: Salmon roe wasn't good. The roe was a bit dehydrated. The yellowtail was good. Garlic yellowtail was delicious. Perfect balance of garlic and fish. Seared salmon was good but not mind blowing. The eel was excellent. Perfect sauce, eel, and rice balance. Halibut was ok. It was a lil tough for nigiri. Surf clam was very good, fresh and not tough. The fresh scallop was good. The mackerel itself was very good but unfortunately drenched in way too much vinegar that made it too sour and the rice was about to fall apart. 

Rolls: I didn't have the one roll but I had a piece of the soft shell crab roll. That one was very good. 

Handroll: Salmon skin was good but not my thing. I'm used to a lightly floured and fried savory salmon skin, really crispy in a handroll. This one was only slightly crispy drenched in some sweet, soy based sauce. The flavor was ok but I didn't like the sauce completely drenching the seaweed, making it soggy. If they didn't put so much sauce, I think I'd like it so much more and I'd highly recommend. 

Seaweed salad: Would've been very good if the vinegar base sauce wasn't so sour. Need to not put so much sauce on things!

Tempura ice cream: I really enjoyed it as the fried batter was decently light. The ice cream was average. Overall, was too sweet for my taste but I still loved it. 

Overall, I took away a star due to them putting way too much sauce on vinegar based pieces that made it hard to eat. From a bang for buck perspective, this place is definitely a 5 Star. Most things were fresh and for a AYCE, the fish quality was really good. It's expected that they don't use Japanese sushi rice with mirin. I've gone to numerous AYCE Japanese buffets in Hong Kong and US. This one has pretty good bang for buck ratio.

AYCE sushi sounds a little sketchy. But this place is every bit as good as typical sushi restaurants. I thought the sushi might be pre-made, but it's to order. There were a couple of rolls I ordered that came with crab but it was more of a crab 'salad' - I was a bit surprised but it was still very good. The wait can be a little long after you put in your order, but that's not atypical when you're eating sushi.

What would have been a 5 star review - if based on food and value - became a 4 star because of the service inaccuracy. We ordered twice and both times the server forgot to put in one of our rolls with the kitchen.
This place is great!! Super quality sushi with awesome variety. I will definitely come back when in town. Awesome environment and friendly staff as well.

The food was kind of good...But the service was very very bad...There were seats there, but the server just asked us to wait. After like twenty minutes we finally got seated, but no server came to ask for an order and didn't even bring water to us until we asked some guy 10 minutes later...When we asked an Asian server for the dishwares(yes they just gave us two sets, we have five guys), he just said what's up and ignored that...So rude...

Back again. You can't beat the quality of the fish, the customer service, and of course, the price.  Let's start with price. $26.95 for AYCE. Based on our sushi palate, if we were ordering a la carte, we would've passed the $30 mark like, 5 rolls ago. The beer/wine/sake selection is limited, but priced ridiculously low and the selections they have are the ones they SHOULD have for a sushi joint. Next is food quality. We ordered all the good nigiri and a few specialty rolls. Without exception, the fish was amazingly fresh, and the pieces were huge!  If you've never had the Poke Tuna Salad, order it!!!  Awesome!   
Finally, the service. We say at the sushi bar. It is the only way to fly--especially for a twosome. With the AYCE option, the sushi chefs take care of you throughout your meal, except for drinks and non-sushi items (why waste your time?).  A huge shout-out to Chef Robin, who took outstanding care of us, and was a joy to watch as he churned out every different item on the sushi menu. A true artist, and very attentive and entertaining, as well!  A+ experience!
Don't go here.  It's my secret.  The sushi is always fresh and delicious.  The all-you-can-eat deal is a steal.  Stay away.  I don't want you to come eat it all!  :)

We now have our Las Vegas Sushi place. Not too busy on a Thursday night so we had Great service. My wife and I went with the AYCE and everything we had was good with several items becoming instant favorites like "Red Boy", "Oh Jenna", "Sushi Solution" and "Dancing Eel" rolls. We also really liked their "Alaska", "I Love Sushi" rolls. They also have specials that should not be missed if the have it. Specifically the "Salmon Belly" and the not to be missed "Boom Boom Special" (a mouthful of taste explosion followed with a slow burn).

All of the fish appeared to be fresh and was tasty. The staff was helpful and made some great suggestions.

The next time we come back to Vegas we will definitely reserve a time to eat the Sushi Way.

Fantastic place. First time here. My family and I will be back here without a doubt.  Sushi chef was friendly, FAST, and funny. All you can eat is the way to go- options are beyond any other all you can eat sushi menu.  For some reason our daughters teriyaki chicken took a while to come out, but don't let that stop you from trying this place.

Came here on Saturday on my very last night in Vegas. My girlfriend and I enjoyed the food they provided for us. Our food did take awhile to get to us but we were compensated with a bottle of sake and halibut. Would definitely come back here again.

Absolutely the best sushi in Vegas. Support the small restaurant not the casino! Everyone here has shown genuine passion for the food they served me. This is without a doubt my favorite place I've eaten in this city.
Was super disappointed, nothing tasted right or fresh. All the staff was super nice tho.
Jun the owner has developed some unique rolls. I've been here 3 times now and it is a must for me every time I'm in Vegas. The all you can eat is a fantastic deal!

Cool laid back environment, really chill music. The sushi masters are friendly and nice! The food!!!! Omg the fish is fresh and delicious, I ordered a sexy lazy roll and it was like the best that ever touched my lips. The nigiri is delicious and the sushi nacho was so unique and married sweet and spicy flavors really well.  

Our server was attentive and funny and she gave good suggestions. I normally go to kaya because I get off at work at midnight and it's hard to find late night sushi places. I'm so happy we tried this place out, we're definitely coming back!!
Don't be deceived by the AYCE sushi thing.  This place is the real deal!   Every roll I tried was excellent.
Food was really good. Specially the spicy rice! And the all you can eat dinner buffet was more than worth it. Servers were great and very attentive to ensuring we were taken care of. Two thumbs up!

Awesome place in Vegas. This sushi restaurant is just opened few weeks ago. I like the atmosphere of the restaurant. The sushi chef and P.K are so nice. Definitely, their fish was fresh and excellent. I love their seared super white tuna sashimi. I should go again soon.

Some of the best sushi I've had - and it's all you can eat - unbelievable!

Highly recommend sitting at the bar where you can keep the orders flowing directly with the sushi chef for the all you can eat ...

I work at a sushi restaurant in California, I was extremely disappointed in the food. I was already expecting it to be pretty bad because it is AYCE, but this was un expectable. The octopus was not fresh or anything near it! When I told them it was bad and I couldn't eat it, they told me it's probably too fresh for me. That is not what it is, I eat sushi every other day because I love sushi and that's why I work in the field. Plus if fish was so fresh why would it be AYCE, it would not. Not to mention there was 3 servers that day with 4 tables and they were so slow, when I asked them about it they said it was super busy earlier. But what about now, we still need things. Over all I recommend going somewhere else for sushi, I felt sick afterwards, all my friends did. Let me save you and your stomach, don't go!

Super convenient to have our food delivered to our hotel room. My sushi was delicious. The only downside was the hour long wait time and the hard, inedible avocado that was on the top of sushi. It seemed almost fake.

I went here with my boyfriend also guided by the good reviews . 
I don't know how it works in USA But i think that possible ingredients causing allergy should be written on the menu. 
I read on menu salmon tartare, that it should be simple salmon cut in small pieces. Instead, I received salmon on avocado and Cramp. 
As I realized there was cramp, I had already eaten a bit because it resembled rice .
So I had to immediately take a pill of my medicine to prevent an allergic attack .
If you really want to have lunch in this restaurant, be prepared to unpredictable surprise .
Very delicious!!!  Highly recommended. Fresh fish. Will definitely come back again :)

Awesome! I love this place and their food! I ordered from their all-u-can-eat sushi and I will definitely return! Jane was my waitress, she says that she is new but by far she was professional, fun and was able to discuss their menu in detail. I would recommend going Wednesday thru Sunday because the 2 Itamae (sushi chef) that prepared my food and conversation do not work Mon or Tues.

Wow! Incredible sushi!! I don't usually eat AYCE but this place was on good recommendation. They were totally accommodating to my no rice rule. They have cucumber wrapped rolls and a $24 sashimi plate that I could not finish! I highly recommend it.

First of all, they use way too much rice on their nigiris and rolls... They don't play around when trying to get everyone full off the rice so you order less... The rice on the nigiris are the same size as the fish, plus the fish cuts are small, you taste more rice than fish... I also ordered some half rolls and the rice on their rolls was as thick as the rice on the sushi rolls at Smith's... The rolls were sloppy lookin like they didn't care how they came out, and it wasn't even busy... Took forever to get my nigiris, and there was only three tables and two couples at the bar... It took forever to get my last two rolls before last call and by that time there was only one table and one couple at the bar... The service was slow, the sushi chefs were slow... Won't be coming back here again..
High quality all you can eat. Fresh fish tuna salmon yellow I love it and I will come back again for sure
After trying this place for the first time a couple of months back, I refused to eat sushi anywhere else in Las Vegas !!! JUNE is thee best!!
First time here and I am very impressed.  Everything is very good . Highly recommend. Customer service was amazing. Food fresh and delicious.

Came to this little place late night in Vegas. The people were so friendly and the food was so delicious. I am a HUGE fan of sushi. These guys have it down. Fresh and delicious. Thanks for making my stay in Vegas memorable.

New place just opened up a couple weeks ago. Closest sushi place near my office. Really happy that the sushi is good quality. 

The Sex Bomb roll was delicious. 

I will be assembling my crew and returning very soon. :)

Stopped by before heading back to Cali.... small cute place, it wasn't packed when we arrived for lunch so I was very surprised it took forever to get our food. 
The rolls were ok, average size. We tried a good selection from the menu for the AYCE but nothing "wow" that stood out. The fried FAT ASS rolls were too fried, hard as a rock. 
The only thing I didn't like was the service was s-l-o-w.... like unbelievably slow, the servers were nice but can't understand why it took so long for our rolls to be made. We waited over 10mins for the sushi nigiri. 
When we come back to Vegas again, we'll probably find another sushi place to check out.
First time here. Fresh fish and great service. Definitely coming back again and again!!!

I am not one to go to an AYCE sushi restaurant but did based on the reviews. I was not disappointed! Service, presentation,  freshness, taste, all GREAT. I can't explain any negative comments from other reviews. They had a generous selection and all was made to order. One limitation was you had 90 minutes to eat but I don't see that being an issue for anyone. Next time I am in town I'll be back.

Great service, great food! All you can eat sushi is very reasonably priced at 21.95 before 3PM, and with over ONE HUNDRED items on the AYCE menu, this place is a steal. Fresh fish, good rice, and everything else you might need to fill your sushi craving!

Well like most a bit leery of AYCE sushi place, as I too am a sushi snob.  Bottom line the food was REALLY good and the service was just great.  We went at 3:30 and were the only ones in the place.  I could see that  if it were packed the servers and chefs may have a hard time keeping up, so order what you think you can eat at your first ordering.  Eat it all and then sit back and ask yourself ' do I really need that 4th roll' 

The menu is mostly rolls, but they were really good.  

Enjoy

For a $21.95 all you can eat lunch, I think you can't beat it.  There's only a few things you can't order on the menu but everything else is fair game and they have a pretty good sized menu.  Had tuna, yellowtail, unagi and octopus sushi, all good and what seemed to be pretty fresh fish.  Also had a few rolls along with some miso soup and edamame, all were good.  We were stuffed when we left and the bill was under $50.  Dinner AYCE is $26.95 if I remember correctly and you do only have one hour but we would have spent probably three times what we did if that was a strip hotel sushi joint. Have to remember this place for when I'm working at the convention center, just down the road (in a strip mall across from the Hughes center, next to the old Firefly location).

The sushi was very fresh! I did the dinner all you can eat and by the time i was done, i was filled to the top!!!  The chef allows you to order any item on the menu. It was definitely worth the price.

Note worthy with our first time at Sushi way though is that I liked the coconut shrimp tempura, fat ass, hamachi Kama, and honey bread dessert, basically a mini version of honey toast since thats new and un common for a dessert with sushi places. 

Been to at least 5 other AYCE sushi place here in vegas and I would say Sushi way is 2nd to last... but don't get me wrong they are pretty okay though. 

I'd rate the Food a 3.5 for the reason of they seem to be drowning with sauce and I did try and request for light sauce and still saucy for my preference but the customer service was great. For that Its 4star for me.

Wow I love this place! Great fish and rice. The service and music is the best. This sushi hits a new level especially when it comes to all you eat. Highly recommend to sushi lovers. You gotta try this place you won't regret it.

I love sushi, but I hate all you can eat sushi... usually if I walk in and all you can eat is an option I just leave. Typical all you can eat sushi packs the rice and adds slivers of low quality fish. I was really craving sushi and was staying at a hotel next door for work so I chose to stay and am beyond happy that I did.  Sushi Way is an all you can eat like I've never seen. Unique rolls packed with outstanding fish, thick cuts of tuna layering the tops of rolls. To say I was surprised is an understatement.  The fire sauce on the Kiss of fire roll was  perfectly blazing and what ever it is made of is outstandingly tasty.  The sushi chefs are friendly and talkative while even working hard and the owner/manager walked the tables to make sure everything was the way it should be. This place is leaps and bounds above yama sushi. It will not disappoint!
Really good sushi  very polite outstanding customer service definitely recommend it all you can eat

Wow some of the  Where service I've ever gotten before in my life. Its own by a husband a wife that seem to not care about anything at all. W get much better sushi, anywhere else, forget the strength you definitely definitely definitely find something really good right around the corner with better service. Sushi was good don't get me wrong but overall experience no Bueno.

Fantastic place! The fish is first rate. Particularly enjoyed the amebi, hamachi, and the albacore. Nigiri is nicely made with just the right amount of rice, ie, not too much. The ability to order half rolls is perfect for being able to try different combinations without filling up too quickly. Will definitely return here on my next trip to LV!

Wonderful place! Very fresh fish, innovative dishes and a very friendly staff. I will come back here every time I'm in town.

Amazing. We were the only ones at the bar and our chef gave us his full attention offering us recipes that were off the menu and specific to our liking. Atmosphere was a tad "off"...at one point Eminems hit "Superman" was on...in a fancy sushi restaurant. 

Overall amazing and would recommend it to anyone that loves genuine, fresh sushi!

It was a great experience! It's not easy to find a good sushi place. Sushi way is my favorite place because the sushi  tastes really good, location is perfect, nice atmosphere, friendly staff and reasonable price.

The sushi here is amazing.  They have fresh fish and great service. I mean you can get good sushi anywhere, but I think it's the friendly staff that makes this place great.
   The portions are perfect and the presentation is great. Their AYCE price is pretty much the same as everywhere else. Their quality is great. It's not a huge place but it's nice and can accommodate big groups. I personally love the sushi bar. I like being one on one with the Chefs. 
   Our server was on point and so was Ivan, our sushi chef. He was easy to talk to and very personable.  He made us some amazing rolls. He asked us what we liked and made us some off the menu rolls that were incredible.  Everything tasted great, I highly recommended you stop by andgive it a try.

****The super white tuna was my favorite. It just melts in your mouth (not in your hands).
It's been my fifth times here already and we also tried Umiya sushi place and with no doubt Sushi way is much much better. Will come back later soon.

The food was amazing ! It took a little long to come out. But it was worth the wait. The California dream roll was definitely my favorite especially if you add cream cheese , yummy ! I love the selection and the prices aren't bad at all for how delicious the sushi is ! I suggest this to everyone !

Luckily we found this gem next to our hotel room. All you can eat sushi for $21. The sushi was delicious. The sushi nachos is a must try. It's pretty much poke on a tostada. Our drinks stayed full while we were there. As soon as the waitress saw we were running low she filled us right up. Great atmosphere and great food. If I'm ever in vegas again i will be coming here for sure!!
Amazing rolls for AYCE sushi.  Very wide variety of any rolls you can imagine.  Along with fast and friendly service!  If you leave this place hungry you are doing it wrong.

Memorial Weekend Friday dinner.  I myself am not a diehard sushi person, but if you are, then this might be your place.  Don't get me wrong, I was hungry, and I was craving, but I just didn't expect myself to get so full that I almost felt sick.  My goal was to have at least  5 different orders, but by number 4, I was done.  

Variety, taste, waiting time, value for your $ - A.

Service - B.

Location - A

So if you're avoiding the craziness, busy-ness and trafficness of the strip, then this little food strip mall is a good choice. 

TIP -  if you're gonna do AYCE (because you can also place individual orders) then be VERY hungry and in the mood and you'll be very satisfied.

This was an awesome all you can eat and Jane (with the bangin rose tattoo on her forearm) was really great and fun! Service was fast and we loved the atmosphere! Sushi is awesome and SO much to choose from!
Definitely recommend especially if you want a really good all you can eat!!

Best urchin I have had in a very very long time. They keep the urchin very fresh well protected as its only one order per person, you will be hooked, so be prepared. My date rule is if a sushi bar has urchin and place an order if your date likes it or at least tries it, he/she is a keeper in my rulebook...

Service was execellent, sat @ the bar, little less conversation and more action from the sushi chefs, Elvis was there...

(Review based on 2.5 stars)

Sushi Way is located in the same plaza as Tacos & Beer (right next to it actually) with parking. My husband and I decided to try this place on our last night in Las Vegas, for dinner. We came in for an early dinner around 5:30 pm. When we first came in, no one greeted us. A server walking around saw us but did not greet us. We were just standing around and decided to just seat ourselves at the bar. 

As we sat there, we just waited. Eventually my husband asked the guy behind the bar (Mike) if he could take our order. He said he can only take sushi orders but not for the kitchen. I just kind of thought he would assume that we were here for the all you can eat option (pretty much as everyone else when they come in here...). My husband asked if he would take our order after he said that... 

Anyways, during the course of our meal, service was initially average and lacking. But eventually 2 other servers came out and took care of patrons, including ourselves. I appreciate their attentiveness. Also eventually that guy, Mike, left to do inventory and this other guy came and he took care of us. 

Everything we had was good, except for the uni. It was not fresh and had that fishy smell. You do not want your seafood to have that smell, if it does, it indicates it isn't fresh. 

If service was better, I would award this place higher, but because of the lack of service in the beginning and a little after, I have no choice but to give this place 2.5 stars.

If you like being ignored and not being acknowledged, come by here for sushi. And then when you are done eat somewhere else. Being that this is Sin City, the land of buffets and gluttony, I am sure there is a better place to eat at.

By the way, for 2 people for dinner (all you can eat option), it will cost you $58.35 (tax included).

Hidden is a little strip mall off of Paradise and Flamingo, the food is quite good, cooked fresh upon arrival.  They even know how to make teriyaki chicken correctly.  Their sashimi was just so so, but the tempura was very good.  Service is fast and friendly.
I've been to 100s of sushi places and Sushi Way is among the best. Clean, friendly and a terrific value.

Food is decent but service is very very slow. We ordered items and never got them. Some can out 30 minutes later. Some didn't come out at all. When we asked about them the waiter totally had forgotten about them. She kept saying I'm sorry and blaming the cooks. Sad thing about it is the place isn't really busy. As I sit hear typing this review I am still waiting on my order. Waiter came by and ask if I want ice cream yet I haven't gotten my prior order of shrimp tempura ordered 15 minutes ago. What a joke. Never again. Don't come here if your hungry because that's how you will leave. Slow and poor service.

I had high expectations for an ayce sushi restaurant with ratings as high as Sushi Way. Unfortunately, the service was extremely slow during our visit which was disappointing. 

Objectively speaking, the food was great! The fish was really fresh and they carried a lot of unique options I haven't had at other places (like garlic hamachi). The uni/amaebi (one serving per customer) are a must! 

Our experience was sub par due to the service that we experienced during dinner. The management should try to staff the restaurant accordingly every night. For a Friday night, you would expect more than 2 sushi chefs to accommodate customers, but the lack of staff resulted in a 40-45 minute wait for our first order of food. The server was courteous enough to provide 2 complimentary bottles of sake, but it wasn't enough to make up for the lack of service. Shout-out to the staff for working hard to make up for their inadequate management. 

Food Quality: 4/5

Atmosphere: 4/5

Service: 1/5 (Will give the benefit of the doubt that it's not always like this, but for our particular experience, the service was terrible.)

Overall: 2/5

Chef Specials:
Super white tuna sashimi w/ jalapeño - fish was fresh and the mixture of sauce and jalapeño was good. It wasn't salty at all.
Wasabi tobiko - I actually liked it. Tasted fresh and different than most things I eat at sushi spots.

Appetizers:
Screaming Orgasm - This was ok. The fish was different than say sushimon.
Fresh oyster - it was fresh and good
Coconut shrimp tempura - I loved it.  It was flavorful :)

Rolls:
I love my ass - good
Snow White - good
Jack Rabbit - good

Nigiri:
Salmon Roe - average. Same quality you would find in most restaraunts at their level
Garlic Tuna - it was fresh. Didn't really care for the salt or spice they out on top of it.
Salmon - kinda tasted like Scottish salmon. It melted in my mouth! 
Yellowtail - it was average
Fresh scallop - it was average
Sweet shrimp - it was average

The tempura ice cream was the same like you would get at most spots.

My son said the honey bread was ok.

Will I come back? Maybe. This is out of the way for me because I live near Mountains Edge. There's other spots around the area that I can eat at. 

The service was ok. Felt like they could've done better. I did receive excellent service from Jay. The lady that waited are table first didn't talk too much but she was nice enough to give my baby girl a lollipop to stop her from crying.

Ate here for dinner two nights ago, Not a bad all you can eat sushi place, seriously service was ok... The sushi items was good, the kitchen items hot foods was pretty good aswell... Would come back if I was in the area.

Just stumbled upon this place when we were craving for ayce sushi! Food is fresh, service is fast. I just wished it wasnt as dim but hey thats the only complaint for me. Definitely a spot ill add to my must eats in vegas!
Kudos to chefs! The baked mussels,bacon wrapped scallops,Who's yo daddy roll,Viva Las Vegas roll and sexy Richard was on point like always. Don't forget the warm sake

OK so first of all, the sushi here is delicious! I had the sexy lazy special and my boyfriend had the Chicago fire roll (I think that's what it was called). I would definitely recommend those rolls. The customer service however was bad! Our waitress looked unhappy the entire time we were there. She didn't bother to refill our cups. The sushi chefs also seemed unprofessional by flirting with customers. I would return but I hope management takes a look at their staff.

I was amazed by how fresh and delicious this AYCE was! The fish was amazing, the rolls tasty and there were plenty of no-rice dishes for people counting carbs. I highly recommend our server Richard and the Rock n Roll and Screaming Orgasm!

Yes I agree with the other yelpers... well worth it if you do the AYCE, but we opted for the bento boxes, which were complete with the usual meat, sushi + tempura. Service was great, maybe because we were the only few there on a Friday night, wait, did I just say that? Open til 2am, so we barely made it before the crowd started pouring in. Still fairly new, so hopefully their quality stays the same once the word gets out =P

This place is pretty legit for AYCE! They don't fill you up with a lot of rice in their rolls, and the ingredients are fresh.  The food comes out pretty fast, too! Most importantly, there wasn't any wait when we came on a Saturday night. 

Between the four of us, we got Arizona, I Love Sushi, Rock & Roll, Candy Cane, Baked Salmon Roll, Crispy Rice (with spicy tuna on top), Golden Philly, Fat Ass, crunch roll, yellowtail nigiri, sea urchin nigiri, albacore tuna nigiri, fresh oysters, miso soup, seaweed salad, and multiple orders of Screaming Orgasm. 

We were soooo full after all the food but somehow they just kept coming!!

The service is friendly and they come around to check on you every now and then. It is a little far off the strip, so be prepared to walk (which is probably a good thing for before AND after you stuff your face silly with sushi). 

Time for a post sushi nap...

Big surprise here... new restaurant for my news crew on our most recent Las Vegas trip and we went in expecting an 'OK' meal for an AYCE sushi experience and came away impressed, stuffed, and looking forward to our next visit. VERY good and friendly service, REALLY good sushi, along with a variety of interesting non-sushi choices and an overall high-value experience. I never give five stars on a single experience... but this was visit was tempting... looking forward to seeing how this place holds up in future visits.
Great place to get Sushi. I come here since it's close to the strip. Server seems okay, mainly trying to get this free soda for posting a review.

My husband and I had AYCE option and the food wasn't bad nor good. The Food was kinda bland to me, especially those with garlic or ponzu sauce has no flavors. It needs a little kick to it. They do have big portions of fish on the nigiri though and cooked items are not bad either.  On the other hand, the service wasn't quite there, they need more uplifting spirited ppl working there. Waiters was kinda ehhh....its not good for a start up business and the layout or lighting was not welcoming, it felt cold but hope all is well for this business . Oh lastly , they said fresh oysters on the menu wasn't fresh at all... It smelled like rotten seafood that my husband couldn't eat it so I had to eat it all and the consequences wasn't good.... :(  will I return? Maybe in the future to see if any improvements on food and place.
The sushi place to go to. Close to the strip. $26.95 for all you can eat sushi. What is not to love? Will definitely be coming back every time I come to Vegas.

Good AYCE menu but the service was even greater. Despite me trying to practice restraint, the proprietress kept asking me if I wanted to order more. I left Sushi Way following a very satisfying lunch. 

Came for lunch and opted for the AYCE option which was around $22. It wasn't crowded during my hour or so here which meant I got my orders to me really quickly. Order a whole bunch of things but what stood out included the sashimi salad, the rock n roll cucumber roll, and the seared salmon nigiri. Overall the nigiri and rolls were pretty fresh and generous with the seafood. The sushi tacos were interesting but perhaps a bit too tart. 

I think the spread is better at Sakana but the service here is more personable - everyone was absolutely lovely from the mom-like hospitality of the proprietress to the enthusiasm of the young chef behind the counter. Really enjoyed lunch here.
Good food, decent price. I just ordered an entree but the all you can eat for $25 isn't a bad idea if your hungry enough.
I'm pretty picky when I eat out but this place really hits the spot. They just opened not long ago and their food and service is very good. I'm definitely coming back! Thanks chef! Thanks sushi way!

My experience tonight bothered me enough to write my first Yelp review. I eat here regularly, the food quality is decent and the pricing is  reasonably cheap. The service is always quite mediocre (never rude, just slow and inattentive) but is excused due to value.

Tonight, I placed a phone order for pick up, was told to it would be a 30 minute wait. I informed them I was in a rush and it was apparently noted. I arrived 35 minutes later and they said "no problem" took my money and said the food would be right out. 10 minutes later, the food was nowhere to be seen. I asked again and was told they were just putting the food in a bag. 5 minutes later they informed me they hadn't even made my order. I asked for my money back and left hungry.
Great selection. Exceptional service. Near the strip. One of the best AYCE sushi spots in Vegas.

All you can eat sushi... Viva La Vegasssssssss!

I've also tried Sushi Mon as well but this tops everything by far. We arrived and they have a lot to park in and waited about 45 minutes? They also take reservations by the way.

We have a group of 9 and our server Jane was so wonderful and accomating to us even for a big group and an indesivie family... our server was great! 

Wr ordered so much food I can hardly remember what I ordered, I remember my favorites that were the sushi nachos, and the seared salmon.

I basically loved everything here including the green tea honey bread!
So yummy!! All you can eat dinner is a must. Bring a jacket, it's a little chilly inside
Great food. Lots of options. Open late. And a friendly staff, I wish they had quail eggs for massago but other then that they are great
Very friendly and great selection! Was not overly busy, the seating was comfortable, and it was not far from the strip. I definitely recommend this place
Always amazing food and service! Uni is fresh and the super white tuna is refreshing... always a must when in Vegas!

Lisa hand roll was Excellent! 
Great service. AYCE on a Saturday at 1130. 

Highly recommended. Fish quality was excellent
Very disappointing.  Sushi rice fell apart on the nigiri.  Nigiri fish was small and low quality.  Every roll we picked had a sauce and none of them were good.

This is the best Sushi AYCE I have found in the Las Vegas strip area. The selection of sushi is epic for an AYCE place. Every type I had was well made and very tasty. The service was great also. Place is nice inside, easy to find and very clean.
Great sushi restaurant off the strip. Prices are reasonable. I will return next time I visit Vegas.

Away from the strip food. Only $12 cab from Mirage. Super fresh and All U Can Eat for $26. Over 50 rolls. Sexy Lady (coconut fried shrimp roll) was good and different. Super White Tuna with Jalapeño freaking rocked.

The worst service ever! Took 10 just to get a drink order. Never had menus we had to grab them ourselves. One waitress at peak lunch time. Orders weren't right. I'm always down to give a second chance to a place.

This is the BEST sushi I have ever eaten!

The spider roll is amazing, the salmon killer, the James Bond, the crispy rice with tuna.....all legit and amazing!

And for lunch, it's all you can eat for $21.95.  You can't beat this place!!!!

I'll be back next time I'm in Las Vegas!!!!

After comparing other ayce sushi places to Doh's, this is my new favorite place.  Came here for lunch at about 12:15 on a Wednesday.  Only one sushi chef and several tables were occupied, so the wait for  your order was a few minutes.  Once the 2nd sushi chef arrived, everything went a lot faster.  Our waitress was very attentive and courteous.

Nigiri sushi tasted very fresh.  Cuts of fish were pretty big, while the rice was kept to a minimum.  

We had a desert called honey bread, using Hawaiian sweet bread dinner rolls.  Shokudo in Hawaii uses something like Texas toast.  Similar in taste, just not quite as big.

Usually I walk out of an ayce sushi place feeling full and uncomfortable.  This time I felt satisfied and just right.  Very comfortable atmosphere.

Definitely will be back for my sushi cravings!

With multiple sushi joints popping up in Vegas, how does one stay ahead of the pack? Well, there's a no brainer here! Quality and Service are on top of my list of what I look for.

I didn't stumble onto Sushi Way. It was under "hot and new" so I gave it a shot! I always prefer to be seated at the bar, so I can interact with the chef. It's also very entertaining to watch them prepare my meal.
And wow! I was very impressed by the temperature of the sushi and the fish to rice ratio was excellent.

I was even more impressed that the chef kept making items that were off menu! I was game for anything! 
I love that this place doesn't use a lot of cream cheese in their sushi as fillers! If I want to eat cream cheese, I have lots in my fridge! LOL

Having an option for sushi half rolls is another reason I consider when dining in and I'm glad this place offers that! Some places only do half rolls on your last order. Then there's the awesome staff at Sushi Way. Where they treat you in an AWESOME way!

Love this place. Service good. Quality sushi and rolls. Best of all it's pretty close to the strip without strip prices. The must try is the tuna poki salad. It's light and refreshing! We came for lunch which is from 11:30 - 4pm at $21.95. Dinner is from 4pm - 2am at $26.95.
We're in town from Los Angeles, and I have to say, this is by far the best quality sushi for all you can eat I've ever had.

I really LOVE this place!! I usually go to Yama (I've been loyal to Yama for 11 years) but that place has seriously outgrown that spot (waiting for a seat at lunch at 2pm on a Monday ....just me....seriously?). As a result I decided to give SUSHI WAY a shot. It's only been open a couple weeks but I work nearby and fellow coworkers have said positive things.... 

I went by myself and tried a few things, not a single 'meh' it was all delicious! I went back again the other day and tried more rolls- I LOVE that they incorporate coconut into their tempura and rolls-YUM! I tried the bacon wrapped scallops -bite size and perfect. Coconut shrimp tempura-yum! Screaming orgasm-creamy and delish! Seared white tuna, garlic tuna- yum yum! Snow White roll-perfectly savory! And I tried 3 other half rolls (two had sexy in the name) but I don't remember the other (no matter what, you just can't go wrong). 

The service was AWESOME, they didn't miss a beat. Food was on point. It's close to my work. I don't believe it gets any better.... Oh wait, it does! They have stamp cards for A.y.c.e. 
Yes indeedy, I'm one happy lady!

Bookmarked this place to try in the hopes of finding an AYCE competitor to Yama, and I got to try it out with the boyfriend this past weekend. 
In terms of taste, this place is really good. It also has an impressive menu. I liked the fact that they gave us an AYCE and a regular menu. The food is what has me giving this place 4 stars. Favorites from what we ordered: Tuna Poke Salad, Seaweed Salad, Yolo Special Roll (love the fried onions on top to compliment/balance the roll), Chicago Fire Roll (had enough spice for the boyfriend), Japanese Lasagna Roll (always a fave for us), Honey Bread (reminds me of a cinnamon roll with ice cream instead of frosting), and the fried Tempura Ice Cream (tasted like Fruity Pebbles Cereal).
Honestly knocked one star off 'cause of customer service we experienced early in our dinner. It was nice to be greeted and seated right away. What wasn't cool was waiting for a waitress take our order about 10 minutes after we had been given water by the initial host to the evening. Umm... We didn't have our phones out, distracted from looking at the menu. 
I will admit that it got slightly better after getting our appetizers, but when we were trying to order the sushi, the waitress was nowhere near our table. 
I look up and around the restaurant for her, and she's at the cashwrap area, leaning against the counter or whatever, talking to the host that seated us. The boyfriend said he observed her there for awhile, but just didn't want to point it out to further irritate me. 
I was about ready to leave when a waiter we hadn't seen earlier came by to get a sushi order. Big thanks to that gentleman. We never got 1 order of sushi I asked for, but no biggie 'cause he checked up on us more than our waitress, who I only saw pick up our plates, not saying a word to us. The host even checked on us more - asked about soda/water refills, and brought me the sake cooler I asked for. The fastest service I got from her was when she brought the check and picked it up in less than 5 minutes. What the...?

Excellent quality sushi for AYCE. 
$20.95 lunch (1hr) and $26.95 dinner (90 min)

Make sure to try the garlic edamame with your AYCE
Make sure to try the sorbet for dessert after the AYCE

HIDDEN GEM!
I grew up coming to Togoshi Ramen (RIP) in this shopping center and never knew about this sushi spot until I was searching yelp for a lunch idea to take out some out-of-towers today.

Did I mention how excited I am that I found this place?! 

The service was excellent. The quality and consistency followed through the entire meal. Tons of delicious apps and sushi to choose from. I can not wait to come here again!

Some favs:
Baked Salmon Roll
Salmon Skin Hand Roll
Fat Ass Roll 
I Love Sushi Roll

Tip:
Get a stamp card!
If you plan on returning, be sure to get a stamp card(one stamp per all you can eat)

I was hesitant to really believe all the 4 & 5 star reviews for this venue as I've seen those types of reviews in the past where the venue did not live up to the hype. Well I have to say that Sushi Way really does live up to the 4-5 star reviews. Went in with a group if 10 people tonight with having made a reservation ahead of time. Table was all made up for us. The restaurant was not busy at all until toward the end of our meal which was about 2 hrs after we arrived. We all ordered the AYCE & ordered lots of things & I'd have to say that almost everything was fabulous. I didn't get pictures of everything we ordered but I'd have to say we had about 10-12 more items ordered than what you'll see in my photos. Some of the rolls are the same rolls from I Love Sushi which I thought was great because I love the Cherry Blossom just wished Sushi Way's version had the crunchy like I Love Sushi's Cherry Blossom does. Really loved the Salmon Tar Tare, tuna nigri, yellowtail & Rock & Roll roll.

From what I recall we ordered:
Nigri: Tuna, Salmon, Super White Tuna, Yellowtail, Garlic Tuna, Ebi, Unagi, 
Albacore, Seared Albacore, Octopus, Squid, Fresh Scallop, Uni, 

Sides: Poki Tuna Salad, Screaming Orgasm, Shrimp Tempura, Coconut Shrimp Tempura, Crispy Rice with Spicy Tuna, Sweet and Spicy Dumpling, Salmon Tar Tare, Calamari Tempura, Fresh Oyster, Baked Green Mussel, Sushi Nacho

Rolls: Spider Roll, Dancing Eel, James Bond, Cherry Blossom, Rock & Roll, Burning Your Stomach Roll, Mexican Roll, Candy Cane Roll, Lisa Hand Roll, 
I Love My A Roll 


Pros:
 - Nigri was super fresh. Tuna was fabulous. We ordered about everything on the nigri list as well as serveral "side dishes" as they like to call the appetizers. 
 - Super friendly service & they were on top of service almost the whole evening until the end. 
 - Like the fact that you can order 1/2 orders on rolls all through meal & not just the last roll you eat. 
 - Allowed our group to have the 10% off locals discount for their Christmas special.

Cons:
 - Table placed vertical to wall didn't leave enough room for 10 people to sit comfortably without bumping elbows. Wishing the table would have been placed parallel to the wall with three 4 seat top table tops. 
 - Shrimp heads were undesirable as they were over cooked & you could tell the oil was not hot enough when they were fried & oil tasted old. 
 - Oyster on the half shell seemed to have been pre-frozen. They just didn't taste fabulous.
- Towards end of night it seems that our table was being ignored as 2 rolls had been forgotten that were ordered as well as desert for 2 people was forgotten & it took over 10 minutes to get it while everyone else had already eaten their desert. 

Although the Cons list may look longer than the Pros list the cons will not deter me from coming back to Sushi Way. It's definitely on the "repeatable" list.

This place offers a great deal! All you can eat for $26.95! 

The other night I paid $20.00 for really subpar Indian food in the Fashion Show Mall, and I feel like... this place is a treasure chest in comparison. 

I ordered uni, sweet shrimp with the heads fried, soft shell crab spider roll...mini udon noodles.... fresh oysters... the quality of the sushi is also very good. 

Highly recommend this spot!

I was impressed with the quality and the cut of the fish.  From a sashimi standpoint a little thin. But I was impressed with the lack of rice in their rolls!!  Most places you run into throw so much rice into their rolls you never get enough fish!   Not the case here!

Flavored were spot on.  My favorite roll of the night was the "I Like My Ass"!!  Yes indeed, soft shell crab that had great flavor a!

One of my tests for a new sushi joint is to see if they have fresh wasabi.  This is key in great sushi joint!  Ever since I was introduced to it by a very close friend and sushi chef it is the tell tale of a place in my book.

The attentiveness of the staff was bar none phenomenal!!  

The all you can eat menu isn't limited on what you can get but rather how much you can devour in 60 minutes during lunch or 90 minutes during dinner!!! 

Highly recommend you check out this new one!!  I think they will be around for awhile once the word is out!!

Thanks again for a pleasant eating experience on the road!!

Upon arrival, this place seems very chill and low key. It's nice to get off the strip away from all the noise. Didn't know it was an all you can eat place which was a pleasant surprise. Decided to go that route for dinner before we headed home. All you can eat include the entire menu front and back. Includes all sides & dessert! 
Our server was Brian, was very friendly. He kept us entertained throughout our meal. The sushi was great! Overall, I would come back to this place when we visit Vegas again. Oh and in my opinion the music was amazing! Whoever made the playlist is awesome

fish is fresh. service is friendly but not terribly good (slow, no one ever asked if I wanted anything to drink, took more than 15 minutes for anyone to acknowledge me after I sat at the bar). the rolls were a bit heavy with sauce, but nigiri was excellent.

Very good AYCE sushi. Went here for lunch in early Sept and service was great, sat at the bar and go to order quickly and didn't have to wait at all for orders.  The place was not busy at the time we went.  The fish was fresh but for nigiri it was a bit limited for lunch, no uni, ama ebi.  We enjoyed this place and will return when we go back to Vegas.

Hands down the best overall sushi restaurant I've been to. I say overall because this is not the best sushi I've ever had, but it is pretty damn close and for a fraction of the price! 

Food: 
Fish was super fresh! I was in such shock since we are in the middle of a desert eating super fresh seafood. The rolls were well made. The sides were just as good. Must orders: Tempura, sweet shrimp, uni, salmon kama, salmon belly and scallop roll. 

Service: 
Super friendly staff who dropped by every few minutes to check up on us. 

Environment: 
This is set away from the strip. The place can fit 50 - 75 patrons. Plentiful parking and easy to get to. 

Price:
$28 for AYCE!! This is top notch quality sushi...I don't quite understand how they can charge $28 for all this. 

I will be back! Perhaps everytime I'm in Vegas....

Food: 5
Service: 5
Environment: 4
Price: 5
This place is on point in every way! Fresh sushi, amazing flavours, and great service (thanks Ploy & Jane). A definite must if you're in the area!

The best place in Vegas for fresh sushi and authentic Japanese appetizers. Freshest fish and actual Japanese chefs. Amazing customer service and price friendly. 

My new favorite place in Vegas for sure.

I ordered delivery from this place and wasn't impressed.  My mussels didn't look appetizing and was tough to chew.  My sushi roll didn't look too great either.  It looked like they just threw the meal together.  I used bite squad and I didn't get my meal until an hour 1/2 later.  I was initially told one time and then sown a much later time once the order was sent over.  Highly doubt I'll order from here again.

Sushi Way is on the higher end of average for AYCE sushi in Vegas- service was great and most fish was decently fresh, but the rice was oddly wet and dense, which significantly detracted from my enjoyment. From reading other reviews, I was expecting more riceless options here, and though they weren't clearly marked, the few I found were good.

APPS: the poke is decent with seaweed, ahi, and a lot of onion in a sweet-spicy sauce, BF really enjoyed the coconut shrimp tempura, the tartare was interesting, screaming orgasm was quite small compared to others' orders?
NIGIRI: aside from the aforementioned rice issue, most fish seemed pretty fresh but some pieces were bland. Specials were pretty basic (fishy-tasting yellowtail with jalapeno, yuzu tobiko), salmon is my preferred fish but I didn't even request a second order because it didn't have much flavor... almost tasted like it had been frozen?
ROLLS: This area of the menu seems to be their forte, the "Sushi Nachos" would probably be more appropriately placed in the apps category but was my favorite. Lisa hand roll could use a sauce to perk it up but was one of the healthier options. The DD and Candy Cane rolls recommended in other reviews were typical, the YOLO seemed unique and yet flavor was lacking and fried onions were old and hard. 

I always recommend sitting at the bar, the chefs and server were super friendly. I don't know if it's their location or if they're just really popular, but they got crazy busy- recommend arriving early, as they were empty at 6PM and started a wait list around 7PM.

Looooooved the sushi here! I've never had such a good experience at a restaurant. All thanks to JANE, thanks for everything !! I'll definitely plan on coming back during vacations. The food tasted great and your service was exceptional! My favs:  SEX BOMB ROLL,  COCONUT SHRIMP TEMPURA, OYSTERS, MUSSELS, GARLIC YELLOWYAIL, MOCHI ICE CREAM ... BOMB !!! This is from that one LA table, we WILL be back!

Surprisingly, really good! Rice to filling/topping ratio is on point! Especially for an AYCE that's decently priced. Sit at the bar and be able to constantly order directly with the sushi chefs. Hand rolls are a definite recommendation over cuts. Be sure to order all the "one-time" items, you're welcome! Oysters are great. Exactly like the shooters but on the half shell. And who wouldn't like to exclaim, "Can I have a screaming orgasm, please?!" Only complaint is that the uni and sweet shrimp didn't taste as fresh. And the spicy garlic edamame wasn't exactly what I was expecting from a Japanese restaurant. But everything else was delicious though!
