Friendly staff and quick service. Restrooms are clean. Parking is just enough. Has a TV above the bar to watch whatever sports are going on.

We came here with our friends who came her once before. It's off the strip so not a well known place but has excellent reviews and we found them on yelp. Well the reviews don't lie. The food is amazing. But the service.... well it's impeccable. Sun was our waitress and while we were not the easiest because my husband has a shellfish allergy we needed some serious accommodations, she made it happen. She allocated a single chef to us to make his food so that it would not be mixed with shellfish. Even though this was not an easy task she made sure to get it done. We greatly appreciate it. There was  also a bus girl and i didn't catch her name but she was super friendly and on top off things. Oh and did I mention this place has all you can eat for $26. No joke. You can have as many things as you want off the menu.  It was a really good meal for an amazing price with excellent service. We will be back!!!

Came here due to the high number of good reviews & their menu options looked promising. Maybe we came in on a bad day but food wasn't up to expectations. 

Starting with the nigiri - we first ordered eel nigiri. I absolutely love eel but it was drowning in eel sauce & eel tasted off. There was a lot of bones in eel which greatly detracts from the flavor. Salmon is my preferred fish but didn't even request a second order of salmon nigiri since the rice-to-fish ratio was so bad.

I ordered few of the no-rice rolls which were a no-go. When my "rock & roll" sushi came in (which is tuna , salmon , white fish , yellowtail & crab wrapped in cucumber) , the fish tasted frozen , there was waaaay too much crab (more crab than the actual tuna , etc.) & the cucumber was thick cut + orgasm sauce all on top tasted terrible. I didn't take a photo of mine but my "rock & roll" did not look like any of the photos other Yelpers have posted in the past which looked way better before.

We also ordered a few baked & deep fried rolls. It was hard finishing them even when we ordered half rolls. Did not taste as good as their descriptions sound. 

I really wanted to enjoy the other menu items such as "salmon tar tare" in appetizers section & "volcano roll." The orange/yellow sauce + sriracha on top of salmon tar tare was not a good combination. "Volcano roll" (which is also part of their no-rice rolls) could've been decent since I love avocado but the spicy tuna + crab inside tasted pretty much almost frozen too.

Service was bit slow but I can't blame them since they seem short staffed - during lunch looks like only one waiter , one food runner/busser & two sushi chefs. AYCE prices same like any other place/competitors - about 22$ for lunch & 27$ for dinner. However , I'd suggest trying out other places :(
Great food, service, atmosphere!!  V- our sushi chef was very personable and gave great conversation during our meal. Highly recommend this place
No como sushi pero este lugar me hizo convertirme en una fanática del sushi. Las cervezas típicas que ofrecen son buenísimas.
Really great and fast service! The food was good and the menu was extensive. Monica was so helpful in explaining the menu items and providing recommendations. Thank you for the meal Sushi Way!

Vegas has some of the best all you can eat Sushi spots.  After seeing awesome reviews for Sushi way I decided to check it out!  The waitor was very friendly and suggested popular items from the menu which was very helpful.  I chose to have the all you can eat special that costs $26.95 @ night which was pretty resonable.  I came around 7:30pm and was seated immediately.  20 minutes later the entire restaurant was filled!  The sushi rolls were pretty good.  I had the Big Easy Special, Salmon Killer, and I love My Ass. Of those the Big Easy Special was my favorite. They made a mistake on my Unagi and gave me a Unagi roll instead of Nigiri.  The Flavor of the unagi was good but it was slightly burnt and crispy.  Not really how Unagi is supposed to be cooked.  For Nigiri I had the Salmon, Garlic Yellow Tail, Ikura, Unagi.  My biggest drawback to this spot was that it was extremely slow during 8pm (Peak Time) So I wouldnt reccomend coming here during this time.  I would assume 10pm might be better.  It would be less crowded and you wouldnt have to wait a long time for your food.  On average I waited 20 minutes between orders.  All in all they've got decent sushi here and good service however, it wont be my go to spot.

Had one our best meals at Las Vegas for dinner at $26.95 per person.  Everything was super fresh and made to order.  Had three small toddler under 4 years old and was not charged.  Very good selection and varieties of raw and cooked food on the menu.  The Udon was very hot and tasty.  Great place.  Call for reservation is a must.  We came in early at 5:30 since here was two large parties in the evening.  Service is good as well.

This place is so good! Fast service! The all you can eat is such a great deal. There are so many rolls to choose from. So glad we came here on our visit to Vegas. Definitely recommend coming here if your in the mood for sushi.

Tonight I had THE most..."spiritual" experience in a long time. And of all things with food, and my gift of a sushi chef. Meet "Mike", a 67 year old sushi master who grew up as a pineapple farmer in Hawaii. 

I could tell you I only ordered one thing off of the menu. That after that, we began talking and he learned I appreciated authentic sushi, with minimal flavoring, much more than the hyper saturated "American sushi". That for the rest of the night not a single thing I ate came off the menu, but was custom made to fit my palette and preferences. But none of that does the night justice.

As soon as we began talking he began imparting wisdom along with every dish he gracefully handed to me. As though to feed my soul along with my stomach. He learned I was a photographer and most everything he said thereafter he tied into photography or what he knew of me. I wish I had recorded everything he said (he reminded me of my grandfather), but I will do my best to paraphrase the many things he shared with me:

"Say...hundred cooks learn to make one dish. But maybe only 20 learn to make it another way. Just like photography. One subject. All photographers take one picture. But you see one thing and you see ten things. Ten angles. You make ten things out of one thing. This is cooking."

"People grow up eating fast. Fast food. We don't think about what we eat we just eat it. We don't think about life we just live it fast. Then we get old. Then we think about what we eat but it is too late. We think about how we live but it is too late. Slow down. Eat slow. Live slow. Appreciate everything slowly. Enjoy."

"Beauty...beauty is an interesting thing. Beauty leads to jealousy. Jealousy leads to anger. Anger leads to hurting people. We must not hurt people. We must see beauty and appreciate."

"Don't do something you don't like. Love what you do. Find what you love and use it to make other people happy."

"You work hard, you come here and I take care of you. You relax. You enjoy. I like to make people smile."

"We can't just hear. We must understand. I say something to you. Tell me what I said. Understand it. If you don't understand it you did not hear it. Don't hear what people say. Hear ideas." 

COME HERE!

This sushi place is not bad at all. They have an AYCE option for around $25 a person or you can order the entrees individually. We ended up getting the AYCE option because it seemed so much more worth it. The quality of the fish is pretty good, seems decently fresh and tastes great. We ordered pretty much everything from the raw oysters to the nigiri to rolls. The nigiri and rolls were good, salmon, tuna, eel, yellowtail all the standard stuff were on point. The only thing that was less favorable was the raw oysters. Nonetheless, a pretty solid sushi place!

Not only was my service not the greatest, when I revived my avocado roll it came with salmon inside of it & my sushi roll was falling apart, I'm a regular sushi person and this place was not the a place that will be returning, I was also with a party of 6 others and no one as satisfied. The food just did not taste fresh.
I went here a couple of weeks ago, and I enjoyed it. The food was great, the staff was nice, I'm going again tonight, but so far I have to say, GOOD FOOD!

Can't beat AYCE sushi for $27. Service was fast and there's lots of options to choose from. You need to finish everything, including the rice. The rice portion is not too big, which is a plus. There are a few items that are starred that you can only order 1/person, including uni and sweet shrimp. Each nigiri comes with 2 pcs. The standouts were the sweet shrimp nigiri, salmon roe, screaming orgasm, and salmon tartare.

Upset, came in at 1:20am and the waitress said we were to late, last call was at 1:30am. So we walked over to the steak house across the street. No problem with saying it's to late, lying is where I got upset.

Ahhhhhmazing! This restaurant's rave reviews are absolutely on point! Would definitely recommend this as THE Las Vegas sushi destination to put on your list.

The vibe is hip and trendy, with Eminem rap music bumping through the speakers and high-speed skating on the TV screens. Food was ready extremely fast, and everything was amazing. 

I've never had deep-fried sushi before, and my Johnny roll was awesome!! I would've eaten two! We also got two other sushi rolls and the vegetable tempura. Tons of options on the menu, and lots of them were very different from what I'm used to back home in New England. Lots of great new things to try!

Sushi Way does have an "all you can eat" option, but the a la carte menu is what we went with, and I was happy with my decision.
Best All U can eat sushi place in Vegas! Really, really delicious!! I look forward to coming back the next time I'm in town. Incredible value for such great quality sushi!!!

Very disappointed. Craving for sushi and went here due to its high ratings. We sat down at the sushi bar and I ordered all- you-can-eat. My girlfriend does not eat raw seafood so we ordered bento dinner for her. We waited at least an hour for her bento box. If I had not flagged the server to ask for it, it probably would not have arrived. I was already halfway through my course when her dinner was placed in front of her. Gladly, she enjoyed the food aside from the shitty service. Unfortunately, my all you can eat dinner was an unpleasant event. The amateur chef loaded my nigiri with fat portion of rice. The ratio was about 3 to 1.  Fish was cut so thin it looked like paper. I felt that he was trying to get me full fast so we can get the hell outta there. My kitchen order came quicker than the sushi that I ordered first. This tells ya how slow this so called chef was. By the time I asked for the check the chef had a disgusting smirk on his face. I'd probably give them a bit of slack if it was super busy but it was a slow steady night during our visit. Save your money and go somewhere else. I will never come to this place.

We must have come here on a bad night but I was extremely disappointed in this place. We came here on a Friday night and there were only three other tables here so we were seated immediately.

The waitress gave us only a couple minutes before asking if we were ready. This was obviously our first time here so we politely told her we needed a couple more minutes. That didn't stop her for checking in every five minutes until we finally ordered.

My friends and I decided to only order a couple rolls since we weren't super hungry for AYCE. I ordered the TNT roll which was good, but we had problems when it came to my Candy Cane roll. The description stated that it would have spicy soft shell crab, spicy crab, cucumber and tuna and yellowtail ( I think) on the outside. Well, when I got my roll it was super tiny, not even as big as a quarter! I saw the cucumber on the inside but it was surrounded by regular imitation crab! Sushi is my favorite food by the way guys so I know the difference between spicy crab, regular crab, and soft shell crab. 

I decided to try one piece just to be sure, but sure enough there was no soft shell crab and there was no spice at all! I politely tell our waitress that I believe the soft shell crab is missing and she takes my plate away to talk to the sushi chef. However, when she returns to the table she asks me, " Do you even know what soft shell crab is?" Then she explains that the chef said that there is soft shell crab in there and I should be able to taste the crunchiness throughout the roll. 

I am not an idiot! I should have taken a picture for evidence but it seriously just looked like a California roll with no avocado and tuna/yellowtail on top.

The service is horrible here!
So soooo good! My new fav sushi spot! All the employees are all so nice and welcoming too!
One of the best in town we've found! Really good quality, location, and they have some specials that will have you coming back for more!

I like searching for hot and new spots on yelp and stumbled upon Sushi Way, with 4.5 stars, it was a no brainer to come here. My wife and I came here during lunch, it was not busy so we were seated at the bar very quickly. The service was friendly but forgetful. Apps we ordered did not come out when first ordered. Now for the main event unfortunately the sushi, pretty much all of the rolls we ordered were bland, no flavor, no taste. It was weird, nigiri was good but still did not hit the spot. Probably will not come here again but we'll see.

Everywhere I travel,  I find a sushi joint. I chose this one for the number of positive reviews compared to other places. (And I always take any negative ones with a grain of salt)

I am glad I came here, it couldn't have been much better. The sushi was very fresh and the chef has some unique twists I never had before (like searing several rolls right in front of you). 

The owner was our chef. He was super friendly and fun. Whenever I come back to Vegas, this will be a mandatory stop every time!!

Went here for lunch.  We choose the all you can eat option.  The sashimi was fresh and the sushi rice was good.  They had Hamachi and Salmon Kama that was included that day and it was fantastic!  Definitely planning to go back next time I'm in Vegas!

I went to this sushi place because of its high reviews. I have been to a ton of different sushi places in Vegas over the last 5 years and these reviews absolutely do my match up to what it should be rated. The food came out 1 plate at a time and took forever in between plates. The restaurant wasn't that busy and the food is subpar as well compared to many of the other options in the city. This place offers almost the exact same menu as Sakana. Sakana is top 2 of AYCE places in Vegas for sure. Unfortunately will never eat at Sushi Way again. Staff was nice though.

This place is awesome. I don't like the mayo or honey sauce and they custom made every roll to leave it off. I'm a pain but they made it work perfectly. Quality spot... intimate and unique. Good for a date. Unless the date is a dog, then there is a Taco Bell across the street.
This was the BEST sushi I have ever had!!!! My husband and I LOVE sushi; we've been here twice now and whenever we visit Vegas this is on our Must Go To Eats!
This place is great, Rodolfo gave us the best of attentions the food is great, fresh, the sushi nacho is wonderful, the rock and roll is amazing definitely a must.

The all-you-can-eat lunch is amazing and includes very many options, including nigiri and rolls that you would expect, plus many in-house rolls, appetizers, salads, and even a dessert. The staff are friendly and attentive and the food was excellent.

Love this place. Good portions and friendly staff. The menu has a good selection of nigiri, rolls, kitchen items, and desert. The chef didn't skimp on the fish on the nigiri like some all you can eat places. It is priced well since I've gone to places where I've eaten less and paid more. I loved this place so much I came back twice in three days!

All u can eat and sushi are normally two things I would be sketched out combining but this place really nailed it. Their sushi is surprisingly amazing and for 45 bucks a person it doesn't hurt so bad when eating well over double the amount you would pay at a comparable sushi spot. A+
Great sushi! They had fast delivery and variety to order. Dankdankdnakdnandkndandkandm
The BEST Sushi we have ever had! Every roll was amazing. Wish we lived here as we would come back every week! You do not want to pass this place up!

Sushi way is my favorite spot for Sushi..everything is very fresh..I've tried half the menu and I've liked everything so far...my favorites,,screaming orgasm..shrimp lovers..when I was pregnant I craved their sushi more than anything..it's that good!!..but of course I couldn't..I just had my baby..and can't wait to go in and have some Sushi...see you soon...

Food was decent, the service ruined the meal... Waited 10-15 minutes in between every order that was delivered to the table and each order only had 2-4 pieces... Hubby and I ended up drinking 4+ pots of tea waiting for food to arrive at our table... I think we got full from tea and not the food... One order never showed up to the table at all after waiting a good 20 minutes at the end... We gave up and asked for the check and even that took 15 minutes

Love this place. 

They do half rolls, include salmon & hamachi Kama & salmon belly on they're AYCE menu, dessert too.

Recommends:
- White tuna w/jalapeño
- Cherry Blossom (for avocado lovers)
- Bacon scallop skewers & Baked green mussels
- GARLIC YELLOWTAIL

My waitresses (Monica or Kim lol hi) are always very exceptional & sushi chefs have always delivered swiftly. Third time here, definitely a worth a try. 

Lunch time 11:30A - 3P $21.95
Dinner time 3P - 2A $26.95

Excellent sushi 
Fresh fish 
Perfect sushi rice
Good Sake 
Best Sushi I have had in Vegas 
Close to the strip 
Walking distance

A staff member told me about this place. At first I was a bit skeptical try but glad we did. Service was great. Very friendly staff. Food came out super fast and the taste did not disappoint us.  Nigiri came with good size fish. The rolls were well made with very tasty sauce. Love this place. And they have STAMP CARD...Hehehe. Lol. Definitely coming back here again even though it's a bit far for us.

I'm always skeptical about AYCE Japanese restaurants but this amazing new kid on the block DOES NOT disappoint! In fact it will blow away all the joints out of the water. Literally...Sushi the WAY it's suppose to be! Made to order, light, refreshing and the sushi rice is perfect! Not too much and not to little. But be patient.. the chefs are working overtime and the freshness is just as though the fish came out of the sea this morning! I'm not sure how they do it but coming from LA/OC, I'm serious when I say this place sets a new standard. Service is excellent and friendly!! We will definitely come back!! P.S. Kids 9 and under are 1/2 price. Here are the kids reviews - Chloe gave it a thousand stars and Lukey gave it a million hundred thousand stars...Chloe said if she was rich she would give them 1lb of gold for a tip! :)
We took our family to this restaurant and it was delicious. We had a lot of fun and the service was really good. The all-you-can-eat sushi was fantastic.

I got off the plane at LAS and IMMEDIATELY headed here for AYCE sushi.  The place was packed on a Friday at 8pm in early January.  We snagged a seat at the bar and I am so glad we did!  The sushi was delicious!  The chef was funny and would slice off perfect pieces of nigri between jokes and slugs of beer.  The white tuna with garlic was a stand out but all the fish was super fresh.  I will definitely be back again.  This is my second fav AYCE in Vegas and that is saying a lot for a city that has so many.
This restaurant is amazing !! I strongly recommend for an all you can eat. They serve fresh sashimi and delicious sushi

I'm from the Midwest, so we don't do much in the way of sushi, let alone all you can eat.  This place does it right.  It tastes fresh and delicious.  Price is more than reasonable for all of that.  The staff here is also very friendly.  If you like sushi and saving some $$$, get of the strip and try this place out.  You won't regret it!

This place is amazing fish quality is amazing very fresh....im a sushi chef as well and will continue to come and eat here chef Ivan is a great experienced man made me some awesome items very friendly shared a beer with him the only thing is i wish could have tipped more everyone is very friendly but christmas wiped me out

It's rare for me to find a sushi restaurant that I absolutely love, needless to say a sushi restaurant that has an AYCE option.  Sushi Way servers are extremely friendly and attentive. The AYCE is $21.95 for lunch and $26.95 for dinner. We came for dinner at 6:00 PM on a Friday evening. The restaurant wasn't busy but there were enough customers to know it wasn't a terrible place. You can order any of their menu items for the AYCE and the best part is that you can order half rolls! I would recommend the raw oysters, baked green mussels, and galbi. Of course, complete your dinner with one of their dessert items (included in the AYCE)!
Found our new favorite ayce spot in Vegas. Very tasty, will definitely be coming back. Coconut Tempura shrimp was my favorite.

Absolutely amaziiing!!!

The service was a little slow, for it was a little crowded (came at the end of lunch hour), but they recognized and accommodated.

Ordered all you can eat, and it was SO worth it.

Definitely recommend.

This was my first time eating here. I ordered 2 caterpillar rolls from the lunch special menu. The rolls came drenched in eel sauce, so much so that all the rice in the rolls were brown. The first roll was somewhat edible since it was only half drenched so I used napkins to take off the exceeds and just ate it since I hadn't eaten all day and was starving. Even then I couldn't finish the first roll. The second roll was just disgusting. It looked like a dark brown roll with an avocado on top. Sauce was dripping down from it when I picked it up. So I sent it back.

I complained to both the chef and the waiter but they did not do anything and still charged me for both rolls. I understand sometimes the food and the wait staff are not in sync so I usually let it go, but I spoke with both parties with no result. I'm very disappointed with the experience.

TL;DR - ordered caterpillar rolls that took a bath in eel sauce. Complained to chef and server, still got charged for everything.

Excellent choice to satisfy our sushi cravings while in Vegas. Short Uber ride since it's off the strip but totally worth it. Super friendly staff and sushi chefs made great recommendations. Will definitely be back!

I'm very pleased with this restaurant. I'm having the all you can eat meal and I'm being extravagant. Oysters started my meal. Then I moved onto the screaming Orgasm and the Kiss of Fire. You better believe my mouth is on fire now. Holy cow! Fantastic. 

I'm pausing for a moment for shrimp tempura and bacon scallops to cool down my tongue. The flavors here aren't just spicy. They're complex. You can tell the sushi chefs truly have a passion for creativity. 

Service is prompt and attentive. Looking up and giving a smile will beckon your server. The environment is light and festive. There are plenty of smiles and people seem to truly be enjoying themselves. 

The restaurant has wood tables and benches. There is a darkness with red hues in the lighting. It makes for interesting dining for sure. I absolutely will be back.

Went on Tuesday night and ordered the All you could eat. Worth it as I've a big appetite (in Vegas). They kept serving with a smiling face and we kept eating with a drooling tongue. Too many choices to try. Will definitely go there again.

If I could choose "minus stars," I would.  My customer chose Sushi Way for dinner & I was pretty much horrified by what we were served.  I couldn't eat it.  I was worried about food-born illness.  Their specials were room temperature and tasted bad.  The presentation was sloppy and the sushi nachos difficult to eat.  My tempura shrimp was undercooked.  We ordered at least 10 items and were disappointed with everything.  I left hungry but paid the bill ($30+) for each of us. I was worried I'd never eat sushi again (I typically love it), but was redeemed in South San Francisco with a delicious lunch this week.  I wouldn't let my dog eat @ Sushi Way.  How they get good reviews on Yelp is beyond me.

Love this off the strip Sushi joint. We ate off the all you can eat menu and the food was amazing. Service was very friendly and prompt throughout the entire meal. Unlike many all you can eat menus, the choices were very creative and delicious. Definitely will come here again during my next trip into town.  Try the Honey Bun for desert. You won't be disappointed.

sushi and service were both good. I took care of the bill for our group. I left a 20% tip on top of the bill. once I got home I realized they had already added 18% service charge to the bill. it is standard for a server to inform the guest when when a service charge has already been added, they did not. the server also picked up the bill and added cash tip long before we left and knew exactly what happened, but said nothing. shady business!

Let me start off with the service, it was fantastic. Ryan and and another girl were our servers and they made us feel like top priority. 

Food and quality was OUTSTANDING! Our favorite roll was the last one we ate "sunshine special" recommended by our female server. 

Thanks everyone for making our first experience with you an exceptional one! We will definitely be back :)

I'm from Southern California and Sushi seemingly is available on every corner, so when my friend and I decided we wanted Sushi for lunch we spotted this a block from our hotel and took a chance. Let me tell you, it smokes every place I've been to in Cali! We had multiple different items, and ALL of it is super fresh and delish! Specifically the Ono and Halibut sushi! Don't pass this place up, price is right, atmosphere is perfect and the service was perfect! Everyone was very friendly as well, we will DEFINITELY be back!

I just want to start off saying this is not the worst AYCE sushi place but it definitely is not the best. After we got our seats we waited about 15 mins before someone took our order. After ordering we asked the server what rolls that they gave us were and she had no idea what it was. If your server doesn't even know what it is how do you expect me to know if it's the right one? We just dismissed this and just said its ok and she just told us to eat it, that it's good. 

As far as the quality of the food, it's ok but I've had better. I had the Arizona roll and Sunny Special. The Arizona roll had yellowtail, cucumber and avocado which was topped with yellowtail. I definitely enjoyed the Sunny Special more which had crab and was topped with salmon and a lemon slice, the lemon was too strong for my liking but once I took the lemon off the rest was enjoyable. I also ordered the poki tuna salad which was probably my favorite thing I ordered.

After eating we told the waitress that we would like our check, I guess she didn't hear us or forgot because she walked around for like 15 mins and then came back without the check and asked if we wanted anything else. We asked for our check again and I would say another 10-15 mins for us to get that as well. The restaurant as a whole is decent, they definitely need to work on customer service though.

Not a fan. I am a major sushi lover and have eaten at a lot of places in Vegas. Never have I decided after the first roll to cancel all you can eat and pay for the roll and leave. The food here is to fishy. The yellowtail was hard. I have never had hard yellow tail before. I read the good reviews and that is why we decided to try this place. No thanks, if you like good sushi this place is not for you. On top of that, service is not good. Don't throw down the plates, place them down. Sorry but won't ever be going back to Sushi Way.

Excellent food and service. Delicious! 

We ordered Rainbow Roll, Sexy Lazy Special, Crunch Roll, Screaming Orgasm, and various side dishes. Everything was wonderful! :D

My wife and i came here on Saturday night for dinner. We both got the AYCE ($26.95 per person). The stand outs were the baked mussel (get like 3 orders of of these!), screaming orgasm (get like 2 orders of these!), and crispy rice with spicy tuna (my favorite!). My recommendation for rolls would be the sexy lazy, sweet 16, big easy, and yolo. And for dessert, we tried the honey bread and yuzu sorbet. The honey bread tasted good but it was nothing special. The yuzu sorbet was great bc it cleanses your palate from all the heavy flavored sushi that you just ate. Their service is great, very attentive and fast with your orders. My wife and I have been here twice already in 1 month so that says a lot about a sushi place. This place is up there in my top sushi restaurants here in Vegas.

I wasn't a sushi lover until we tried sushi way and OMG GOTTA TRY IT! The Mexican roll, the big easy, shrimp tempura are to die for!! Yumm!! This is what I love about Vegas any kind of food you want whenever you want.

Amazing is an understatement and close by the convention center make this the new best sushi in Las Vegas.  Even if it were not AYCE, I would still come here!  Here's my recommendations:

#1 Salmon Belly nigiri tied with Hamachi nigiri
#2 Wasabi Tobiko
#3 Super White Tuna with jalapeno (sashimi)

This is the type of place that when it gets really popular (been open for 9 months), you'll have to get here early (6PM).

Their Salmon belly is actually better than any Chu-toro or O-toro at the higher end places and a fraction of the price.  Wonderful!!!
Great lunch specials. Great sushi. One of my favorite spots in town. We visit here each time we're in Las Vegas.

My friend and I were dying to try sushi together but we didn't know where to go. So I went to the bank and they recommended Sushi way. I'm so glad I took their advice because Sushi way is totally awesome and they're very clean people head also when you do the all you can eat sushi there's plenty of choices and everything is delicious.
Ivan is awesome with the service, very friendly and super accommodating!!! Great food. Great selection of food from the all u can eat. Fresh ingredients. Foods are tasty.  will come back.
Delicious! Great service. Fat ass roll is really popular. The i love sushi roll and salmon nigiri was also amazing.
Amazing service, amazing food, amazing atmosphere!! Love this place every time I'm in Vegas this place is a must!!!
I only go for he nigiri! It is definitely amazing and not stale at all. My favorite is their salmon and garlic tuna. The waitress that was attending us throughout the night was very attentive.

I wasn't happy. we got AYCE, and the older waitress wasn't very nice, she was always rushing us, and she wasn't understanding the order. the sushi was OK.... tempura calamari just disgusting..., the rolls weren't flavorful at all.. lack of sauces... I am not going back

This place had very yummy deep fried sushis, i'm giving them a four star because it took them a while to serve our sushi even though there wasn't a lot of people there, but still very delicious sushis and the miso soup was also really good!

I'll be the contrarian and say this place way underwhelmed me, except for the price. After reading the reviews I had high hope, and didn't mind spending $20 for the Lyft round trip. 

In an AYCE setting the owner and the customers' objectives are polar opposites. The owner wants to limit his/her damage without being too obvious. As I get older quality takes precedence over quantity, but I keep forgetting that.

The good:
Sea urchin is fresh, the salmon has a rich taste. The waitress is nice. Unfortunately the list ends here. 

The less than ideal:
Sea urchin, sweet shrimp, tuna sashimi and oyster are only one per dinner order. But for the price they are charging I can understand that. For the sweet shrimp they were supposed to serve the head tempura style. There were only two waitresses so they were overwhelmed in an AYCE setting where the customers made repeat orders. 

The bad:
All other fishes are not as fresh (likely previously hard frozen) and are almost tasteless. It is also half the thickness I am used to (granted the rice is also on the small side). Hence the nigiri lacks balance. The salmon roe and smelt roe are way too salty. Oyster is not fresh, which is kind of hard. Oysters on half shelf are either fresh or spoiled so it puzzled me why the taste was off yet not spoiled. The wasabi has no kick at all - something really hard to screw up. All rolls had faked crab legs basked in mayonnaise in the center, and more creamy sauce on top. Two of those one can call it a night.

To add insult to injury I felt sick and threw up afterwards.

The food was good. But very poor service on a weeknight. The restaurant was severely understaffed, there were only two servers in a restaurant with a 50-person capacity and one of them attempted to serve as a hostess. They lacked expediting skills as well. You're better off finding a restaurant with adequate service.

We tried this place a few years ago, the food was good, but the service was so SLOW. They told us that one of their sushi cutters had called in sick. We were there for over 3 hours altogether, waiting 15 plus minutes between each roll!

We decided to try it again last week, just in case that one time was a fluke. BAD IDEA. After sitting for over 20 minutes and only getting a hand roll and some tempura shrimp, my husband couldn't take it anymore. We paid for what we had eaten and told the girl we were leaving. She told us AGAIN that their sushi cutter had called in sick. Ridiculous.

We left and went to Sakana and had amazing service and sushi. There are so many great AYCE sushi places in Vegas, but this is not one of them.

This is my second night in a row at Sushi Way.  Really friendly, great service and excellent food.  I recommend the Chicago Fire Roll and the spicy garlic edamame.  Added bonuses- they play great music, have an awesome atmosphere, and a big screen TV behind the sushi bar.

Best sushi I've had in Las Vegas, hands down. Make sure to get the crispy rice w/ spicy tuna (ask for no eel sauce) and the Sweet 16 roll. Ask for Sune Oak (Monica) as your server. She's amazing. MAKE IT HAPPEN PEOPLE.

Great food and service. I would recommend this place to anyone and know they will thoroughly enjoy their time here in sushi way. The fish is also very fresh! Best sushi experience in Vegas hands down!
Always one of our stops   Service is meh but the sushi is good. Go before 6 and you have no waiting

First time at Sushi Way. We came for the all you can eat. 

Great quality sushi, everything was so fresh and clean tasting. Very well prepared, large pieces of fish and a good amount of rice. The itamaes were very skilled and everything was presented well and delicious. 

Highlight was a strawberry rice wine. This was so smooth and easy to drink. We blew through 7 bottles in the course of our meal. Totally worth it! 

The waitresses were helpful and super attentive. Great service, there were always around and available. 

Great sushi spot, I'd really recommend coming to try them out. Off the strip, but worth the time and really high class.
Love the sushi baked salmon roll you must try!!!! One roll is practically as much as ayce!!! So do ayce!!!

This is an all-you-can-eat sushi place for about $25/head. The restaurant wasn't that big, but it was clean. We got the last booth on a Saturday night. Not a fancy establishment...some people brought their kids & infants.

The selection of items was tremendous. Some of the item names are, ahem, not family-friendly. "Excuse me, uh, what is a Screaming Orgasm?" Lol!

Quality of the fish was okay, perhaps slightly better than average for sushi buffet. Note: there's no way we can compare sushi buffet fish with a regular restaurant, given the relatively low cost. The seaweed salad was too sweet.

So, why did DH swear never to return? It was the rice. Their rice was gluey and starchy, so much so that it distracted us from enjoying the fish or shrimp. The  sweet shrimp itself was pretty good, however, they didn't give us the deep fried heads! The uni was a touch bitter & a really small portion. It was okay, but we didn't want more. Which was a good thing, since this item was limited to one order per person.

The Kalbi was good. Haha, must be a Korean-run establishment! :) Eel was okay, but no torch-caramelized top. Sunny Special roll tasted fine, however, not as skillfully done as the nigiri. They had more than 1 chef making rolls, so maybe these were done by the other guy. See the photo with the cross-section on how it was rolled.

The "Yum Scallop" was basically a gunkan sushi with shredded scallop mixed in mayonnaise. We couldn't understand the waitress & thought "mai yu" was a special seasoning! Lol! She meant "mayo"! You folks can pass on this one. ;)

The Honey Bread dessert was tasty. Basically a King's Hawaiian bread roll with a scoop of green tea ice cream, whipped cream, and a drizzle of chocolate sauce. I don't think there was any honey in it. DH tried the yuzu sorbet and the flavor was weak.

Service was surprisingly good. They get an extra star for that. The wait staff was eager to get our orders in & happily explained things on the menu. There is a 90 minute time limit for dinner, but we were never rushed. Food came out quickly.
From out of town but this place was amazing and the staff was very friendly too!! Can't wait till I am back in Vegas to come back here!
Prob the best AYCE sushi i had.  Too bad uni was only for dinner time.  Very fresh sushi.

Wow! Where do I even begin! I can't believe it has taken me so long to write this review (I've been here about 25 times already) but after the FREE travel chopsticks offer how I could I pass it up. Let's start out with the atmosphere. It's fantastic, cozy, yet modern and staff is among the friendliest. Let's not forget to mention the Spotify playlist that just hits the SPOT. Now getting into the sushi well let's just say you're going to pay half of what the strip charges you and get 3x the quality and uniqueness. While all of the sushi chefs are fantastic I must brag about Ivan. He's a one of a kind sushi chef who will not hesitate to make you some of his custom rolls. In the end Sushi way has friendly service, great food, and at a great price.. What's not to love?

Saw the reviews and decided to try this place out. Right when we walked in we were greeted and seated within seconds. Richard served us and he is awesome! He definitely made our first time a great time! 

The menu for AYCE is nicely organized so it made ordering food easy. The names for some of the rolls are pretty funny. Richard tries to catch you off guard so you can say "I love my ass" (name of a roll) haha. Look out for him, he's awesome! 

The presentation for the rolls were absolutely stunning especially the "cherry blossom" roll (beware this roll is loaded with avocado). They didn't drench the rolls with sauces and the fish tasted pretty fresh. All the rolls we ordered were delicious. The chicken teriyaki bento was worth it! So definitely try that too! 

This is gonna be added to our list of sushi spots. Don't forget to ask for a stamp card so you can get an AYCE for free.

This place was amazing! The staff was very polite. For a Monday this place was really busy but the staff doesn't rush you witch is relaxing. I sat at the bar and the chef was really nice. The servers had their hands full but table touched every so often making sure we were ok. The food was amazing just as good as it looks. I tend to go to a lot of ayce places and this is by far one of the best ones.
First time here while visiting vegas! Service is so nice and friendly here. The vibe is very chill!!

When in Vegas, I prefer to eat off-the-strip, as parking is easier, crowds are smaller, and prices are generally lower.  Sushi Way met all these criteria - stopped in for lunch with the family and left completely satisfied.  We ordered a wide variety of sushi and roles, and had no complaints on any of them.  The kids even special ordered their miso soups (one with no seaweed or onions, the other with no tofu) and they even nailed those orders.  Will definitely come back next time I'm in town!

Worse service ever! No system in waiting tables, waiters bouncing table to table. Honestly, if I wanted to, I could've walked out without paying because the waiters weren't paying attention. Never again

Vegas Memorial Day weekend and we had a craving for sushi. After yelping for a good place we found Sushi Way. Winning for sure!  
The service- incredible! We got there at opening but were greeted and seated right away and our drinks ordered within minutes. Food and drinks were brought quickly and timely. The servers were personable and chit chatted with us as well and it was very chill. We were there for close to two hours.
The prices- great. Lunch AYCE for 21.95 and drinks. We payed little over 100 not including tip for 4 people.  
The Food-Spicy Edemame alone was delicious and spicy! We ended ordering about 10 rolls-4 people so don't judge. The baked scallops alone with all the rolls were delicious.  Dessert was the mochi- strawberry and mango. Next time I want sushi here we will come back for sure. We walked out stuffed!

Amazing!!!!!! Top place in Vegas. Hole in the wall place must go! The chefs are amazing if you need or want anything different on your sushi they will work with you. I don't eat fish which is weird to go to a sushi place but every time I go there they help me make me feel good about that and do anything to make me  satisfied with their food.

This is really an average sushi place.  Las vegas has plenty of spectacular sushi places and this really shouldn't be on that list.  I love the waitress, she's prompt and a sweet heart; however, I'm not paying someone $28 to do so where my dog gives that to me for free.

The sushi is average.  Their orgasm appetizer doesn't even tickle me.  The best dish there is the coconut shrimp tempura which comes from a box either way.

How are they 4.5 stars you ask?  People want a free soda so they give them 5 stars.  Really people?  Your integrity for $2.50 worth of coke?

Highly disappointed.  Here are other recommendations if you're looking for ayce sushi in Las Vegas:

Sakana
Jjanga
Yama (hit or miss)

Great Sushi.. Nice atmosphere. Friendly staff. And a gorgeous waiter. Win win
Good selecrion, Was in love with the jalepeno poppers.

We had great food and Jane was a great server! Sushi was delicious! My husband had several sushi rolls and thought they were all delicious and my son tried teriyaki chicken and thought it was very tender.

Food was good the rolls were fresh i guess their left over policy can be broken if you talk to Richard great server may be owner he made nite a pleasureble one would recommend thanks Richard great service

My Favorite, underrated sushi restaurant to visit while in Las Vegas. A hidden gem for the locals. This place is not about the high prices and fancy ambience, it's about the really fresh and tasty sushi. Pleasant surprise. The oysters were just as good as any expensive restaurant on the strip. I will definitely be returning again with family every time I am in town!

All the pics of sushi are old.  The nigiri is really poor quality.

Rolls would be good if the fish was better.

But their crispy rice spicy tuna is really really good and it's bite sized.

And they put way too much ponzu sauce

Like others, I am always wary of AYCE restaurants.  This one is not set up as a buffet rather you order items from the menu.  Unlike others, you can order as many items at one time as you want when they aren't busy.  The food was great and I prefer sushi over rolls.  They had many sushi choices so I wasn't limited in that way either.  They have cooked items for the not so adventurous.  The place is very small so going on off hours makes it more fun.

Really good sushi and they're open till 2am ! Came here on a Wednesday night so they weren't that full and we got all our food quick. Plus our waiter is beyond handsome I'm pretty sure he models on the side.

Found Sushi Way on Yelp and saw there was an option to order a delivery. Ordered and paid and received some delicious sushi within a half hour. Would deff recommend this place! Inexpensive and very tasty!
First time trying this place very clean and good food this is one of those places where can get good food and not spend a lot of money definitely coming back for all you can eat
Best sushi we ever tried , we r spoild and picky frim NY, by the way :):);). Great appetizers, cherry blossom- must to try, everything so yummy
Friendly staff and my favorite part is that they have no rice rolls on their AYCE menu. The Rock & Roll, Spicy Garlic Edamame, garlic yellowtail are all pretty delicious

This place is amazing! My girlfriend and I made a last minute trip to Vegas and were looking for a good sushi joint. This place easily goes toe to toe with sushi samba. We sat at the bar and got excellent service from Ivan - the 22yr old sushi chef wonder. I can't wait to come back to this joint next time I'm in Vegas!

You want a new sushi spot (opened for about only a month now) that serves great quality sushi in an all-you-can-eat format?  Go this 'way' ... the Sushi Way!   Let's preface by saying that my all-time favorite ayce sushi spot currently is Sakana but Sushi Way may take the top spot in the future.  If you were a big fan of Sakana then when I say this rivals them, you ought to hurry before this place gets too popular.  It was that good my first time here and I can only hope it'll stay this way when I return again soon.

The location takes over where once Dragonfly/Firefly used to be way back then.  So many good memories made here and I'm glad a new sushi joint has taken its place.  My group walked in around 6pm on a Monday and we were the only customers there.  Sweet.  More attention for us.  Free drink with Yelp or Facebook check-in. Nice!  Thirsts quenched.  

Onto the food:  

Appetizers- Gyoza, Fried Rice (w/ chicken), Tempura Shrimp and Tempura Coconut Shrimp, Seaweed Salad, Poke Tuna, Baked Mussels, Miso Soup, and Sweet and Spicy Dumpling.

Everything was great but the Poke and the Baked Mussels were REAAALLLY Good.     Check out my beautiful pictures..  so fresh, nice color, tasted marvelously.  My daughter and I enjoyed the seaweed salad and the tempura shrimp in unlimited quantities is reason enough to be eating here.   There were multiple other choices on the menu that we didn't get to try simply because it was just the three of us eating.  (oysters, yakitori skewers, etc.)

Sushi- Japanese Lasagna-  California roll with cream cheese baked with yumyum sauce on top.  Assorted regular rolls such as shrimp tempura rolls, rainbow roll, etc.  All rolled well, nothing fell apart and the taste was good.   The screaming orgasm came with nice thick pieces of tuna in that delicious tangy screaming O sauce.  We had assorted nigiri including salmon, yellowtail and garlic tuna.  The fish was fresh and the ratio of fish to rice was excellent.  

I did also get one order of uni and it was super fresh!  When the uni is fresh, it's as good as it gets for me.  

Also, note on one of my pictures, if there's a roll you're interested in that's not on the menu, there's a "create your own roll" option.  They will try to make it for you.  Thought that was cool.

With regards to the service, the staff was very welcoming and attentive.  Waters were filled within reasonable time and the food came out quickly.  Only time can tell whether this place will be able to handle a packed restaurant once word-of-mouth continues to bring new customers in here.  Until then, stop by ASAP and enjoy some great quality AYCE sushi!
Great food and friendly staff. Sushi chef Ivan was awesome. Sushi size is perfect. Fits in your mouth in one bite.

Coming from Toronto with a huge Asian population, I figured we know how we do AYCE but after visiting Sushi Way, I don't think I can visit another AYCE sushi venue again that's any less than what Sushi Way offers. The fish was amazingly fresh - you can tell by the taste and the colour of the tuna and salmon. They offer 2 pieces of uni sushi (which is unheard of in Toronto) and 2 oysters as a part of their AYCE menu as well as other specialty items. Service was quick and friendly, location had plentiful parking and everything was clean. Great job :)

I highly recommend the Poke Salad (spelled poki on the menu)
Awesome place with good and friendly service. All of the rolls and sashimi were very fresh and came out fast. I am definitely gonna try and stop here whenever I am in town.

AYCE sushi.... We saw, we came, and we conquered.  This place never has disappointed me and all my friends.  

This is the only place that I've eaten uni that I actually liked it. Normally it tastes like the ocean but if you ask anybody that has eaten good uni, they will tell you that it tastes like butter and over it tasted like butter. Even my brother and my dad who has high end taste likes it here.  

One thing to note is the things with the red dot at the end of it (uni aka sea urchin, ama ebi aka sweet shrimp, fresh oyster, Kal bi aka galbi, etc) is one order per person. Other than that it order as much as you can eat. Don't waste or you might get charged. 

They have beer, different kinds of sake, soft drinks, and soda. 

Desserts are things like mochi ice cream, green tea ice cream, yuzu sorbet, tempura ice cream, and honey bread. Unfortunately you can choose only one of them. 

Yuna was our server and she was the bomb. Very friendly and gave us some good suggestions. Thanks Yuna, everything you suggested was good. 

Lunch is $21.95 and dinner is $26.95. 

For all of you who cant eat that much, you can do Ala carte.
Excellent .... Have the sex bomb... The big easy. Sexy lazy....pokey Tina salad...all winners!!

Came here with friends for dinner after a long day walking a lot outside. Honestly so delicious some of the best food in general that I've ever eaten. Wait is really not long around 5-10 min. considering it was dinner time too. Service is very good and the servers can be very funny and easy to talk too. The only real issue that I found was that the sushi can sometimes have too much rice stuffed underneath but only occasionally. Will definitely comeback!

Friendly staff and the owner is so sweet and such an awesome personality! The sushi was good and at a reasonable price. Got the All You Can Eat. We were the only customers in on a Sunday night. Food came out pretty fast. If you search this place on iPhone maps it does not have the correct directions. Must search using like google maps.

Our waitress was great, fast delivery of food and overall the dishes tastes great. Good selection of nigiri as well with exception uni was unavailable that night but overall I'm satisfied and would surely come back

Five stars and it deserves it. I thought LA was the only place where a great AYCE sushi restaurant was until I found Sushi Way. Huge selection of real sushi, even the hard to find stuff like uni, ikura, amaebi, fresh oyster sushi (Amazing!), and the more common sushi like hamachi, tuna, salmon and so on. If only I could have tried every roll on the menu? So good and my highest recommendation. Our waitress Jessica was great. Thanks Jessica.
Strong with the drink refills, Michael, the waiter explained the menu well, delicious freshly prepared all you can eat off the whole menu.

My friend and I ended up here after being greatly poorly at nearby Sakana... They are open until 2am for AYCE. It was empty when we arrived but it was 11:30pm on a Tuesday during the pre holiday season when UNLV and most of vegas was slow

Pros: very clean, nice server, open late..

Cons: 
Portion: while the Gyzoa was very fresh we couldn't fathom why am order for two people would only have 2 pieces( 1 for each). The gal I was super small and cut oddly 

menu: it would be better if it had pictures...reading through the list as it was organized wasn't the easiest.

Subjective taste:  the sushi was not to my taste...I don't like cream cheese rolls and they had many... I wasn't a fan for the garlic ponzu sauce and their spicy tuna just wasn't to my taste. 

So... Why a 3 star.. They were clean, good service and while the food wasn't to my sushi taste my friend liked hers and I have to round up on the subjective side

It was good overall. I got ALL YOU CAN EAT, and usually just eat sashimi. The sashimi was pretty plain but I liked how they don't overload it with rice (like most places) which was nice. The sushi place I usually go to as a variety of sauces for each type of fish and this place didn't really have that. Almost everything on the menu is all you can eat (including the desert:)). And if you want to get rolls you can always ask for a half roll (usually has a total of 4 instead of the usual 8 pieces) so you don't get full on just one roll. Other than that the service was awesome and were very attentive.

This was some of the best sushi I have had in a while. My friend and I are on vacation here from New York. Our hotel was nearby and we saw the all you can eat special so we decided to try it. Because of the special I didn't have amazing expectations. The food was amazing, the fish was really fresh and the service was excellent. Next time I am back here I will come to this place again and would recommend it to anyone.

Fantastic AYCE sushi.  Much better than the now defunct Todai which I used to frequent when in town.  Fish quality is on par with most standard sushi joints and thereby much better than the average AYCE place.  Nice staff and excellent service!  I will be here every vegas trip.

Some of the best AYCE sushi I've had. 
I normally go to Yama or Kaya and both are great,  but
I wanted to try a new place. 
I do believe this place tops them both! 
Fast, friendly service and very fresh fish.
This will be my new go to place for my occasional 
Sushi fix.
This place has really good service, and good quality food. They really deserve 5 stars. Ivan is pretty clutch too

We came to Las Vegas for 4 days, and the sushi was so good here, we ended up having 2 of our dinners here! It was just as good second time around--and sushi chef Ivan even remembered our favorites. If you've never tried an oyster shooter, theirs is excellent. They have a wide variety of sushi, it's fresh and tasty, and the service is friendly and fast.
Garlic hamachi great!  Good rice to fish ratio for nigiri! fair price of $26.95 for dinner!  Ayce sushi. Got here at 6:00 and no wait for table of 4.
Not too much rice. Fresh seafood. Super soft and tasty. Great service. Decent price. Best local all you can eat sushi spot!

Sushi Way is one of my favorite AYCE sushi restaurants! The screaming orgasm and coconut shrimp tempura are a must! I'm normally more of a sashimi and nigiri girl, but I always order the sexy lazy special, sweet 16, and go rebel (deep-fried) whenever I come here! I love all their coconut rolls. Their nigiri never disappoints me. The staff is great as well! Remember to look around for the chef specials that aren't on the menu.

Chef Chu Chu was amazing , Richard was a great server. I and my boy had a great time there with all you can eat menu. Sushi was great and fish was so fresh. Sweet shrimp was amazing. Excellent service from Richard and Chef Chu Chu will bring us back there again.
Great place. AYCE is a must. Service is good theyre pretty attentive, sushis not the fastest to come out but the quality is worth the wait. Definitely will be coming back.
Enjoyed the all you can eat sushi - the waitress were quite courteous and prompt service. Mike the sushi chef was very attentive and quite friendly. I highly recommend this place!

Amazing food and amazing service for an amazing price!!  Very friendly staff and on top of it they make you feel like a person not a number or a dollar sign. It was my first time here but not my last! Will be back soon.

5/4/18 Been to 6 different kinds of AYCE Sushi restaurants and I can say that this is one of my top 3 places. My husband and I took my friend,  visiting from Seattle out to eat. Good choice yelpers! 

I love their salmon belly nigiri and we all ordered the "one order" only per person. Everything I tasted was fresh.  My husband didn't like their uni (sea urchin), he said there was a different taste to it and he has develop an acquired taste to uni. Anyhow, so far this is the only AYCE restaurant that doesn't limit on desserts. If I knew I could have saved more of my appetite on desserts. 

Well,  I'll be back for sure! Happy eats!

My overall experience with sushi way was okay. 
The fish was good overall, but the way the sushi chef was cutting the fish pieces were inconsistent. He said it was his hobby so it was very iffy. Some pieces were super thick and yummy and some of them were extremely thin and choppy. 
The spicy edamame has a kick. When it says spicy, they mean it. I really liked that. 
Other than those notes, the overall quality and time was super nice.

Chef ChuChu and Chef Sexi Man are the absolute best. We decided not to order from the menu and just let Chef ChuChu create surprise us with new creations...best idea ever. Hands down. The food was amazing. If you're lucky enough to sit in his section at the bar, you're for sure going to be entertained the whole time.

Our second time here, and it did not disappoint! The chefs are very friendly, they're quick, and the place is hopping! My husband is a sushi connoisseur and loves coming to Sushi way. I like sushi as well and I'm always happy with the roles that I get. They're very tasty! The appetizers are good and the coconut shrimp is cooked to Perfection as well as the tempura calamari. You can't go wrong at this restaurant.
All you can eat sushi is an amazing deal. CraY part is that the Audi is high quality and good. Lots of traditional and more subsume type sushi. Try whatever suits you fancy.

All you can eat Sushi is a staple in Las Vegas. So my wife and I love to search for new spots every time we come and we landed on this hidden gem. We were greeted by the staff right away and got a great seat the sushi bar (Great Choice). One of the head chef I believe (Mike) was excellent. He was friendly and breakdown the whole menu. A hidden gem about this spot is you don't have to order a whole roll. You can mix and match a few rolls so you can get a little bit of everything. Eel rolls are my absolute favorite so I made sure I sampled all of the different rolls they had to offer. They didn't disappoint!  I also ordered several different sides like the screaming organism and the short ribs. All on point.  This spot is definitely competing for my favorite sushi spot in Vegas.

Incredible Service and some of the best sushi I've had in my life. I don't usually go to ayce sushi restaurants but I decided to give it shot based on reviews. Exceeded all of my expectations by far. Big pieces of super fresh fish, large creative menu  and perfect service, quick and friendly. If I lived in Vegas I'd be in there every week!

One of the top sushi places I have been to. They have so many different dishes and variations of seafood/sushi, the cherry blossom is amazing, try it out! Plus the mocha ice cream is different and really bomb lol hit them up before 4 for the 21.95 price.

Fun experience, but as a native Japanese, their sushi was just OK.
Some items took forever to arrive and a few items that we ordered didn't even come.  
We ordered raw oysters and soon as we ate them, we knew they were not fresh.  We got food poisoned.
If you are looking for sushi, you can find better place in Vegas.
Came here for all you can eat lunch for $21.95 per person. Great variety! They also have daily specials on a blackboard that you don't want to miss.
I love this place! I come for the all you can eat its so worth it. The best appetizers is the coconut shrimp and  bacon scallops.  Ethan is always so nice and does a great job!!!

Loved it!  The All You Can Eat Sushi is well worth it if you enjoy the speciality rolls.  The rolls were fresh and tasted great!  Our waitress had a great and friendly personality.  If I lived here I would definitely come back!

Review #095 - 2017

We showed up on Monday night, May 1st, around 11 PM and asked for a table for five, three adults and two babies.

The place was pretty much empty except for one other table who were getting ready to finish up and leave.  We had the whole place to ourselves so our food was made pretty quickly.

We started off with a few different rolls and nigiris.  I'm more of the sashimi eater, but my friends were more into the specialty rolls so it made it a little difficult to share with them so we ended up ordering a bunch of separate items.

I think my personal favorite would have to be the super white.  It was very tasty, plus the fact that there's no rice was a bonus.  I ordered 3 orders which consisted of 3 pieces per order.  I think I ate 2 orders to myself.

The bacon scallop skewers were also tasty.  Even my 1-year old daughter had a bite and didn't spit it out.  She also enjoyed a few strands of noodles from the udon noodle soup, which I thought the broth was kind of salty.

The screaming orgasm did not live up to its name at all.  I think they must have misnamed it because I was not feeling the orgasm.  Sorry, TMI!  Glad they limited it to just one order per person because I would've been greedy & ordered more just because of the name.  Haha

The salmon skin hand roll was really dry so I took quite a while to finish it, but everything else that I ordered was good.

The food is probably a 3.5 at best, but I bumped it up to a 4.5 because our waitress was the best that I'd ever encountered.  She was super friendly and accommodating.  I don't think I've ever met anyone who's so good at doing their job.  Sadly, I didn't get her name.

Yes, I did see that this place was on some local "dirty dining" exposé recently, but I assumed that meant that they are probably working in overdrive to turn that around, so decided to try it out. So glad I came in! The selection for lunch is not cut short from the dinner menu. Everything that a person can get at dinner, they can get at lunch. The options include lots of appetizers as well as deserts with the dozens of sushi roll options. I really enjoyed the couple of riceless rolls I tried, especially the Johnny roll-would HIGHLY recommend it! The roll has a perfect mix inside and the "orgasm sauce" is to die for! The egg roll was great-and is vegetarian friendly. I also really enjoyed the Hot & Juicy roll-it is an explosion of flavors in your mouth, and not too spicy, but still provides a great little kick! The rainbow roll was also delicious and had great filling and the topping is thick! I had a few other rolls, but those were the ones that stood out most. I finished with one mango and one strawberry mochi, which were a great palette cleanser. The service was quick and friendly. I look forward to coming back here any time I come to Vegas!
Gotta try Sex Bomb and I Love Sushi rolls.....delicious!  June the owner is the man!!!! Menu is filled with great items.
Not a big sushi eater at all but "Stephanie" told me what she likes to have, I took her word for it and I was really happy, thanks a lot "jane" lol

This is hands down the best all you can eat sushi deal EVER! Food is fresh and the place has great Hawaiian vibe. Quality of food is ONO. Staff really nice- seems like they work as a team. Seriously - this is the best deal in all of Las Vegas.

This is my new favorite sushi spot!! Our team originally was going out to another AYCE sushi spot but saw this last minute and decided to go here.  I highly recommend getting any salmon nigiri.  The service is also great in that they are very attentive to the customers and very friendly.  Take your friends and family here if you want some quality sushi.
Great sushi! Staying nearby and this is my second day in a row here. The sushi taste fresh and a super friendly staff. This place is definitely a hidden gem in Vegas!
Very clean and nice staff yummy sushi!! There is a sushi bar to sit at with a live sushi chef! And tables to accommodate groups!

First time here.  Skeptical from look of front entrance but got good reviews.  Walking distance from hotel.  I was very happy with my food and the atmosphere.  I suggest not even looking at the menu and just get the all-you-can-eat option for $27.  You'll easily double that as you can order from both sides of the menu.  Great service and fast food prep.  Fish was all very fresh.  Salmon was a bit tasteless but the sign of a good sushi place is the quality of their uni.  It was excellent.

I wish they had more sashimi options for the all you can eat.  I'm not allowed to order nigiri and not eat the rice.   All the plates are freshly made and enjoyable.  The staff is friendly.    There is one waitress and three sushi bar cooks.  I was lucky to arrive early before the rush.  CJ made most of my plates with a smile.   I enjoyed dinner.

Love love love this place.
In from dallas, and found this place via yelp. Our waitress Grace lived up to her name with the remarkable service. She recommended two rolls to start. The Oh Jenna and the Sexy Lazy. They launched the all you can eat on it perfected way.

I am indeed a sushi freshness snob, and every bite we had was wonderful. For $26 each, Sushi Way can't be beat. We mainly saw locals here which was a good sign.

We were staying at the Rio and although only 3 miles away, it was a $15 and 20min ride in early evening traffic. But well worth it.

Not a bad place for lunch ayce but not the best. 
The highlights were the - super white tuna, garlic tuna, yellowtail, and crispy rice with tuna. 

Would've given another star but I had to ask the chef a few times for some of the stuff I ordered since he "forgot." Think he did it on purpose because I complained to my sister about them being out of ginger. Guess that's what you get for sitting by the bar lol .

Recently took a party of five here and had a great experience. The AYCE menu was stocked full of essentials and the quality of fish was good. A hidden gem for anyone that enjoys simple AYCE sushi. They also have great chief specials and recommend honey bread for dessert.

The food here is delicious and super fire!!! I recommend this place for sushi lovers! 

-Item that was photographed is my favorite roll and that is called the golden philly!

I was craving sushi and needed a restaurant located halfway between the two of us, and Sushi Way was the ideal destination. Easily accessible and great reviews for their AYCE lunch. The menu was extensive and had numerous unfamiliar concoctions that appeared worthy to try. We certainly weren't let down as all were excellent in both presentations and taste. Ratio of rice to protein was good, and they even had rolls that were without rice like the exquisite "Cherry Blossom." Service was good (for the most part).  I would definitely go here again. One of the better AYCE joints in town.
Hands down.the freshest.Best sushi I have ever had. The owner takes.great.pride in his work and it shows!!!!!¡!!!!¡!

My fellow Yelpers did not steer me wrong! Excellent service and sushi! My first AYCE Sushi experience and this place didn't disappoint! I'm still skeptical of AYCE but would definitely come back here. They can split the sushi rolls if you start to exceed your limit. Ask for the quantity in some of the items if you want a large portion. They serve some things tapas style which I think is genius! They want to limit food waste which I appreciated. I also appreciated the large menu choices! They also are awesome for recommendations and again very friendly staff!
Amazing I've been searching for a tuna bowl (not roll) as good as the ones I had in like LAST 13 years  ago. Amazing customer service!!!!!!!
This is my third time back.  Food is great.  Service is great. It will not be my last.  Sit at the sushi bar~~I will come back..

Oh oh!!! I think I found a new favorite sushi spot. We sat at the bar and got real lucky by having an amazing sushi chef. His name was Ethan and he made this experience great! My boyfriend loves this place so I had to come try it for my self. We order a variety of rolls and nigiri. All were wonderful especially the yellowtail sashimi and the "oh Jenna" roll. Thank you Ethan for putting things together for us and making us try new things. Can't wait to come back :)

2nd time here on a Friday at 7:00 pm. Only one other party here. Excellent sushi, small rice. It's a nice atmosphere here with good music, air conditioning & good hot green tea even if it's 111 degrees outside. Oh & not noisy at all. Very chill tonight.

What can I say about this place except that it's the best sushi I've had in Vegas hands down! this is a must come to place if you are in Vegas and year this area you have to come here it's worth the trip!

Came on a Saturday night. Everything was poor quality, fishy ( not a good fishy ) the tempura was hard and overcooked. tasted stale. The only positive was that the servers were nice.  I will never come back here

I was anxious to try this place after reading the reviews. I was not disappointed!

It's nice to have a good AYCE joint in the area.

I came late at night. The service was stellar and the food was very good. The chef was eager to please when I told him that it was my first time and that I would try anything he recommended. Hopefully this place is here for a long time!

This place was fantastic! Fulfilled my sushi appetite with rolls, sushi ngiri, oyster shooters, white fish with jalapeño and then some! We were greeted and sat by this beautiful and set girl who explained their all you can eat dinner for $26.95 and that pretty much everything on the menu was included.  We started out with rolls (Sushi Solution, Chicago Fire, Rainbow Roll and I Love Sushi)...all delicious!  We topped it off with sides of Golbi, white fish with jalapenos, salmon ngiri..Before we could think of something else to get,  our server Jay just started bringing out extras for us to try including coconut shrimp, oyster shooters (interesting and not as horrible as I expected, although I didn't chew husband did and he thought it was great). 

Albeit, there were no the guests,  but being that they are open till 2am, we went during the old people's hour and the place gets hopping later on in the night.  Haha. ..either way,  definitely coming back during this visit!
You gotta try their sushi nachos, so bomb! Their pork belly was surprisingly good too, tasted like Filipino adobo with tons of fat on it
Great AYCE place - Lyle, the new guy who just started this evening killed it and was totally amazing and quick! Definitely a recommendation for a great sushi place off the strip. Great Job!
I dunno why this place receive this high review but I have been waiting for so long for food ! Omg! But we hav been waiting 30 min for one sushi roll!!! Is this normal?

The all you can eat is excellent. Do not let 'all you can eat' scare you. The quality and service are wonderful. The Sweet 16 & Kiss of Fire rolls are unreal and the fish is incredibly fresh. Highly recommend the yellow tail as well.
This is the best Sushi place ever!!! the price (AYCE) + great quality = Amazing!!!

Really nice servicers and beautiful decor. The sushi was delicious! The price was good for AYCE and the sushi was worth it. Their dessert option for Yuzu Sobert was a delight because I never seen it before and it was awesome. I will admit that it took a while to receive our food but it was worth it. Definitely will be coming back. Can't wait to bring people to try their sushi.

Great sushi. On time delivery. Everything was packaged well and tasted fresh even though I picked it up from the front of my hotel from the delivery girl. Ginger, wasabi, chopsticks, and soy sauce included!
First time eating here fish was so fresh and cold!!! Not one thing I ordered wasn't the best I ever had!! The owner/chef was so nice and on top of everything will tell everyone about this spot
Awesome food done by chefs in the zone. Had a la carte sashimi, huge chunks of fresh tuna, salmon and yellowish. Also had a big easy that was delicious.

The best sushi deal in Vegas, for 26.95 you can get all you can eat dinner, which even includes sea urchins and oysters (1 order per person). Every thing we tried was amazing quality!!! Thank you Chief Robin, you're the best :)

This is probably my most favorite sushi place to come to when I'm? in Vegas. Great food, extra cozy atmosphere, helpful waiters/waitresses, and did I mention good selection of music. "Reminisce a time" . Last but not least ask for Jane!

I must say, as a sushi snob, this place by farrrrr is my number one sushi spot. Wow. I read a review that they were usually skeptical about ayce sushi places, and I am too, but their ayce sushi here is legit! Wow. Everything is included. Lunch is $21.95 and dinner is $26.95. $50 for dinner sushi-appetizer, sides, rolls, sushi AND dessert. Can't go wrong here. Better try it when you're in Vegas!
Awesome.. Food is always fresh. The staff is super friendly.. The place is always super clean.. :).. Best spot for all you can eat close to the strip..

My pregnant wife was craving sushi, we came here and Jane gave us a few roll options that were safe for my wife to eat. We got the big easy special, the baked salmon (Jane requested they bake it longer), and a California roll. Everything tasted amazing and my wife was doing her happy dance. Will definitely come here again. Great food and great service! I recommend this place to any sushi lover.
Love the food here; great variety of roll selections. Taste is also very delicious. I would definitely recommend this place to my friends.

This place is awesome! My Uber driver (a local) recommended it when I was heading to my hotel;$26.95 for all you can eat from 4p-2a and everything I was served was terrific. I let my server Jay know my preferences and he put together a smorgasbord of great stuff (appetizers, rolls, sushi,etc.) He kept it coming and set up the next round based on my feedback; he was truly awesome (attentive, knowledgeable, pleasant demeanor, etc)

I would highly recommend this place to sushi fans that are looking for fantastic eats at a reasonable price!

Grymt sushi ställe med buffé möjlighet om man känner för det. Vi tog buffén med allt du kan äta för 26.95$. God sushi med bra kvalitet och fisk/ris ratio. Rekommenderas starkt för den som har stor aptit och vill äta fräsch sushi tills magen spricker!

Located near the strip, "Sushi Way" offers some decent sushi for a reasonable price, that is all you can eat. 

Look I'm not all that into sushi, I'll be upfront but I found myself enjoying some new stuff. 

No Edamame before my meal? That kida sucks.

The fried rice SUCKS! But maybe it was a bad batch.

The Sushi tasted fresh with good flavor.

I'm not the biggest fan of sushi, but I can say without hesitation it's ok.
Best all you can eat sushi and for such a good deal!! Definitely coming back!! We loved the Fat Ass and the Oh Jenna and ate 2 of eat!! So good!
Great customer service, rainbow roll was good and spicy garlic edamame had a fantastic flavor!!

Best sushi I have had in a LONG time. At first I was skeptical seeing it was all you can eat sushi- those typically only serve you all you can eat California roll or spicy tuna- however, Sushi Way lets you eat ANYTHING OFF THE ENTIRE MENU! Come in with a hungry belly. I ended up eating 6 half rolls (they offered half rolls so I could try more of everything I wanted)! Not to mention also had edamame... And amazing coconut shrimp! Save room for dessert bc their Mochi is some of the best. Everything was delicious. I highly recommend and will definitely be back here next time I'm in Vegas!

New spot I found on Yelp and decided to try out with my friend.  The AYCE menu is quite extensive and there only about 10 items that are limited to just a single order per person while the rest of the menu is unlimited.  The only reason why I have deducted a star is that when it gets really busy here, the wait times for your sushi will be LONG.  We nearly waited 30 minutes just to get a few rolls and some sashimi.  They also have a time limit but I am not sure if it is enforced since everyone is waiting for their orders.  To their credit though, the food is delicious and the service is friendly.  Not sure I would be back though due to the long waits.

All you can eat (AYCE) sushi?! "When you crave it, you must go!" I believe someone in a religious text quoted that.. The Book of Noms? Anyway, I digress.

Sushi Way is tucked into the Corporate Center in Vegas near all the other food choices. The service was excellent and the waitress/staff were all incredibly attentive. The food that came out was fresh, and tasted great (see all the photos of goodness in the review)! The lunch AYCE price was $21.95 I believe, and had pretty much everything on the menu up for grabs.

All-in-all, very good spot to stuff yourself silly. Be warned though, DO NOT WASTE FOOD. I think every household (including you who are currently reading this) has been scolded by your family as a youngin'. If you do it here, you will be charged.

All you can eat sushi for under $25.  Includes over 50 options from deep-fried, to tempura, to fresh fish.  They have basic crab rolls and also fancier, more exciting rolls which are filling and look great.  Cuts, rolls, and basic maki.  Gyoza, dessert, salads...all included.  Sushi Way is your typical AYCE sushi spot that has many options but most are more or less the same ingredients.  Tasty and for the price well worth it if you're looking to stuff yourself on rice and fish.  I usually prefer to spend more on higher quality sushi, but Sushi Way is very solid nonetheless.  They also offer a la carte if you just want some sushi east of the strip at a cheaper price.  And, don't forget the awesome names of some of the rolls.  Might be worth a stop in here just for the fantastic comedic menu creations.
Awesome awesome sushi for a great price. The service rocked and we didn't have one bad thing... Would totally go here every time!!
Awesome place! Gave it a try and truly not disappointed! If you are unsure of where you should go... Try this new place! Derive ok.

Three stars for me = good. Very average sushi-- I'm not sure why folks give four and five stars here. I had the AYCE sushi and discovered it was a matter of quantity over quality. My two rolls were sauced excessively--a sure sign the resto is hiding the flavor and texture of the fish it sells. My unagi roll was very average. The rice in all the rolls & nigiri I ordered did not taste really fresh and firm as it should. The seaweed salad and miso soup were fine and should never be an issue. 
I stopped in here b/c I was staying in the 'hood--it was close and convenient. If I'm back in the area and craving sushi, I will continue my search elsewhere. Oh, waitstaff was attentive and friendly--no issues here.
