Disgusting. Went to wash my hands in the bathroom and one of the sushi chefs was using the stall. Door was wide open. When I finished washing my hands, there was no paper towels. I watched the chef finish using the bathroom, not wash his hands and walk back in the kitchen and start preparing sushi. Immediately canceled my order and left. Will never return here. Less than 1 star.

Sushi  rolls were really good. I really liked the all you can eat selections. They have a wide variety of sushi rolls and tasty appetizers, however, the service was not great at all and they had a tendency to bring out the wrong food to the wrong tables from time to time. Also, the bathroom floors needed serious  cleaning . They took forever to bring out some of the extra items we ordered.

Don't think twice. This is my Top pick for AYCE Sushi in Las Vegas. They top every other joint because they are new on the scene and pretty much take every favorite like  screaming orgasm and yellowtail jalapeño, uni and Amaebi and put that on their menu. Then added premiums like salmon belly and toro. Cool sides like coconut shrimp.

This is an amazing Sushi place. The freshness of the seafood, the preparation, the presentation and the service are all five stars. After having eaten in excellent sushi places in California, I was skeptical about eating fresh sushi in the middle of the desert.  Sushi Way proved that you  can have a great cuisine, and one of the best if not the best in Vegas. Try any dish on the menu and you will not be disappointed!

The sushi rolls where amazing and the service was great. The server we had was amazing, she was so funny and charismatic. The guy who I'm guessing was the owner or the manager was also very energetic and nice. We tried several rolls and none of them disappointed us. We also tried the mussels, which were AMAZING, one order had 6 of them which was great. We were really happy about it because the other places we've been, only serve two as an order. Overall our experience was beyond words.
Definitely recommend Sushi Way!!! So many choices to choose from n it's really GOOD...The service is great our waitress had a good sense of humor.

Sushi way is a small place, but thats the only complaint. This is the best place to go for all you can eat. I like it better than kaya, yama, sakana, etc. The price is 27$ for dinner and 22$ for lunch. Pricer than the other places but def worth it. The quality of the fish is the best ive tasted in vegas and i love that they have unlimited orders of salmon belly. The service is A1 and it never seems to be crowded. This has been my new go to spot and i will be recommending it to all my friends. Two thumbs up!

For a spot that a group of seven friends and I chose on a whim, I am quite satisfied with Sushi Way although there's definitely some items that you should not order. The service was great, and the quality of the nigiri was great! Except the uni and oysters. I would NOT recommend those. 

We all did the AYCE dinner for $26.95. The atmosphere is a bit dim lit. And just a heads up, they include an 18% gratuity charge for groups larger than six. We also called ahead to check on the wait time, and there wasn't a wait on a Saturday night so our hangry butts immediately headed over. 

As soon as we got there, we placed orders for salmon nigiri, fresh water eel nigiri, fresh oysters (DON'T GET THESE), baked mussels (don't recommend these either), udon (this was good!), miso soup, garlic edamame (DANK!!), mackerel, uni (it was an oddly creamy texture), halibut nigiri, yellow nigiri, and some rolls.

Overall, it's an average AYCE sushi spot. It's most definitely not the best I've ever had but also not the worst. Great service though!

All you can eat sushi was about $26. Service was a bit slow, but they were extremely busy so it was understandable. They also only allow 1 dessert per person and it came in a really small portion so did not quite finish my meal with an exclamation mark. Would definitely recommend this place in the future.

This place is awesome!

We went on a Saturday evening (10pm). It wasn't packed and we were seated at the bar right away. The chef there was super friendly and told us what was fresh for the day and what the best sellers were. 

The ayce option is great- their yellowtail, fatty salmon, and eel were the best in my opinion. We also get one order of uni and sweet shrimp per order. Those were really fresh.

One thing that separates this place from others- service. The owner was there at 10pm on a Saturday. She seems really dedicated to the business and actually didn't leave until
She made sure everyone's water was refilled even though she had told her team she was going home 10 minutes earlier. That's dedication!

Next time I'm back in Vegas I'll make sure to come back. It's only about a mile off strip.

Had the all you can eat sushi lunch at Sushi Way a few weeks ago and was very happy with my experience. Unlike a typical buffet, you're seated at a table and order from the many. Rolls are prepared quickly, so pace yourself and order two or three dishes at a time. A great deal at $22 for lunch - you can order from both sides of the menu which includes standard rolls, specialty rolls, fried rolls, and your staple menu items such as edamame, miso soup, etc. 

There is a catch, though! It's all you can eat for an HOUR and you must finish everything you order or they will charge you for waste. Come hungry, pace yourself, and enjoy!
Great sushi for a great price. Second time here and will continue coming back. "Snow White" is a must!!
Highly recommend this place. The all you can eat is good. The fish is fresh. Verizon was an awesome sushi chef. P.s ask him for his special rolls. Been to many sushi places. This is in my top three.

This place was absolutely amazing!  It was worth every penny considering it's one set price for all you can eat sushi!  Our waiter was great and the bartender/chef was even more amazing!  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone and everyone!

Excellent! Followed recommendations from Yelp and this place was fantastic! Our waiter was great and very personable! I've been to quite a few AYCE sushi places that take forever to get you your rolls. Not here high quality and fast!

Amazing place. I came here for my late night bday dinner and loved it! Great customer service, good environment, DELICIOUS rolls; Tiger roll was sooo good. The waitress, Kini, was very friendly and very attentive. She recommended the Honey bread and it's a MUST for dessert! I came from LA and I'm a sushi lover. Sushi Way is one of the best!

Excellent service, great quality food! The staff was friendly and the chefs prepare the food rather quickly but to quality standards. Sizeable menu which includes sashimi with the all you can eat, so they are not trying to fill you up with rice. Make sure you try the honey bread for dessert. Definitely recommending to local friends and anyone visiting that wants great quality sushi at a great price!
I can't wait to go and eat here again . The best bag for your buck in Vegas! The food was awesome! A must try!

Was in Vegas to meet up with my mom and sister and we were all craving sushi, but being on a budget could not begin to fathom the prices at any of the options on the strip.

So I put a search out to good old Yelp, and this place came up with good reviews and the price was right at $26 for AYCE dinner. I called up Sushi Way to see if I needed to make a reservation.. since it was a Friday night, but was told there was no need. Fantastic!

This place is right off the Las Vegas Strip (only about a 20 in walk from Planet Hollywood Hotel). So we were on our way!

Let me tell you, I was a little nervous for it being in a small strip mall, but do not let that deter you!!.. This place is amazing, with really fresh seafood.

The menu is the perfect size with lots of options for every taste preference. The best part is that they offer 1/2 rolls so you can try more options! I love this option, wish more places offered this!!

Don't know what you want... the staff is great at providing suggestions!

My faves of the night: the Big Easy, Volcano, DD, Green Monster,  Gyoza (pot stickers),  Jalapeno poppers, Bacon Scallop Skewers (so yummy!!)

As for the desert, only had space for a few spoonfuls of the Yuzu Sorbet, this was so refresing, wished I had saved more room to finish this.

So when in Vegas and wanting sushi at a reasonable price, this is the place to go!!

i lived in vegas for 3years now.
best sushi place in Vegas!!! food is great!
! i will come here again for sure!!! 
clean and yummy!!

AYCE is really good. The Volcano pieces were huge. Nigiri salmon, tuna and shrimp were excellent. The rolls had more sushi. Perfect combination fish/rice. You can also order half roll what is perfect when you want to try different things. The price is reasonable compared to what you can find in Las Vegas.

Other suggestions: Dragon roll, shrimp lover.

Every time I go to Vegas I eat essentially only sushi. I'm really glad I found this place. This sushi is amazing! They make it right in front of you and everything I had on the menu was amazing!  From spicy tuna to the dragon roll. I will definitely be back here the next time I'm in Vegas!
This place was amazing, and sooooo worth it! Leaving the strip and venturing to this place was the best decision...

I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this place! The sushi was fresh and SO good! The service was amazing and their "all-you-can-eat" includes EVERYTHING from their menu for only $26! Definitely recommend!

Great sushi place to eat...love their speedy service for an all you can eat place the fish quality is great...the waitress and chefs are great pleasant and just all around great place to eat...i just had to come back cuz i had a great experience the first time

Great all you can eat menu for a great price. I will definitely come back.

Also, if sake is your thing. This place has a great selection and also sake coolers which are tasty. Lychee was tasty.

This place is a must go if you're in town.

Take it from a guy that has been over 50+ times to Sushi Mon (according to check-ins)  This is the best AYCE sushi place in town right now.  Jun has opened a great place with remarkable service and great tasting food.  Some people have complained about the wait time, He has hired more peeps and the wait time has been cut down considerably.  For the value and the great taste and cuts of fish, you can't beat Sushi Way.  The hamachi Kama is huge and full of meat.  Poke is great.  hand rolls are wonderful and the Negiri sushi is like any other nice sushi place you would go.  His play on tempura shrimp (coconut tempura shrimp) is great also.  For the value and the great food, I highly recommend Sushi Way.  Don't forget the honey bread dessert!

I was looking for a great place to eat all u can eat sushi my friend recommended this place so I said let's give it a shot .....Not a chance I started with a ice cold Azahi that arrived fast  then I proceeded to order sides poke salad, tempura calamari, and a crispy tuna rice, it took 35 minutes before I got all 3 sides then the sushi chef asked if he could start a roll which was nice but 40 minutes before u start a roll when u only get 90 minutes all u can eat then I ordered a nigiri Salmon , yellow tail, and tuna, and a caterpillar roll that never made it Then I was being rushed by the server that had a bad attitude she insisted 2 times if I was ready so After the second time I ordered a mango mochi  Ice cream , the bill came before I got my dessert so I paid this is how bad this place is the sushi chef didn't notice I had paid my bill after 30 minutes I was waiting on my caterpillar roll he calls me sir your roll is ready I smiled and said I'm finished I paid my bill....This place sucks is a totally don't come here and waste your money on bad service and flavorless food and the sushi chef was not even wearing gloves totally a health violation....on ready to eat foods.... don't come here and risk getting sick because they don't follow health code regulations...Thank you I will never return.....and a piece of advice to the owners you need to seriously train your staff because these  employees you have are going to make you go out of business and shut your doors real soon!!!

Went here with some friends to try out a new AYCE sushi place since we wanted to shake things up a bit. This location is near the strip and is located in a small plaza, so be sure to make the turn at the light because I thought I could just turn directly in, but there is no other entrance.

For lunch they only give you 60 minutes to order your food so make sure you have your whole party with you to maximize the time. I ordered a couple of rolls, but I wasn't really impressed with any of them since I've had much better. The only item I would highly recommend getting is the sushi nachos which is basically a bunch of raw fish stacked on top of a tortilla chip (think of it as a seafood tostada). The rice to fish ratio is alright, but they could cut down on the rice a bit. Also, you can only get one dessert item per person. They are really stingy!

The service was both good and bad. The male waiter is very nice and attentive while the Korean lady really needs to brush up on her customer service. I called her over to just order a seaweed salad and the cucumber salad since I wanted something refreshing with my sushi rolls. The first thing she says is "oh, but you already ordered a lot." First of all, my orders were all half rolls and I was only ordering two light appetizers. Secondly, doesn't she realize that I was doing the AYCE menu? I'd be more understanding if I ordered a bunch of stuff, but I was being rather conservative for the first round. Luckily she took my order, but I've never had that kind of experience before. It just sucks that she is the one to take the orders, while the guy can only clean up or give more water. If the service was better on the lady's end I would have considered giving a higher rating.

Overall, I would not recommend this place. The food is alright, but I would recommend going to Sushi Twister or Sakana. Trust me on  this one lol.

Great price on the all you can eat and wide selection

Sushi was fresh and prepared prefect 

Friendly staff
Easy parking 
Clean
Friendly staff and they had a great menu. My mom was not a hard sore sushi eater and the staff went out of their way to find something she would enjoy.  I would go back.
First time here. Service is good and food is excellent! Not too much rice and excellent grade sushi! My new sushi joint!

Ok first of all I go many places to eat sushi and this one just got on the top of my list so far! LET ME TALK ABOUT THEIR SERVICE. My friend and I came an hour before closing so literally 5 mins before last call (I know I'm sorry) so we ordered everything right then and there ... FOOD CAME SO FAST and they were so nice about it !!! The best rolls are the sushi lover's, Johnny, Japanese lasagna- all mindblowing! They have the best super white tuna (you can ask for it without the vinegar thing) and EBI shrimp nigiri ofcourse! For the dessert PLEASE GET THE HONEY BREAD !!! Oh my gosh, everything was amazing especially service ! 
The sushi chefs just laughed with us and had funny small talk while they were starting to clean the stations :)
I made sure we were fast since they were closing and I made sure to tip our server very well! Wish I could've gotten her name because she was amazing!
Was really good sushi and good price for Vegas . Not a crazy crowd but lots of traffic in and out. Had a lot of options and everything we got was amazing.

Great tucked away gem, off the strip. All you can eat sushi and other items off the menu. The guy behind the bar rolling the sushi was so fast at getting the rolls out. He made sure we left full. The quality of sushi was good too. So many rolls to pick from, primo service and delicious to boot. I will make this a regular spot when in Vegas. Don't let the fact that it's in a strip mall detour you. Worth a visit for great sushi!

The sushi was prepared very quickly without sacrificing any quality.  I had an hour lunch break at conference.  Easily made it back to conference in time.  I didn't do all you can eat, but guy beside us at sushi bar was.  It looked to be like a great deal if that kind of thing is for you.

Absolutely delicious food! Quick and friendly service in a nice and clean environment. I will definitely be coming back. 
I loved the sushi solution roll as well as the volcano roll. They were the stand out rolls among the other already fantastic dishes.
Great food! Excellent service! Wonderful experience!  The ALL YOU CAN EAT is a must!  If you are looking for warm, exciting, and cozy this is your destination.
Great sushi, great staff, clean location and good prices. I will come back here for sure! Lots of choices on the menu and the AYCE dinner menu looks even better!

Las Vegas, sushi ,right, it's  off the coast of Nevada. 

I was advised to find a good Japanese  restaurant  with raw fish, Me entiendes?
Well after a bit of research and people asking while hiking, this was my choice for my only real meal this trip to Vegas. Heard there were lots of shitty sushi places on the strip and this was a Vegas local favorite, just a short distance where tourists don't go. Well I have never been steered wrong with this advise.

Wow, in all honesty some of the best poké I have had that was not in  the south Pacific. Really really good quality tuna . The seared salmon app was pretty good as well.  Short ribs were decent. Salad, miso were pretty standard. Yellow tail was good, the escolar was good, I forget what it was called as I did not order it, but is was good.

I wish I could have eaten more, but man I'm  not so much the fat boy anymore.  In my raw fish experience this was really,really good. In Vegas,LA. or where ever, you blow a ton of cash for raw fish, but I'm not so sure it's worth it.  Let's  just use a bit of logic, in the USA where are you getting same day fish, cut real time?

So if you want good   fish at this price point, I'm pretty sure you can not do much better in a land locked desert paradise of sin, than what we experienced, and I know my raw fish.

My taste buds are off right now so have to disclose that first. I had yellowtail tuna first and it was amazing. I just didn't like much after that with the exception of the coconut shrimp tempura. Since my taste buds are off, I didn't take off for that. A couple of things to note that I didn't read anywhere. On the menu it said no leftovers. I thought it meant you could not take leftovers on AYCE. Makes sense. I found out that it meant you have to eat all the plate to get other things. Different than other AYCE I had gone to. You can share with anyone in your group getting AYCE too. Alas, I was traveling alone so I didn't have that advantage. The waitress was a bit rude about it but let me do leave some. So you must know you are going to like it before you order. I did half orders which helped but I don't know how I would know if I would have liked something new without tasting it. Wish it would have been explained better when I sat down espically since they get lots of tourists. With that said, I really liked the food and would go back now that I understand the rules better. The yellowtail tuna was like butter. I had like 8 pieces and it was hard to stop. Could not get enough.

we were craving sushi and  it was our last day in Vegas so we checked it out. The reviews are more than accurate! It was Delicious fast and we had the best service by Monica! I'm now craving for more of their sushi and dessert! Amazing team work by both servers and chefs. I'm looking forward to return to Vegas so we can come back to sushi way.
Good food. What you expect from a sushi buffet. I ordered take out and I thought it was pretty solid. Good place to go to get your sushi fix
Great prices, open late, great service and clean. Came here for a late night sushi craving at 1:30am and I was pleasantly surprised!

Trying out new place for all you can eat sushi. They have really good stuff here. My favorite is super white tuna with jalapenos. I like their tuna poke and sexy lady special.
I would've given them 5 stars but the oyster took a long time to come out and also our last order consists of shrimp, sweet shrimp and tamago order. It took about 15 minutes gap in between.
Service is good. You do have to ask for more tea from the server even tho you are paying $2.50 for hot tea.
For dessert, we got honey toast and yuzu sorbet. Yuzu sorbet is a great way to finish the meal. Very light and refreshing!
We were there for about 2 hours, longer than I wanted to but the food was good so can't complain much.

Another 5 star review because this is hands down the best all you can eat (AYCE) sushi I have ever had.  Incredible.  The sushi maker and waitresses were very friendly and on-point, the food was out of this world.  I decided early in the evening to let the sushi maker pick the rolls for me - because they were so good.  Not one wasn't top notch.  This is a Vegas-off the strip-must go spot.  A+

We came here immediately after getting off the plane, starving and craving sushi, and we weren't disappointed. It's a nice, clean little place and the staff was very friendly and attentive. Each roll we had was delicious and they didn't skimp on the fish. I would highly recommend this little place!

This is my first review and I promise I don't give out give stars easy.  This place though, THIS PLACE!! By far the best I've had since moving back from Japan.  Only open for two months!? You would swear these guys have been at it for decades.  The sushi is spot on and fresh.  The menu is full of legit items.  The best part? ALL YOU CAN EAT FOR $26!  I will always come here when ever I'm in town! My tip? Get the all you can eat, sit at the bar, tell them to make whatever they want and watch the magic happen.  You will not be disappointed. I promise!

The Korean old waitress is so rude!!! She doesn't greet or smile and never say thank you or sorry. She got us a wrong item so we told her that we didn't order it. She said nothing. Since I don't like to waste food, I said I can eat it to be nice and she said nothing. Seriously??

AND she said I can't order my favorite Alaskan rolls without crab! Even after I told her I have crab allergy, she said I can reduce the amount of crab but I "have to" eat it!! She laterally said that!!! WTF???Seriously???? Even tho you guys say on the menu that you guys would make a custom roll???? So what if I ask you to make a roll with salmon, cucumber,and avocado? Would I still have to eat it with crab??? Lame. 
 After I said then forget it, she asked the chef and he said he can make it w/o crab( of course! Why not?) But I never expected to be told to eat something I am allergic to in any restaurants so I was so shocked! Also, in almost all the restaurants(as far as I know), they 
normally don't put crab meat in Alaskan rolls anyway!!! 

Also when we went to have a lunch there, it was almost empty but each order took about 10-15 min to come!!! So ridiculous!!!! I really wanted to love this place but I can't. I don't think I will never go back there. They are Korean so they don't know how to make sushi and cut fish right. But their fish quality was actually good for ayce, so If the service was better, I would give them another chance, but never! I will never go back to the restaurant that tells me to eat what I physically can't. Or unless she leaves the restaurant, or they train her right!!

I happen to go on a very slow night. Now I'm okay with waiting, but when there's no one around and the employees are just joking around it's frustrating to wait 10 minutes to get a seat. Then we waited another 10 minutes to finally order our drinks, which we happen to order some rolls afterwards. We ordered one specific roll but got two, talked to a lady about it she said it was fine to just take it to go. ((We went during dinner hours)) after we revived the bill I was surprised it came out to 73$. Then I noticed she charged the roll and insisted we asked for two. The sushi was alright I kind of regret wanting to try something new.
Yummy food and creative rolls! Only wish the food came out faster. A little pricey too, but worth it in my opinion. Honey bread dessert was so good.

A great place to have an All-You-Can-Eat sushi dinner!
Very friendly and fast service, fresh and great tasting sushi selections, nice ambience, ... The list goes on.
I love sushi and consider myself an above average sushi expert, and this place delivers!  Very fresh fish, good rice preparation, good balance of fish portion vs rice.  Sushi pieces are a bit on the small size, but for an AYCE, this works to  It is not a big place and can get crowded quickly, and so go a little early in the evening if possible.  Coconut shrimp and raw oysters safe wonderful side dishes, too. Galbi is also a great addition, though it is a sushi restaurant. Highly recommend!

The food was great and the sushi chef was friendly and did a great job with presentation. Had some sushi and a few rolls with hot saki. Tasted great. The volcano roll had a milder taste than expected. But without comparing it to any other place, still a good roll. The place had a clean and comfortable feel. Would have been 5 stars had the waitress not forgotten to put our order in for an hour. Sushi chef more than made up for it!

I could make this a long review because there is a lot to say... But it's simple, BEST quality sushi and most creative rolls I've ever had for AYCE. If it wasn't AYCE and I had paid full price it would have still been worth it... And this is from someone who's tried, Nobu, Katsu-ya, Izakaya. Great service at bar, TRY IT!
My new favorite AYCE in town! They just opened not long ago. Atmosphere is very open and cool. Come check it out~ they have great food and service! :)
Good service, get the fried ice cream. I ordered the salmon killer roll and the I love sushi roll and did not like either of them.

I've been to many sushi places in Vegas ranging from cheap to the VERY expensive and Sushi Way is still very the best sushi in Vegas! Better quality food and great friendly staff. I bring everyone to Sushi Way.
*the super white tuna is the best!!

The sushi here is average, the service is a little slow, and the AYCE is overpriced at $27 per person. They didn't bring out 2 or 3 of my orders, and the place was only about half full. They were also completely out of mochi and many of the desserts. My ice cream also came out half melted for some reason? 

Overall, I agree with the people who say the fish is fresh, but not enough to make up for the service or price.

Great place. Very quick and fresh. I am from Reno and am an AYCE sushi snob, and both price and quality are on par. I am a big fan of nigiri, and theirs is super fresh. No need for heavy sauce, but the rolls are good too. So much better than the trendy little sushi bars on the strip.

Yumm alert!

You like all you can eat sushi? Can you stuff it in your pie hole (sushi hole) in an hour? You betcha!

For about $26 bucks for dinner, one person, no sharing, finish in an hour ANYTHING on the menu'. Challenge accepted!

My dining guest does not eat sushi.... sadly... however, he did have some amazing pot stickers as well as some tasty katsu chicken; so there is something on the menu for our non sushi eating friends.

Here is a tip as well....... you can order half sizes of the rolls! If you are anything like me you want to try as much as your sushi tummy can handle! Also, beer drinking is fun, but it does have a tendency to make that rice expand in your belly, so stick to water or their amazing tea... 

Lunch is around $21 smackers, all you can eat, no sharing... you get the idea...

Oh yes I will be back!

Love this place. I took my boyfriend here for his birthday and we were so happy with the freshness of the sushi and the service was amazing. The waitress even secretly connived with me in preparing my boyfriend's bday song and cake. They also have a variety of sushi's not tasting the same unlike the other sushi buffets.

A wonderful addition to the AYCE sushi scene in Vegas!

It's very conveniently located not far from the strip and not far from the convention center. The 3 of us came for lunch one afternoon to satisfy our sushi cravings! My friend was raving about this place, so I had to come and try it. 

Prices $21.95 for lunch and $26.95 for dinner. Lunch does not include sweet shrimp, uni and some of the other expensive items. Minus 1 star. We started with a bunch of sushi items on the sushi list. The fish was incredibly fresh, and each one had a long piece of fish on top of a piece of rice. The fish wasn't thick but definitely larger than many of the other AYCE places. The super white tuna just melts in your mouth, so good! The scallop sushi was made with real scallops, the smaller ones and definitely very fresh also. We followed the sushi with a bunch of rolls, and each one was made well and tasted great!  

Service was decent, I did have to ask for refilled a few times. Free soda with Yelp check-in which is awesome. Dessert options were good. The sweet toast with ice cream was yummy. Bathrooms were clean, parking was easy. Definitley recommend!

Great AYCE!! Its not exactly on the strip but if you are willing to drive a bit this place is totally worth it!!
I will be coming back when i come to Vegas!!!

I've already been here a few times and have yet to make a review. So I have been to many sushi spots here in Vegas. Sakana, Umiya, Kaya, Yama, Twister, Goymon, and a few others I can't think of right now, but let me tell you that this is thee best Ayce Sushi in town period! Best Nigiri the quality of the fish is exceptional. Many amazing rolls and appetizers to choose from. Highly recommend getting the Yellowtail belly and Salmon belly if your into Nigiri. Amazing will keep coming, found a serious gem!

Today they had an all you can eat special. Everything I tried was prepared to perfection. I had Philadelphia, Rainbow, and a few other special rolls, dumpling, ribs, egg rolls, and even ice cream. The workers operated at a team. I never had to wait or ask, they were on it. Food was prepared quickly. Top top it all off, everything was reasonably priced.

Meh. Well, I guess for being in the middle of the desert you could do worse when it comes to getting sushi. 

I decided to order off the menu rather than go for all you can eat. Rolls were overpacked with rice and tiny pieces of fish.
Came here based on Yelp reviews, and it didn't disappoint. They had the best Albacore sushi I've ever had; if you come, you must try it!!

If I could give more stars, I would. Staff is so friendly, our sushi chef "Choo choo" was a hoot! He made us incredibly delicious rolls and kept us laughing the entire night. From California on vacation, but frequent vegas vacationers. DEFINITELY WILL BE BACK!!! The fish is so fresh, this might beat home (ironically, we live at the beach, who knew!) Love sushi way!!!
Awesome sushi, specially my other half very picky when it comes to sushi. I love the server very quick & friendly. First time that we barely use the soy sauce because the flavor is so good

My friend recommended this AYCE sushi spot to me and I would have to say this will be included in my top 5 go to's. 

Walking in, this definitely has that typical sushi restaurant feel with a bar. The waitress immediately sat us down and provided menus to my buddy and I. We didn't even have to wait long to get her to take our orders either. It's like she had Psychic powers because she was always on top of her game serving us when checking if we need anything.

Sorry Richard, we got ourselves a waitress who knows how to keep her customers happy lol. She strikes up a conversation on her free time to make our experience a lot better for not only the food, but the welcoming personality. A+ for her service!! 

My friend definitely showed me great expectations for their Sushi and fusion specialties. We did AYCE for $26 and got free drinks for writing a review/rating them on yelp. Ask about their stamp cards. When you get 10, next visit is free.

Don't forget to try their tempura ice cream and there's no limit to trying each of their desserts. Usually most Sushi restaurants only limit you to one dessert per customer... 

Take a look at my photos to see all the delicious food I had.

Stopped by for lunch on a Friday afternoon with some friends. I wasn't coming in to try their AYCE that day but once we were seated there was no lunch menu to be found. Make sure to specifically ask for it. The rest of my friends tried the AYCE. 

I ordered the chicken teriyaki bento ($9). It comes with: chicken teriyaki, 4 California rolls, 2 gyozas, 4 pieces of vegetable tempura, a very small portion of potato salad, salad and miso soup. Although it was a good amount of food, nothing stood out to me. 

One big thing that bothered us was the service. The busser was very friendly however our waitress...not so much. After my friend placed his first round of orders in, he called her back because he forgot to order some side dishes. She commented that "you already ordered a lot." I understand that most places want to make sure you only order what you can eat but this was the wrong way of going about it. You can also only order 1 dessert item :(


I'm going to have to come back here and try the AYCE menu. Especially the coconut shrimp and sushi nachos, the two stand out items my friends mentioned.

Been here 3 times, and every time the food was on point! 

Awesome sushi. Wonderful flavors, fresh fish and good rice to fish portions. Seared Salmon Nigiri and the Garlic Yellowtail were particularly good.

This place is kind of hidden from the limelight of the LV Strip but it is well worth the short travel if you're craving sushi. The AYCE is averagely priced as is the quality of fish. Service was fast, staff is friendly, and AC is always a plus in Vegas.

P.S. The dessert menu is a part of the AYCE,  but it's only one order per person.

This is my first ever Yelp review. I usually just check in but this place was just so great. My boyfriend and I come from Vancouver, Canada so we know what's up when it comes to good, affordable Japanese food. We were really pleasantly surprised. Food is fresh and tasty, and the value - in both quantity and quality - really cannot be beat. Service was super attentive, and the staff very friendly. All around A plus plus :)

3.75***

Unfortunately YELP does not allow for 1/2 stars!

Unlike most of the other AYCE Sushi places, this one is not too far from the Strip!

I thoroughly enjoyed the all the nigiri here, they even have Salmon Belly in the AYCE!
- Fresh Scallops were very good....one of the best I had at an AYCE
- Loved the Sushi Nachos...very creative with tons of flavor.
- Bacon Scallop skewer was tiny...gone in a couple of bites...
- The Salmon Tar Tare was gone in one bite as well...creative and tasty!

The service is decent. This is where they get docked the .25 Stars...lol
There is a Korean lady that is a bit rough around the edges...
For dessert I asked her for the Green Tea Tempura...but instead got the regular ice cream...wasn't really interested in making a big deal about it...its fine.

Other that than...Nothing to really complain about...

I will be back.
Best AYCE sushi I've had in Vegas.  Great selection and the AYCE menu includes a variety of plates, including non-sushi ones (nigiri, side dishes, etc.)
Killer lunch specials, great service. Totally worth the walk from the strip. Try the Sexy Lazy, you won't be disappointed.
Great service && the food is always delicious! Try their pork belly appetizer! It's super yummy
Delivery was on time and correct. The volcano roll is to die for it was still warm when delivered. Overall great experience!
Excellent sushi.  Great menu. Friendly accommodating people work there I highly recommend

Sushi Way is my go-to neighborhood AYCE sushi bar. It may not have the best sushi all the time, but it satisfies my cravings and I'm always able to get in without having to wait 1-2 hours unlike Goyemon or Kaya. I believe lunch is $22 and dinner is $27. Like most AYCE sushi restaurants in Vegas, you get a few extra premium items with the dinner price such as the uni, oysters, sweet shrimp, as well as galbi and the screaming orgasm. They always have daily specials, which has always included a type of sashimi with jalapenos. In the past, this has included the super white tuna and yellowtail. 

The best things to order at Sushi Way include the nigiri and a few of the side dishes. I've never had a bad experience with any of the fish. I tend to stay away from the regular or specialty rolls as they usually have a ton of rice and cream cheese. However, if you are tempted to try one, they do offer half rolls. Some of my favorite side dishes include the coconut shrimp tempura (must order every visit), baked green mussels, bacon scallop skewer, and seaweed salad. Of the specialty rolls, I've only tried a few variations of the soft shell crab for fun. 

Their dessert menu includes green tea ice cream, yuzu sorbet, mochi, tempura ice cream, and honey bread. I usually stick to the green tea ice cream or strawberry mochi. The tempura becomes complete mush and the yuzu sorbet is too icey. Don't forget to check-in on the Yelp app for a free soda. They do have time limits for meals, but I've never experienced them enforcing the rules.

I'm just going to keep this nice and short:

BEST AYCE sushi place ever! If you can, just sit at the bar. This was my 5th time here in the last 5 months. Ivan behind the bar is very cool and very talented. All the fish is very fresh for AYCE. Great customer service. 

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. Stop reading. Just come here and try for yourself.

I have developed a true appreciation for well-done sushi, & this place does not disappoint.
  The problem that I have with  restaurants (provided, of course, that their food is well-done- fresh, good proportions, variety of ingredients, decent-sized pieces, & preferrably at least a couple of rolls that set them apart from their competitors) is that I tend to find 1 or 2 rolls that I particularly like, but I don't want to have to travel from 1 place to the next to get a full meal. Plus, I prefer AYCE- takes the stress off.
  This place is my current favorite- living up to my requirements, plus having several interesting rolls. 
  The only suggestion I would make is to add a dessert roll. Preferably something with bananas
  Professional but fun staff. Even when they are painfully understaffed, tgewy manage to be pleasant & friendly (I've only seen this happen once). Sit at the bar for a more personal experience
Jane is by far the best waitress I have ever had. She is very helpful and energetic. I will for sure come back and try the amazing food again.
Great place,  food 5'*****. Fresh.Great customer service. Price are reasonable. Definitely will be our favorite sushi place in Las Vegas.

We're in Vegas for the week and got lucky we found this place..It's all you can eat sushi is amazing. Truly fresh sushi and they don't over stuff the fish with rice; unlike so many other places. We liked it so much we had it 3 days in a row!! The atmosphere inside was very nice and the lady taking care of us made us feel at home. She recommended different speciality roles for us to try, it all tasted great!!
Great service, delicious fish and quick and attentive service. Everything you would expect and want when visiting an ayce sushi restaurant! We will be back!
Upon entering we were greeted by friendly service and seated right away.  Our server was very attentive and the atmosphere was Amazing!

We came on a Saturday night so of course it was gonna be busy.. however once we walked in the door another party was already waiting and no one greeted us. Then we were finally greeted by the chef, not the hostess to have a seat at the sushi bar. Then, we looked at the menus while we waited to order. Everything had a description and looked pretty good. We tried a few rolls, the have the Sex Bomb, Crunch and Lasagna which are my favorites at Kaya. This is the same price as Kaya ($27) and I felt like it included more. I ordered the oysters which were dabbed with Siracha. They were so good! The rolls themselves were good but the part lacking is seriously customer service. We waited for water, to take our plates away.. There's no hostess here and the phones were ringing off the hook. I liked coming here but the customer service even made a party of 3 decide to leave after not being seated. Overall, I think I would come back.
When the boss in the all you can it sushi is Korean, it is always good to visit.

This was phenomenal! 
We were worried about "all you can eat" sushi, but this was just unbelievably good. You can order almost anything off the menu including appetizers and deserts.
The sushi nachos were one of my favorite dishes, great flavor, loaded with fresh tuna and a tangy sauce.

The fried coconut shrimp were also to die for, you almost don't even need the sauce to go with it. Very light and just a hint of sweetness.

The rolls were um... Amazing so good and so filling, we were committed to not over eating but this place made that a challenge. 

The only thing we didn't like was the mochi ice cream, the texture was just not the way it should be.

If your in the mood for sushi swing on by.
Delicious all you can eat lunch for $22. Unreal. I ate 70$ worth of salmon. Great salmon. Chefs were cool too, kept telling me what to try next.

Seriously one of the best all you can eat sushi restaurants! I definitely recommend it to anyone who loves sushi! I'm not from here, but when I come back down here, I know where I am planning on going everytime!
Went here for dinner and loved it!  All the food were fresh and delicious.  My son says he rated this place a 5 stars.  For three person $88, which was not bad.  Highly recommend this place.

I'm a pretentious foodie that is very hypercritical and 5 stars is almost unheard of from me. All you can eat for under $30 ???? Must be crap right?...Wrong! Good quality saki, great vibe and sushi rocks. Be patient and not overwhelmed when ordering , the menu can overwhelm you . I've never been to a sushi bar in my life with better value.

Not the greatest ayce sushi, just average.  Had a lot better everywhere else.  The service was good and attentive, but the food was ok.  The coconut shrimp was probably the best dish I had there.  The plus was that it is close to the strip.
All of the fishes and food were fresh and delish! Wonderful server (super down to earth). Chefs are kind, smiley, and welcoming. When I visit Vegas again, I'll be back :D

OMG sooooo good! Best AYCE sushi in town! Everything was on point!  I read some of the hater reviews. Im not sure what they were eating, because i have 0 complaints on the food. The only thkng that wasnt the best is the service. We got a girl that was on her 2nd day. So she forgot some rolls, mixed them up, and ended up having to switch with another server. Im sure once she has been there a few more days it will be perfect!!

I was super excited to try this place. I'm always looking for new AYCE sushi restaurants and usually Yelp doesn't let me down. However, I was disappointed tonight. 

The service - Our server was training a new person. Both of them were nice, but about halfway through the meal our server let the trainee take over and she didn't seem to have any idea about the menu, which roll was which, or even basic sushi terminology. Also, at one point the sushi chef told our server to not let us order more until we were finished with what was on the table... Since I don't really like sushi rolls, and I had finished all the nigiri I ordered, I had to wait until my 3 other dinning companions had finished their rolls. I've never experienced that before. 

The food - Very underwhelming. We started with some apps... The mussels were okay, nothing special, and had way too much eel sauce. The salmon tartare was super bland, but the nachos were flavorful. The hamachi kama was over cooked, but the portion size was good. Tempura was just ok, too. The best one was the poke, it was spicy and full of flavor, but when we ordered a second one it wasn't spicy at all. They were like two completely different dishes.
All of the rice was super mushy. I tried to order a spicy scallop hand roll but they wouldn't make it for me. They gave me a yum yum scallop roll instead, that had absolutely no flavor. I can't really speak to the rolls, but as we were leaving, one of my friends said he wouldn't go back because he wasn't impressed with the rolls he had. 

Overall, it was such a disappointing experience. We'll be sticking to Sushi Mon or Goyemon for our late night AYCE sushi fix.

Service staff were wonderful ! We also had the all you can eat lunch and everything we ordered was done pretty well and tasted quite good. Glad they had a section for sushi with no rice, we tried one with nachos which sounded odd, salsa and fish? But it was our favourite and we had to order another serving of it.

On a Friday evening we got seats at the bar right away.  Our waitress was fast and helpful the whole night.  Our chef was great and was on top of our orders right away.  The green mussels were so good.  The chef even recommended certain things based on what we liked, which was cool.  The sushi was really good, but not the best I've had which is the only reason it's not a 5.  Will definitely be back though.

This has been my go to sushi place since around the time it opened. It's always been great for good quality fish and good quality portions of fish. Their waiters are super friendly and it's definitely one of the best AYCE in town, and I've done AYCE on just about every side of town.

The last few times it's been a bit inconsistent with sushi chefs that change every single time and when I get nigiri the fish temperature is almost room temperature instead of chilled as it should be. The food is still good, but the rolls have been more inconsistent since every time we go it's different sushi chefs that don't seem to have as much training. If the fish were chilled properly and the rice to fish ratio were consistent between chefs I think this would be a 5 star review. I do love that they offer punch cards which gives you a great incentive to keep coming back!

Went here for ayce dinner. About $27 a person without tax. I wanted to take pictures but we devoured the food so fast. 

There was a great selection of rolls with really creative names as well as sides and appetizers to choose from. Rolls were too saucy for my taste. I am not a big sushi expert but I love the thick cuts of fish and how they melt in your mouth! Next time, I'll definitely get more of that. Desserts were pretty good. I got the mochi ice cream which was small so the perfect size after ayce.

Service was a bit slow. The restaurant was small with two to three servers. Every time we need something, it was a bit annoying trying to get the server's attention. However, our food came out pretty quickly!

Coming from Cali this place was fucking awesoooooooome! Highly recommend. So everytime you come to Vegas, this is the spot. All you can eat sushi. Great service, friendly service. Found it on Yelp and we decided to try and believe me well worth it. The price, great prices, compare the all you can eat sushi. Well worth it. You have to stop by and you will see. You won't be disappointed.

This experience went 100-0 real quick.

When we got there the place wasn't crazy busy. We got seated right away and the servers were genuinely super nice and on top of things!

The rolls were decent, we tried the following:

Rolls-

Tiger
Shrimp Lover
Freaky Friday
Baked Salmon
Spider
Hot and Juicy
Lisa Hand Roll

Appetizers-

Cucumber Crab Salad
Seaweed Salad
Screaming Orgasm
Sweet and Spicy Potstickers
Tempura Calamari

Dessert-

Strawberry Mochi duh

Like I said the rolls were decent but I'm sad to say we will not be returning due to the horrendous wait time to receive rolls.

There was a time we waited 28 minutes for a roll. 

I get they only had two sushi chefs but there were times when we saw rolls waiting for ten plus minutes to be picked up and taken to tables. It's unfair to blame the chefs when they're doing their job.

So to start off..I'm a HUGE ayce critic. (Lol) and this place....is AMAZING. FROM THE SERVICE DOWN TO THE TASTE! I honestly can't think of anything negative about this place. The atmosphere is perfect. What I love, is that this place offers half orders on all you can eat, and the service here is awesome! They're quick, polite, and always checking up on us in a timely manner. (SPECIAL THANKS TO JANE!! SHES AN AWESOME WAITRESS, PRETTY TOO FELLAS  lol) So far everything that ive ordered tastes WONDERFUL! FULL OF FLAVOR. NOTHING bland touched my toungue. I would definitely recommend this place to ANYONE. Dinner is a must tho, its 26.95 a person, but you can bet your ass that itS MUCH WORTH IT. My new "GO TO SPOT" FOR AYCE. i love it here! Thanks SUSHI WAY!! (And, they gave me free travel chopsticks!) Super sweet!!
Shrimp tempora rolls were amazing! Only complaint was they were kinda small but would definitely go back.

Are you kidding me!!!  How this place receives such a high rating is beyond my comprehension. The quality of the seafood was subpar, the restroom was unkept and the wait help was lost at times.  I really don't want to get into more details except to say  save your money and go elsewhere, don't believe the 5 star ratings.
100% excellent Sushi and great price. A+ I was not expecting it to be so amazing in flavor.

Unbelievable how good this place is!! Sit at the bar where the chefs can serve you directly. Prices for AYCE beyond worth it!  The menu is wide open for you to order from . Super friendly staff, fun atmosphere. You will not find better rolls or sushi anywhere in Vegas. Your order is filled with incredible speed and accuracy. Drinks here basic stuff, but priced right. This is Vegas number one hidden gem IMO. I love this place and its only a $9 uber away from many Vegas strip casinos!!
Best all-you-can-eat deal in town!!  Excellent staff, they give great recommendations and are super knowledgable when asked about the food!!  Sit at the bar so that Ivan can hook you up!!!

My boyfriend and I were in Vegas for one night and looking for a good restaurant with reasonable prices. We searched and searched, and there weren't a ton of inexpensive sit-down options that were nearby. However, after about 20-30 minutes of searching on Yelp, he saw the menu for Sushi Way--at $10-15, the prices sounded great, and the place had 4.5 stars.

We sat down and picked two sushi rolls to start--when the server came to take our order, we told him what we wanted, and then he asked if we wanted to do the AYCE sushi option for $27 a person. There were a couple rules to review on the menu (like they will charge you for wasting food), but I LOVE sushi and knew that I could eat my money's worth. Any stomach ache or vomiting from overeating would be totally worth it. That's how much I love sushi.

I ordered oysters, baked mussels, seared salmon, salmon, eel, sea urchin, sexy lazy special, vocano roll, pineapple sorbet, and vanilla ice cream. Everything was SO good. I loved the sexy lazy, vocano, and eel the most. I still dream about those flavors in my mouth. Oh, it was SO good. None of the sushi had excessive rice, they were super friendly, quick, and paced everything out well instead of dragging it out so you're full faster.

I definitely wish this place was in Portland. I would probably go eat myself stupid at least once a month. At least.

All You Can Eat sushi is usually a very good thing. Normally it is a delicious event. This is not the Sushi Way. You have to shove rolls into a napkin so you can throw them away in the bathroom. That is the Sushi Way, way.

Took a minute to be seated. It had a decent amount of people in here. We did beat out a group of 8 ladies that had to wait a while for a table. 

$25 for AYCE sushi. A touch north of what I want to pay, but hell, it's a Friday night. I can take the hit. 

Cherry Blossom Roll: This was my first roll. This roll was a red flag. It's spicy tuna, crab and green onion inside wrapped in avocado with eel sauce with crunch. I thought it was a joke when it came out. It's comically large. You can't pick it up with chop sticks. It doesn't hold together to take a bite. It all falls apart. Plus, it didn't taste fresh at all. Crunch was just brown sugar which didn't add anything to the roll. It was actually jarring to get a mouth full of brown sugar out of nowhere. 

No relief in sight. Screaming Orgasm was also gross. It's just tasted old. The sauce was flat. Just like it had been sitting out all day. 

After these two lackluster rolls, we ordered more. And waited. And waited. And waited. Went to the restroom. Noticed there was no soap in the bathroom. Compounded with the fact that I had to FIGHT with the automatic hand towel dispenser to get a scrap of paper towel. With all this in mind, I wondered, "How do they properly wash their hands before touching all these rolls?"

With my appetite diminishing exponentially, I could take in the environment around me. This is when I noticed the head sushi chef looked like he had some frat party to go to after work. He was wearing his hat backwards while plating the sushi. I couldn't stop thinking, "Who even wears hats backwards anymore?" Am I judging a book by its cover? Just ask the people he was about to serve sushi to when he yanked the plate away to fix the presentation of the plate (top of rolls falling off the bottom part). Seemed super professional. He also was just staring at the 8 women who came in after us. Just watching him stare in that direction for most of the night. Sushi weren't the only rolls this guy had his mind on.  

Along the professional route, one server also openly was flirting with the other one in front of us. Or something akin to flirting. I have no clue what was going on. After bringing us our rolls, server asked if we wanted anything else. One server playfully hit the other server, then says something to the effect of, "We can beat each other up if you want us too."

Uhhhh. Please. No.

By the way, did I mention we never got our own plates? We had to eat right off the plates the rolls came in. Supes profesh.

The rolls we got were even worse. Salmon belly was whatever, tasted like it had been sitting out on the counter for hours. We had burnt eel. We had old stale rice. We had more unfresh fish. Debated on how to dispose of this food. Almost settled on the "dump it in the plastic tree" move but decided it was too cartoony and rude.  This is where I had to eventually take the rolls into a napkin and dump them in the bathroom trash can. That was the easy part. Hard part was fishing paper towels to dry my hands.

Any redeeming qualities? Sherbet sure was good. Legitimately, the best tasting thing we had there. 

I have never had such a strange sushi experience in my life. I'm glad I'm still alive after eating that food. Don't get me wrong, I didn't feel great, but I'm alive.

There are tons of other sushi places that are better (Yama Sushi, Sushi Mon, Japaniero) so don't even waste your time here.

This place is so good!!! For a $26.95 all you can eat sushi that is so worth it; the hotel offered $26 per roll which is a total rip compared to here. Ivan was our sushi making person and he was friendly, funny, and made it right in front of us! He made it very quickly and didn't forget our order. Great service and good quality fish!
This is a rock and ROLLing sushi joint. Great tunes and service... What more could you want?

This is our 2nd time here, I see it becoming the sushi spot we always hit when we come to Vegas. Great variety of rolls, great price for AYCE, good service. Nothing to complain about, except a super full belly when you leave.

5 stars rating for customer service. Very friendly and attentive. Love it! 
4 stars for food. Some of the items are not as fresh as I would like, such as sea urchin and sweet shrimp. Other than that, I love most of the foods I got. The grilled hamachi collar is superb! I ate every morsel. Love seaweed salad and the poki salad.
The sushi was super fresh - and the uni was tasty. I always get it without the seaweed just uni on rice. Garlic yellowtail sushi was my second favorite and the sweet shrimp my third. Yummy

Excellent food! Some of the freshest sushi I've experienced. Service got slow when they got busy. As a new restaurant they are obviously working out the kinks in their system. One of the Chefs come to our table to aliviate our frustration and I found that more than reassuring.

Seriously the best AYCE sushi I've been to. Service was great, food was great, price was great!! $21.95 for lunch and $26. 95 for dinner AYCE. Includes dessert too!! You must try the sushi nachos. Love that their rolls dont have too much rice. I'm only here for the weekend, but I want to come back again before leaving!!!
First time eating here, and I liked it.  Great quality fish.  I really liked the yellowtail belly.  Good all you can eat sushi place.
Delicious & can't beat the all you can eat, for the entire menu! Food comes out reasonably fast & the staff is friendly. Some of the rolls have funny names, like I love my ass LOL! Highly recommend!!
Sushi was very good and made very fast. When you here all you can eat sushi you might get worried. I can tell you this is not a problem here. It was all fresh made. I ate a ton.

Just finished a meal here and will have to say that this place may replace my usual go to spit when I am in Vegas. The fish was fresh, service was as fast as they could be given they were swamped with the CES Rush. 

I would only say that Yama sushi has the advantage because they have a larger space than sushi way, but the food here was great and may be worth the possibility of waiting.

I was super hungry coming from work. So I thought coming here would be a good idea . NOPE ! There were tables open and I they still made me wait 15 mins for a table . After it took another 10 mins for drinks. The server came over and asked if we were ready but then went off to take a phone call . WE WAITED 15 MINS TO ORDER . Absolutely worse service ever they either need to hire better people or work faster .

So... we came back last night and obviously called first to see if Mike is working or not and he did.. so here is the review on that 
I really have a mixed feelings about this place!!! One thing I will have to say though if Mike isn't there I wouldn't dare set a foot in this restaurant!! He really do the face of this business!! Idk what you guys would do without him!! He's a gem and give him a raise he really deserve it!!!
Great food! We had Jane as our waitress and she was wonderful. Worth the taxi ride off the strip.

Omg they have the best sushi.  Super fresh, delish, and they are very nice.  The sushi can be customized and they get creative.  I love when people are passionate about their job and you can tell they love what they do here. 

Because of my boyfriend I have become a sushi connoisseur and I have to say going from ra to yama to umiya to sakana this is by far the best (right now).  I've noticed the places usually decrease in quality as it gets more popular but not here (hopefully never).

Had an excellent 5 star experience this weekend at Sushi Way!  They're a little behind the strip and definitely worth the commute to this hidden gem.  Don't be scared when you hear this is All You Can Eat Sushi.  It's actually all made to order personally by the head sushi chef/owner.  There are many great items to try all for $26.95 for dinner.  

You have 90 minutes and you can pick whatever you want from the menu.  Hot or Cold items, also anything on the daily special board which was amazing. I enjoyed the Salmon Belly Sushi, the White Tuna and Yellowtail Sashimi.  From the main menu they have some fun rolls to try with their unique sauces like the I Love My Ass.

Service was top notch.  We were well taken care of, provided recommendations, and you will get very personalized service here.  Really friendly and the environment, food, drinks were all great.  

They stay open until 1am on Sunday and 2am on other days.  I can't wait to come back and wish they were down here in the OC.  This is a great price for what you're going to get and the food is really good too.  I'm sure this place will be getting popular as you can already see all the rave reviews on Yelp.

If you are going to be in Vegas and want to eat sushi then Sushi Way is the only way to get the best sushi in the town. They have incredible selection of fresh fish and variety ways of making great testing rolls.

By far (with no exaggeration) this is THE.WORST sushi I've ever had. If you respect Sushi and have any appreciation for it please don't come here. You might as well eat the doormat in front instead of coming in and eating this "fish."

Customer service is amazing and the food is even better 11/10 would come again. We sat at the bar and was given delicious fresh super white tuna topped with jalapeño  over and over. The spicy garlic edamame was amazing too. Definitely worth doing the AYCE. Verokon and Brian were awesome!

Out of towners and never eat at AYCE places. But the reviews pushed me in. Great service. Good quality sushi for a ridiculously low price. We eat sushi at least once a week (and no alcohol) at home and do not leave for less than $85 - 2 rolls and a chicken teriyaki. So, overall pleased with this place.

The food was above my expectations for all you can eat. The staff was also very kind asking what I wanted next. I am writing this review because they treated me wonderful for being a late night random visit.

Many choices of rolls with interesting combinations of flavors. 
Nice lunch all you can eat with a bunch of choices to choose from. Affordable price 
I highly recommend it.

Overall, it was an alright meal, but looking back at reviews and pictures, it seems the cut of fish I received was inconsistent with others.. Came for an early dinner on Saturday and was really looking forward to our meal after a hike in the narrows. We chose to sit at the sushi bar and service was decent.

For apps: the coconut shrimp tempura and baked green mussels were good. The calamari was not so great. Not crunchy and the batter came right off.

In our first round, we ordered 2 orders of uni, but was only brought out 1. So I had to ask for the second. When they brought out the second order, there was significantly less uni. I was dismayed but the uni was still very good. 

It seemed after our first round, the sushi chef wasn't happy that I asked for the second uni order and it was reflected on the size of fish and rice we got following that order. The cuts of our fish for the nigiri were small compared to the pictures, and the amount of rice got a little bigger. The rice also fell apart too easily.

I did enjoy the white tuna the best, it came with a garlic ponzu, and the fish was really good. It'd be even better with a better fish to rice ratio. Garlic yellowtail was also good. Everything else was so so: salmon, garlic tuna, scallop.

The sweet shrimp was nice and big in size, but the sushi chef did not include the fried shrimp head, nor did he offer or say anything about it.

The Red Boy roll: this was good, the white tuna on top was a little cooked on top, and the charred flavor went really well.

The I love my ass roll: not so good.. There was supposed to be soft shell crab inside, but there was literally none, just a lot of imitation crab filling.

The yellowtail collar and jalapeno white tuna were the chef's special for the day. The yellowtail was huge and delicious, although a bit overcooked. Also liked the white tuna.

Was my first time here went in for dinner first glance at the menu little overwhelming lots to choose from my waitress was very nice and recommended some items they do offer all you can eat for $26 a person with the exception of kids age 3 and under are aloud to share with you they do have rules to all you can eat don't like food go to waste so prefer for you to Order as you go went ahead did all you can eat ended up trying the California roll, crunch, spicy tuna, Cali dream, jack rabbit, big eazy, sexy bomb oh my goodness all very delicious there teriyaki chicken was pretty good cute little spot have bar seating table and booths will definitely return

Nice small sushi bar great staff, standard all you can eat prices I've been there for lunch and dinner, fish are fresh. The all you can eat menu is pretty big and has a nice variety of things to try. The food I give 4 stars to but the staff I would give 5 stars very friendly
Great service so far and wonderful theme everything is fresh and is delicious and beautiful and the desserts make your mouth water.

My husband and I came here for dinner. We got all you can eat $26.95 and everything was absolutely AMAZINGGGGG. our waiter was amazing as well. Sushi nachos were to die for. We're from California and this is the best sushi I've had in a long time. We will definitely be coming back every time we are in town. Worth every penny
Sushi Way had the best all-you-can eat sushi that I have ever had.  We stopped in for dinner and could not resist the special.  All of the sushi was super hight quality and excellent.

Soooo bomb! I'm from out of town and this place is about 8 minutes from my hotel, I got the all you can eat for $26.95. I tried the Big Easy Special, baked salmon roll & the sexy lazy special! Try this place you won't be disappointed.
Te all you can eat is amazing, they offer half rolls which is convenient. I want to try a little of everything without getting full on a few rolls. We went during happy hour.
First time ever here. I think it is the best AYCE sushi place I've been to. Uni is delicious, a great selection and fair price.
Was craving some sushi so we looking around and found this awesome place. The service was excellent and food was awesome. I would recommend this place to anyone.
The super white is awesome, i love my ass is my go to forsure . This place never fails  to satisfy mu familys sushi cravings! :)
The best and fresh sushi joint in Las Vegas... The proportion of rice to and seafood was perfect. The service was great. The server was very friendly and nice. HIGHLY recommended.
Excellent food and service.   Best all you can eat sushi in town.  Would definitely return
Definite hidden gem. Fish is fresh and service is fast. Coming back for sure when we are back in town!!

Been to three sushi places in Vegas so far as I moved from New York, though non can compete with New York's id have to say, this is the best place I been to so far. Understaffed for lunch, but still had decent service and from the appetizers to the sushi...best I've had yet!

Of course we wanted to try out an ayce sushi while in the west coast. Decided to give this place a try after comparing to others. First of all the items that are limited were delicious! Loved the oysters and sweet shrimp. 

The rice though.... I dunno why the rice was so mushy and I hated it but the fish quality was really good. Wish they would change the rice.

I ordered a to go order from here and it was affordable, and fresh quality. I was impress with how much food they gave me and how fresh the ingredients were. I ordered the sushi dinner. Came with nigiri pieces, California, soup, and salad all for $13-15. I definitely will come back to this place. I haven't tried their AYCE but it looks fantastic.

We went for dinner and ordered off the all you can eat menu. Spider roll probably one of the best I've had. The portion size was perfect. Wasn't too much so that one could still order more rolls. The flavor of the spicy garlic edamame was also better than regular spicy edamame I have had before. I also had the sex bomb roll. It would have been better with less spicy mayo or probs none at all. You definitely get your money's worth here. And service was great; our waiter was attentive and friendly.

I have to say the menu items were delicious and all three stars to the food and chefs. The service however sucked. Waiting 15-20 minutes from ordering an item when the place is semi full is ridiculous. Not to mention , how many times do I have to ask for tea or water before actually getting just that. How about 20 minutes and 4 times I asked. If they hire more people it would be better I would hope

First time eating Sushi Way AND first time ever using EAT24. I know, risk taker ...right!? Well, I'm glad I chanced it.. because not only was the sushi fresh and delishes, it arrived in 30 minutes! Faster than most pizza delivery. I had spicey tuna rolls, Philly rolls with masago added, and hamachi rolls. I keep my sushi basic and traditional... no fancy stuff for me. I made a special request to pack my to-go boxes on ice, it was done so well. The ice didn't even have a chance to melt in the bag it got here so fast. I will definitely order from them again, and visit their restaurant to try the all you can eat. Very impressed, and satisfied.

When my friends and I first walked in, we were kind of turned off because no one was there to greet us and we ended up standing around waiting for about 5-10 minutes. A Korean lady walked in the dining room though and seated us. We thought she was kind of unfriendly at first but she definitely warmed up to us throughout the meal and started joking with us and being really sweet. 

Throughout our meal, the service was prompt (both water and food) and the quality of the fish was really, really good. I'm a big nigiri fan and I definitely enjoyed the salmon and scallop the most. There are also many categories of rolls on the back and I liked the Fat Ass (a deep fried roll) even though it's one of those rolls where one piece is too big for your mouth but at least it's appropriately named. A lot of the roll names are laced with sexual innuendo but our waiter would just joke about it and have a good time with us. 

Overall, a great meal and definitely worth the $21.95 for lunch and lunch is 'til 4 PM! The menu says there's a 60 minute limit but we were definitely full before the limit since the food would come out quickly. The only thing I didn't love about this sushi joint was that you have to look through the menu and list every verbally for the waiter. I'm accustomed to writing everything down on a piece of paper which I think is more efficient since you don't have to memorize your order.

Can somebody give them a negative 2 star please. This place is awful! 
1. Selection of food is very Limited
2. Food are not done of cooked specially the   Yellow Tail  kama. It is in my photo here?
3. The gyoza I think I missed spell this and the spicy Dumpling taste horrible and salty! 
4. Not to mention some part of this two that I just mention? They are cold ? So Disguisting.
 
Why we tried these place because my daughter choose this? I even show to the waitress the uncooked collar yellowtail kama?  She just font sau anything and took it away.
Folks if you ever try to go here DON'T YOU WILL RUIN YOUR DAY AND LOST YOUR MONEY. THESE IS NOT A PLACE TO ENJOY THE JAPANESE FOOD. UGHH.. WHAT A WASTE OF FOOD THEY CREATE!

Fish was super fresh & there wasn't a ton of rice in the nigiri

We had a group of 20 people and surprisingly the food came out very fast

$27 for dinner price is kinda expensive but definitely worth it here

Excellent and prompt service, very friendly - I love that!  Food was excellent... I ordered the seaweed salad, a spicy tuna roll and salmon sushi. Also a 'Sake Cooler' - mango flavored, which was delicious!

See my check-in. This is an AYCE sushi place that doesn't feel like it: They don't load up the rice so you are to stuffed on it and the fish is great quality. People are super super friendly. 5 stars for price and friendliness alone!

The chef was nice and chatted with me. Made me his specialties off menu based on what was fresh and what I liked. You can tell this is a place where they care about the quality of their food and it's fun to taste the chefs experiments into mixing traditional sushi with Vegas flavors. I don't think they should offer all you can eat, but they manage to keep quality up so I can't complain!

This is my favorite AYCE sushi place in Las Vegas. Prices are competitive with other sushi places, and all the fish is great. The spicy garlic edamame is definitely true to its name! My server, Mike, was also friendly and attentive. I will be recommending this restaurant to my friends.

After taking up a calisthenics class, Matt L. and myself decided on AYCE sushi and this place was the closest on my go to list. 

Miss Jane was our waitress and couldn't have been more fortunate to have her. Unlike many other sushi servers, she would stop by each table to engage with her customers which made her very approachable. I asked her for more pickled ginger and she came back with a bowl full! Now that's the kind of woman I need in my life Lol.

As far as the food, I stuck to my favorites from my last visit and the quality is still there: Big Easy Roll, Kiss of Fire Roll, Bacon Wrapped Scallops, Super White Tuna, Garlic Tuna, Sushi Nachos, Coconut Tempura, Oysters, Baked Muscles, Pork Belly, Tempura Ice Cream, Mochi Ice Cream (no limit on desserts). 

Thank you to all the chefs backstage for preparing our food and of course Jane for putting up with our immature personalities. Keep up the great work and don't get frustrated during the busy hours like your former co-worker;)

First off, their service was remarkable! We went between lunch and dinner time, so it was pretty empty, so it's probably the best time to go. 

They have very fresh fish, which is a definite plus! You get your money's worth for the all you can eat menu. 

By far one of my new favorite spots :)

It's a nice inexpensive place. They have "all you can eat" option, which is a great idea for people who like to try everything! It's a nice sized place with enough room between tables. 
The service is great, they really look happy to see you. I felt really good as soon as I walked in, great vibe! And they're fast, so be careful not to order too many things at once because you'll have your table full! 
They are really good explaining the menu and suggesting so if you're unsure or confused, jus ask them!
The food looks and tastes good, I was super excited after reading the reviews here and I sure was not disappointed.
The reason why this place is not a 5 star for me is the fact that they ran out of gyoza, which happens to be my favorite item in any Japanese menu; and the fact that their bathroom looks dark and a little messy.

Go out of your way, to give Sushi Way a shot. This centrally located sushi spot is housed in the same shopping center that Firefly used to be in. 

I came for the AYCE lunch special, which is $21.95, includes all rolls/sides; excludes sashimi. They have a decent little menu, and many options to choose from. There are a lot of baked and fried rolls here as well. Now, typically I wouldn't go for these types of rolls, but right now I have a strict "no raw" fish rule in place because of health reasons. So, I was really craving sushi, and noticed Sushi Way had numerous options that would fit my needs.

The sushi chefs are very nice, as are the servers. Most of my sushi and sides arrived quickly, and I was asked if I wanted more sushi when I was almost complete with each of the rolls I had in front of me. 

I won't list off all the rolls I ate here, but I had 4, as well as two different sides. I was very pleased with the meal, and I would certainly return for another visit.
Stopped in on the way to the airport for a quick bite and it was great.  Wonderful service thank you
Best salmon in Las Vegas!!!! So fresh, cut perfectly every time, & chilled so it melts in your mouth. I could eat this all day. Awesome service.

This place is my favorite AYCE place!! Everything just taste so fresh! I've been to many many AUCE sushi places in Vegas, and this place blew my mind. I love Yama sushi and Umiya sushi, but this place stood out! Do yourself a favor, and try this place. So good

My family and I ate here today (Wednesday) for lunch (lunch special is $21.95 all you can eat, which ends at 4pm) and had an amazing experience. Richard S. was our server and he went above and beyond to make our family outing great. He attended to us, made my toddler niece feel special (brought her chopsticks with the grip, suggested kid friendly foods, and surprised her with treats like mochi ice cream and a Jolly Rancher candy), he recommend us rolls, was funny, and in every way exceeded our customer service experience. The food was beyond delicious and they are generous with the fish portions. On top of all this, they have unique rolls, deserts, and dishes, which were all superb and flavorful. This is now our favorite sushi spot! Which makes it even better they have a stamp card to treat you after your 10th stamp! 
I love this place! 
Special thank you to Richard S. for making us feel so special, we really appreciate your outstanding customer service!

Food was not bad but it wasn't the best. 

The waitress brought us the wrong food, twice and forgot three of our orders on separate occasions. We think she is new.

I didn't like the lighting. It was very yellowish. The seats were uncomfortable. 

Could go to better sushi places for the same price.

ok, second visit....not quite as good as first, but still decent

started off with bacon wrapped scallops of course.....YUM
an order of shrimp tempura and vegetable tempura too, good, nothing special, but good
Hamachi kama, gotta get these if they have them available....simple grilled collars with a ponzu sauce to dip in....not necessary, good by itself

first round of nigiri, ordered salmon belly, uni, unagi, and Hamachi
the owner Jin/Jun (sorry not clear on which) prepared our first round of sushi
everything was great, buttery, melt in your mouth good

pause for another round of bacon wrapped scallops!
and we snuck in an order of salmon tar tar, really good, layered on top of crab and avocado

second round of sushi, ordered salmon belly again, super white tuna w/jalapeno, tuna, and a spider roll....have to order 1 roll at least right?
in any case, his apprentice prepared this order, and you could really tell his knife skills lacked, as the fish did not have the same consistency as our first round
some of the slices were uneven and he cut against the grain incorrectly, as the salmon belly was a bit chewy rather than soft and buttery in texture

in any case, that about wrapped up this visit
finished with some orange slices and green tea ice cream

I will be sure to visit again, but I will make sure we sit in owners section this time so we can enjoy this place to its fullest!

keep you posted!

This place is great!

Food: no complaints, we didn't order the all you can eat, we did all sushi and rolls and everything was great. The Super White Tuna with Jalapeños was amazing, as was the Dancing Eel roll.

Ambience: This is your standard sushi restaurant. 

Service: Ask for Richard, he is an amazing waiter, make sure you ask for the Korean Saki!

Tip: Order the Honey Bread for desert you will not be disappointed.
Small restaurant with so many food choices. Choose all you can eat.  Japanese Chef. Very good oysters.

very tasty food!
