nice staff and low prices. I recommend miso soup and California rolls.

Service was meh. Server got a lot of things wrong every time we ordered. I can understand that he was busy though 

The fish was great though. All the rolls and fish worked out well
Great food and very friendly service. Very little rice in the rolls which is rare for such an extensive AYCE menu. We have found our new favorite sushi spot in Vegas!

This place is awesome! Gotta come check out Ivan and his skills!
Will be coming back to Sushi Way very soon!

THIS PLACE ROCKS!! Service is 10/10! We had the AYCE and the sushi is just really high quality! The quantity is moderated so you get to try a wide variety of options, and the fish to rice ratio is really good so you won't end up eating a lot of rice and not much fish. 
The waitress was really nice to give us an extra order of mochi too even tho it was one order per person. Must come!!

In Vegas and wanted sushi but didn't want to pay outrages prices so we found this place a little ways off the strip. We walked in and it was lonely but tried it any ways. We got seated and looked over the menu. Our waiter was very cool and very knowledgable about the food they served. We decided to go for the all you can eat and that was a great choice. 
Sushi was fresh and tasty. We had tuna, halibut, salmon and rolls. I can't remember the rolls we had nor did I take pictures of them but they were very good. The waiter would also do recommendations of what to try and everything was very good. My wife also ordered noodles in this place and she enjoyed them while I tore up the all you can eat sushi. You really can't go wrong. When in Vegas I will definitely be going back to sushi way and hitting up the all you can eat!

The selection is huge and reasonably priced for sure. I was surprised that the sushi was so fresh and very tasty.  Ambience is plain but clean. The server that helped us was super fun and helpful. Definitely great tip for them and will be back.
Amazing sushi, great service by both of our servers Ploy and Lucy and all you can eat deal for 26$. Highly recommended, we will be back definitely!

A group of 6 of us went here for lunch on Saturday. We arrived right at opening time, and wanted to sit at the bar, but were immediately ushered to a table. I always prefer to sit at the bar, and since the place was empty, i was surprised that we were basically forced to a table. 

We all ordered the all you can eat lunch, which at 21.95 is worth it, since that is the cost of about 2 rolls. I love nigiri as well, so the value was definitely there.  All the food was decent and came out very quickly (since we were the only ones there).  When the nigiri came out, if multiple people ordered the same, it all came out on the same plate. 

The food tasted fresh, and looked appetizing when it came out. This place would have gotten five stars except that we were forced to sit at tables instead of the bar.

RUN!!!!!  Honestly, everything was great until I was watching the chefs banter over a sauce - at least that's what I gathered from the conversation that I saw.  Right in front of me one of the chefs squirted the sauce on his hand (which he had a glove on) bent down behind the sushi bar, and licked his glove!!!!!!!!! I'm assuming this was his version of a taste test.   Okay, gross, but what happened next was completely disturbing.   He stood back up, and continued to make sushi with the same hand he just licked!!!!!!!!   No change in glove, no hand wash, NOTHING.  Right back to packing rice with the same hand he just slobbered all over!!!!!  Needless to say, I'm BEYOND disgusted.  Luckily my friend and I had already asked for our check.   I left in a hurry, And I will NEVER be back.
you can't go wrong with the sashimi or nigiri items - delicious - tender - melts in your mouth

I was originally going to give this place 3 stars. I wanted to talk about the quality of the sushi and how good it is, and how the way they make their rice is amazing.

But, that changed this morning when my boyfriend texted me, telling me he had food poisoning. And I myself had been fighting an unpleasantness last night as well. 

However, I want it to be clear that we wouldn't have come back anyways, even if we didn't get sick. The ambiance of this place is very dead, it's slightly depressing. There is no joy in the staff, with the exception of one server. It didn't start to get upbeat in the restaurant till a group of guys came in. 

We thought that their nigiri tasted good, the sushi is of good quality, but we didn't like their rolls at all. The only thing you can taste in all the rolls is the unagi sauce, and it overpowers everything else. Their other sauces have no flavor, and the sushi is lost. I also want to add that their appetizers are mediocre. We had the Veggie tempura that we weren't impressed by, the Screaming Orgasm which has the same problem with no flavor and my boyfriends miso soup never arrived. 

But once again, none of this matters anymore since my boyfriend woke up super sick, and my stomach has been upset as well.

I'm sorry Sakana for betraying you. Even though your rice isn't good sushi rice and you're always busy... you always treat us well, your staff is welcoming, and we always leave satisfied and never with food poisoning.

This place. There's not much that I can say about Sushi Way other than STELLAR!
The staff is attentive, the chefs personable, the environment soothing...don't get me started on the food.

Alright...

I'm a sushi fiend. And Sushi Way does NOT disappoint in the slightest. Their fish is fresh, their rice is the perfect texture. There is a balance between the fish and the rice, unlike many AYCE places that pile on the rice while minimizing cost by skimping on the fish portions. 

I'll eat just about anything, so I love to ask the chefs what they like or to surprise me. To not be too terrible long-winded, I'll just say that you better get to this place ASAP! 

They're new, so they aren't always packed, but when the word gets out and around...trust me. Sushi Way will be slammed 24/7 (well, when they're open). Love it! Gotta have it! This is the only Way to enjoy your sushi around the Strip and in the Vegas Metro area.

Our favorite place in Vegas! Excellent selection! So happy we chose this place for dinner. We ordered sweet 16 roll, eel roll, volcano roll, sushi pizza, many other sushimi specials which were amazing. Don't forget to order dessert at the end too. The green tea ice cream was very tasty. Definitely got our money's worth. Not far from the strip and easy parking.

Favorite AYCE sushi in Vegas - and last nights visit was so good I'm here again for lunch. 

Favorite roll is the Big Easy, and the garlic edemame is great!

, came here with a friend during CES. This is one of the worst experiences of My Life. The Sushi was okay I guess that's the best thing that you could say about this place. So the customer service and the management is horrible. First of all they have their son maybe two or three years old maybe stick in the corner watching his little cell phone while they works. You can definitely tell these parents don't care anything about their child. Anyway on to the main part of the it was. This issue was good and that's only because of sushi chef was great, and he probably wouldn't be working here if you knew his real self worth and you can probably get a better job. After learning Sushi we ask for the bill bill came out to a hundred and someone not changed. Once we got the change we gave $140 so we can have extra money to tip and ask for change. It took half an hour before having to ask for the money back and they said hey you only 20. Oh no I've never been to such a disappointing placed as far as management goes I definitely would not come back here again it's a waste of time you could definitely find better Sushi I would definitely recommend Sushi Mon right down the street
Wonderful service!  The varieties of items one can get for the dinner buffett is amazing.

Sushi Way is almost like a hole in the wall. If you don't know about it already then you won't find it. I mean unless you're at Tacos and Beer next door. Everytime I've come here the food is always fresh and DELICIOUS. Never disappoints. Their baked mussels and sushi nachos are always the first things I order. For AYCE it's pretty decently priced especially because the food is good quality.

Quick dinner before heading back to the hotel. I thought the food was fine no real complaints. I wasn't a fan of the bacon wrapped scallops, they were a bit slimy even though they were cooked. The pork belly was good. I don't think the Uni was very fresh either. Overall is was fine... average quality I assume. Although I eat a lot of sushi so I'm very picky. Service was good as well. My only real complaint is the AYCE pricing seemed high to me. I know this is vegas but for the quality of the fish I wouldn't go back with these same prices in place.

I was so happy that they separated, the ginger and the wasabi!! I HATE wasabi! And I find that anytime I order sushi, at least one piece is always tainted by that strong and painful wasabi flavor, due to it being placed in that same container. Yuck!

I ordered a philly roll and a fried philly roll, both of which were standard . Not extraordinary but good. Would I go back? Yes- but my search for the best sushi spot continues.

Did the AYCE. Being that I live in a non-sushi kind of place, sushi is the one thing I have to have when I go to Vegas. Because I want to get more than one piece, I like to go off Strip for my fix. This was a new choice, and I was not disappointed. 

The boyfriend and I did the all you can eat, getting the nigiri first: super tuna, scallops, salmon, and yellowtail. All were fresh, with nice, properly seasoned rice and reasonable portions, with the scallop being the stand out (I think I had six pieces total). For the rolls, they allow you to get half and half if you're torn between two choices, as I was with the Alaska and Arizona rolls, and again, great sizes, super fresh, and tasty combos (I preferred the Alaska with the crab, but that's just personal taste). 

Also got the Salmon Tartar, which is quite rich, served as a round with a top layer of salmon tartar, a lower layer of mayo/crab, and a creamy mayo sauce. The shrimp tempura was light and not greasy. The only disappointment was the tempura ice cream, with a heavy, unappealing shell over the green tea ice cream. But it was such a minor fault (and I really wasn't there for dessert) that I don't care. 

The sushi chef was super friendly and very on the ball, he almost seemed disappointed when we stopped ordering (even though I thought we'd been kind of piggish). Overall, a very satisfying experience.

If you don't want to wait for goyemon come here.  Quality is on point and the size of their nigiri is pretty perfect.  So close to giving this place 5 stars but the order time was just a bit slow but its ok the quality of the food makes up for it.

Fresh and delicious sushi! Always looking for a good sushi place and this one is right down the street from work. I ordered the AYCE lunch and ordered quite a few different rolls, all of which were delicious. The mochi was delicious as well, but everyone at the table was raving about the bread dessert, which was a way bigger dessert portion than the little tiny mochi. Two thumbs up in my book!

BEST AYCE! I have looked low and high for a great sushi restaurant and I think I have finally found it! Went in on a Sunday night, there was no wait and the service was fast. The manager (i think) is also from Hawaii so he was a delight to talk to. Everything was super fresh and tasty. I will definitely be back!

Food is good but customer service was sub par.   We got no plates to eat off of, waited about 30 minutes before being asked if we were ready to order, then another 30 minutes after being served our first dish.
This was the most amazing all you can eat sushi place you can eat at for the price. The sushi was freshly made to order.

Was looking for a sushi place for takeout to avoid eating at the hotels on the strip where I was staying. Drove further north to Sushi Way which I found through yelp. To my surprise all the sushi I ordered were very fresh even though yelp said it was an AYCE restaurant. The only complaint would be the slice of fish were a bit on the thin side. Coming from California we are use to a more generous slice. Solid 3.
One of the best sushi spots in Las Vegas can't go wrong with the pricing the Sushi is so damn good!
My friends and I came to eat after one of the VGK games and we had a great time doing all you can eat at the bar. The bacon wrapped scallops are so delish!

Food was pretty good but the vibe wasn't awesome by any means and it didn't help that the table server was in a very foul mood. 
You could feel the unhappy coming off of her; I know what it is like to have a bad day and it's ok to not be super friendly but it not OK to walk around mopey and slow without a care in the world about your job and the customers there. She was not welcoming in any way and took forever to even get us water, then completely forgot my green tea; I didn't bother asking again. 

HOWEVER I was bummed at first because the AYCE  lunch didn't include some things on the menu that my other usual AYCE sushi spots do, such as my favorite: screaming orgasm! The sushi chefs behind the bar were great (one was possibly the owner) and made me a screaming O even though it wasn't offered. The chefs were very nice and quick to get us all the sushi we wanted so that made up for the negative energy emitting off of the server. 

Over all Sushi Way is not a bad spot; very clean and comfortable. Service and vibe is very important to me so I am not sure if I will go back any time soon but I am not against going back either.

We read all the reviews and they are spot on. Great sushi! Try the cherry blossom or the carrot top roll!! Everything was outstanding. The staff was incredibly and genuinely friendly. PS I also suggest adding masago to your rolls.
The 4 stars are because the food was good but they need more staff, the service was very slow... Yes I will come back and hope that they did better
This is one of the best sushi bar in town. Good food and friendly people.

Great lunch experience. Found Sushi Way on Yelp and figured an off the strip lunch experience would be better and we were right. This place hit the spot. The miso soup was excellent and the service was efficient and genuine. The rolls were less fusion oriented and we really like the Arizona roll. Solid, light and tasty. Highly recommend.

starting off with... if there's one thing i hate using yelp for - it's sushi
Americans often think of sushi as California rolls and their definition of "good" usually leaves me smdh

i am a self-admitted sushi snob
my profile pic is a piece of o-toro from the Tsukiji Fish Market in Tokyo

my favorite is Omakase sushi at the bar, direct from the chef...

so i land in Vegas, around lunchtime, take an uber to some place off the strip... and to my horror - it was All You Can Eat (AYCE)... in any case, i luckily it was closed and i tell my uber driver to take me to the #2 place (as per Yelp)

we get to Sushi Way and I see the "AYCE" sign in the window. At this point I am Stttttaaaaarvvvvinngg!!!

whatever

go in, sit at the bar - they explain to me that for lunch it's $21.95 for 60minutes - no holds barred - anythign and everything on the menu goes

you want edamame? sure
you want 10 spicy tuna rolls? sure
you want a really complicated roll of your own making? (i think so)

in any case - as i sit there, overwhelmed with this menu - and starving, sushi chef asks if i'm ready... i say while i look, let's start with a spicy tuna roll

[listen - i've had amazing omakase nigiri sushi, but that's not what i'm expecting here - let's be realistic]

it comes pretty quickly - and i'm actually pleasantly surprised

for the next 35 minutes, i order 6 more rolls
roll after roll

one from the softshell crab section
one from the eel section
couple from the shrimp tempura section

the special rolls are massive

and they are all DELICIOUS

i was incredibly nervous of spending my first evening in Vegas explaining to my buddies that i ate a lotta strip mall sushi and was spending the night in my hotel room worshipping the porcelain gods... no such thing!

after 35 minutes i had zero room for dessert or anything else (it was still included - and i still had another 25mins to go)

but all things being equal, for $21.95 - i definitely think i came out a winner
one of the best value / best lunches I've had in Vegas... Period!

can't wait to go back, next time I'm in Vegas

Out in Vegas for business and my boyfriend and I had only 1 thing in our agenda... AYCE SUSHI! I did a quick yelp search of what was closest to our hotel and found this spot with 5 stars . 

To say the least, we were really blown away by the top-notch service, unique flavors and fresh selection at Sushi Way. The salmon tartar, poke and sashimi were all solid. In addition our waiter was so kind to offer all the best recommendation. Some of the unique things we tried were the Sexy Lady (topped with coconut) and the Carrot top ( topped with fried carrots). I was really impressed to see some of these dishes that have never been done before.  

This will likely be my new "go to" spot when I make the trip out again. Hats off to the staff for a job well done!
Great sushi place! Had it 3 times this week only. Love everything about this place! And this fish pieces are huuuuge. Super super sushi place.
I have never been so satisfying eating at a sushi place and it's all you can eat! Their sushi taste great! The staff I give 5 stars for sure!!! Highly recommend their fresh oyster, sweet shrimp!!!!!

The busser was Awesome!  The food was just ok. The server was THE WORST I have ever had! I've worked in the industry for 17 years. I ALWAYS over tip. I understand a person can have a bad day. She was SO rude I didn't leave her a dime. I'll never go back!

First time here and already the food is tasting delicious. I would definitely come back here again for the ayce sushi. Service was great and the food is awesome. I would recommend this place to my friends and family that comes to Vegas.

By far one of the worst service experiences ive had, twice now....I eat more than my fair share of sushi and both times I've been here I've waited 15 mins to have my water filled, constantly having to ask to place another order. I honestly wish I could give this place 0/5 stars but the food was mediocre, def not as good as other reviews state. I wish I would have learned my less n the first time and not have returned for a second visit. The table behind us is having the same problem. Ah, please don't come here, go to Kaya
The best ayce sushi I ever had in Las Vegas, good sushi, good service and very good environment! For $26 per person, I think it worth every penny! Surly I will be back! Thank you very much!

OK, I'm writing this review as I'm eating so I can remember what I'm ordering. Hope it will be helpful as I'm rating each dish on a 5 scale. Starting off the meal with all their one order only specials including a screaming orgasm-5 , oysters -3, Galbi -4, and sweet shrimp -4.5. 

Round two I'm trying a 
fat ass -5-different, 
something wrong 69 -4.5-orgasm sauce is awesomeness , 
Oh! Jenna -5-like the sweetness of the eel sauce, Sexy lazy Special -5, 
DD -2.5-bland, and 
sushi burrito -3. 
Ok, so I can eat a lot. You can also order half rolls so you can try more AND I have a friend helping out. Here's some more. 
Spicy tuna tar tare -3 not very spicy
Salmon killer -4
Jose special -3.5
Volcano roll -4odd combo
OMG -5
Garlic yellowtail -4
Candy Cane -4basic 

Dessert time. Liked the honey bread but the pineapple sorbet was the perfect end to the meal. 

Service is good for a place like this. Nice, accommodating waitress. A couple orders seemed to get lost. Not a big deal. The bathroom could use a lock. Luckily nobody walked in on me. 
Overall you won't be disappointed here. Many of the rolls are very clever. Good A.Y.C.E. sushi for a very reasonable price and we had no wait on a Sunday night.
Had the all you can eat dinner. Good del @26.95. The seafood is good quality. Would definitely recommend and come again.

This is the best all you can eat sushi place! The staff is great and on top of when you need to order more food. Each time I have been here it has been with a group and the staff has been more than accommodating. Definitely will go back next time I'm in Vegas.

I love the all you can eat because the quality is fantastic and the price is right.  We went here 4 days in a row because we had a great meal every time.  Joy and Julia are both fantastic waitresses!!!

My daughter had to do a restaurant review for school, so we picked somewhere we have never been before. Sushi Way-   So glad she had the report to do.   The sushi here is fabulous, by far the best I've had had in years.  Try the green monster. Yes we are definitely going to drive from across town to eat here.  
It's not far from the strip either for those out of towners to come here too.

Love the food, love the service, love the selection! For the price, you really can't beat this place. The staff is hilarious, so friendly, and the food actually comes out quickly!! Try the cucumber salad, the spicy edamame, and salmon nigiri!
Had a really great meal! Good quality food and my server jane gave me excellent customer service will definately come back again!

We do all you can eat and waiting for long time to get our second round sushi. Also, we did order the Eel sushi, but we waiting for a long time, we double check with the guy who took our order, he said yes, we have it, need to wait for a little bit and said its busy. We had been waiting for this order more than half hour. After we double check with somebody else. We found out he did not put this order in. At the first time we double check with him he should do double check not just yes, it's busy.

This place is silly! One of the best AYCE places I've ever eaten. Can't wait to go back next month. They don't overload the rice which is great! Not far from the strip, but we had a rental car. Price is reasonable. Rolls are awesome.

Your typical place for AYCE sushi. Their rice portion is at its minimum but it's good because you can eat a lot more. There is a time limit for the AYCE 60 minutes for lunch and 90 minutes for dinner.

My boyfriend and I ordered a lot from the nigiri items than the rolls and everything we ordered there were great. 

There was only on server, which was hard to order  faster than usual but she was nice.

Wonderful service and amazing quality and variety in food. By far my favorite sushi place in Vegas. The quality of the fish is great, very vibrant color which significances the freshness. Will be going here every time I'm in town.

By far the best sushi I have ever had. I've always been skeptical to try a new sushi place because I'm scared I won't enjoy the food. This place had the freshest food I have ever had. Ever order was delicious. The service was amazing. If there was 6 stars I would give 6 stars. Definitely will come back and I might replace my favorite sushi spot
Worst sushi I ever tried. Ordered delivery, it came pretty quick but I can't eat it. Doesn't look and taste fresh. Very disappointed

These guys are Sushi Rock Stars!!! They might be the new kids on the block, but they have the freshest Sushi in Vegas. The owner and Chef Jun, has a passion for Sushi and you can taste it in his creative dishes. I highly recommend Sushi way... It's the best way :) You must try the Poki Salad yum!!!!

My wife found this place on Yelp and it was pretty new.  There is a lunch and dinner menu for the all you can eat, but highly suggest you pay $5 dollar extra to get the dinner menu.  You get raw oysters, Kalbi beef, salmon, oh shoot I forgot the other ones.  Pretty much lots of sushi selection and the best part is you can order a half roll which is really nice so you can try different ones.  The quality of the sushi is great as it does not have the fishy smell at all. Overall a great value and great food, would recommend.

This is not the place to go on your lunch break. There were two waitresses and two sushi chefs. We sat in a table. I think if maybe we sat at the bar, the service would have been a little faster? It was by far the longest lunch I ever had. The appetizers came out fairly fast, but our sushi took forever and a day. The sushi chefs were very slow. Everyone around us seemed to be wondering the same thing, where is the food?!

The decor is very simple. There was a TV but it wasn't playing anything. I think if that was on, it would have helped with my boredom while waiting for my food. I think they could improve the atmosphere with better decor considering this is close to the strip and the restaurants around this area are nice.

The sushi was ehhh. Nothing was extraordinary. Nothing I had to have more of. Some things were okay, some were not good. We went for lunch, but the lunch AYCE doesn't include some of the items I wanted, like sea urchin (uni) and fresh oysters so I paid the dinner price. I never eat sushi without having uni. This was by far the worse uni I've ever had. First off, it was a really small amount. Second off, it left a really bad bitter taste in your mouth, which means the uni was not fresh.

We were completely underwhelmed by this place. I don't understand why it's so highly rated. There's so many places out there and I would have to say this is my least favorite. We won't be back.o
Just came in town from Los Angeles. Having tried a few all-you-can eat sushi places around Vegas, this deserves the 5 stars. Good food and great service- thanks Monica!
The sushi was very good, the fried calamari was good, however, the service was not great, the waiters did mot know the menu
AYCE Buffet with a great selection of items. would definitely recommend the nigiri! We ordered multiple rolls, nigiri, udon, oysters, scallop skewers, and the screaming 9
Came here for a work conference. For the price best sushi I have had. And awesome service

We must have come on an off night. It was just awful. They use cheap, low quality rice that's also cooked badly. I resorted to cooked food because I just couldn't eat the nigiri. The fish is fine though but sushi needs good rice, too. The handroll rice was a bit better. And they put this overly citrus-y ponzu (I realize ponzu has citrus in it but this thing is out of balance) on a lot of the nigiri which is just... why??
Outstanding service and the screaming orgasm was orgasmic.  Japanese lasagna was the bomb too.  We day at the bar and the chefs were awesome...very helpful and attentive

Very pleased... an upscale "All U Can Eat" ..  the baked mussels will blow your mind!  All the rolls our group had were excellent quality, the yellowtail fav of course.  Friendly accomodating staff.  Would highly recommend.

First time here and completely pleased.  More of an intimate place. The food was great.  The service was great.  It's open late til 2am so it's great for people who work on the strip or are staying nearby.  They also offer a stamp card for locals and after your 10th visit you get one free. I will be back!

I had al a carte while I was here but I really wanted to touch upon the service with this place. Absolutely unparalleled. Our server was timely with each order, had a very useful system for getting orders from all you can eat guests, and he was always there to answer our questions about the menu. 

Aside from that is the style of the sushi bar itself. Dim with casual lighting. Very sensual and I really like the fact that they play rnb and 90's 2000's hi hop!! 

Would recommend this place for any sushi eating fiend that enjoys a vast menu . I had very basic items, but my friends ordered a lot from their all you can eat side of the menu. GET THE SEXY LAZY SPECIAL!!

Overall awesome experience! Thank you!
Wish I found this place sooner than later. Great staff and service. Let's not forget about the food. There was a party in my tummy and it was a good party!!

The best sushi in Vegas. Great fast services, we must ordered at least 80 orders of nigiri  sushi. Plus another 30 plus items on the menus....
The quality of fish is sushi grade. They even served from a fresh box of unis. 
Jeanne, our waitress is so efficient  and courteous, happy and patient.  she is the best waitress that every restaurant wish to have.
This is our sushi restaurant in Vegas,  we are locals and hapy to see a great sushi restaurant near us.


We'll come back for sure.

This is my third time at Sushi Way and each visit has kept me coming back again. The service is great, the chef is friendly, and the sushi is fresh. Not sure what else you could ask for from AYCE sushi.

I want to love this place. The AYCE price is $21.95. You can order almost everything on the menu. You can get a lot of sushi creations for one price.

However, the execution of the sushi was lackluster. The rice was toothy and slightly too vinegary. The fish items tasted less that perfectly fresh. They lacked the creamy mouthfeel of higher grade sushi.

My favorite dishes was the salmon tartare app, which had salmon that was admittedly sliced improperly for tartare. It sat atop crab salad, diced red onions, and avocado. The dish was good in a grocery store sushi way: decent flavor combo, but ingredients tasted as if they had sat out a bit too long. Not unsafe food practices, just not fastidiously prepared.

The salmon roe tasted fresh and was tasty. 

None of the dishes blew me away. It was just an OK meal. The service was prompt and cordial but not particularly caring or friendly despite how close I was to the sushi chefs.

I wouldn't recommend this place. Their reviews are high because the price is attractive for an AYCE near the vegas strip. Thr execution was poor.
It was yum and I really liked our server. She was very attentive and courteous. Wish I recalled her name. She had long hair. Will be stopping again for sure on our next trip to Vegas!

First time here based by a recommendation of a friend. 
Service is great, friendly, helpful and prompt waitress and hostess. 
Food was delicious. Sushi is fresh and cooked food sooo good. 
Recommend the Galbi and fried calamari. 
Would highly recomend .

Ate here about 4:45 pm on Sun/21 Sep:
- Server (Kelly?) was great.
- Food was great. With AYCE you can order anything on the menu and the "Chef's Specials" of the day (sign posted near the entrance).  Unfortunately they were out of Kalbi (Korean ribs). 
- Free drink with a Yelp check-in ($2.50 value for a soda, free refills).
- Sushi Way and Jjanga seem on-par with each other.  I would prefer Sushi Way if I'm on the Eastside, and Jjanga if I'm on the Westside.
- The plaza it's in seems to have lots of restaurants I should try eg Urban Turban.  Concentra clinic is also here so should I need to endure a 2+ hr wait for non-emergency medical help, this plaza is a good choice to dine & wait.

$26.95 all you can eat a la carte sushi dinner? Say whaaaaa...  Excellent quality fish, good ambiance and service. Even dessert is good. This place is a magic hidden gem. Good thing i don't live in Vegas, otherwise i would get really fat. 
Oh and their oyster is to die for.

I suspect this place gets many great reviews due to restaurant offering free drink for a review. The food is mediocre and waitress is snippy when asked for specific seating that is available. Some standouts on the food are the sushi nachos and the salmon belly.
This place is close to convention center, and quality was good than any AYCE sushi place.

Not sure where to go with this since the pics of my food look dope and the service was spot on...

but...

...something seemed up with the wateriness of some of the sushi, almost like there was a condensation problem going on in the fridge and some water collected in the tray. A lot of the pieces seemed just wet, even my girlfriend noticed and mentioned so it wasn't just in my head or something. The salmon wasn't totally fresh and neither was the red snapper...and they were out of halibut...bummer. Also, they seared a lot of the pieces even though I'm not into searing it (hence why people go for sushi...uncooked fish, right!?)...maybe they were trying to cover up something.

Anyway with all that above, why 4 stars instead of 3 (or less). The service was great, it wasn't busy and we had a ton of "no rice" arrangements thrown at us left and right made up on the spot that seemed limitless (see pics)...and oh yeah...Tempura. Coconut. Shrimp.

This place came recommended from a couple AYCE sushi fans and I can see it has potential. 

Perhaps I'll give them another shot to earn that 5...(if Sakana has an hour wait).

This is place is awesome! 5 stars.

Their AYCE menu goes 21.95 for lunch(11:30am-4pm)  and 26.95 for dinner(4pm-2am). Their sashimi is fresh! Great selection of sashimi as well. I tried the salmon, shrimp, octopus, shrimp and surf clam. They were not chewy or even very fishy tasty. They were savory, smooth and delicious! Their rolls are magnificent. Well presented and flavored. My new favorite in Las Vegas! :)

The experience was very average. Pros: the service staff was fast and pleasant (not overly nice). The salmon killer roll is edible, and the fried ice cream dessert is tasty. Cons: Stay away from the "I love sushi" & the salmon teriyaki plate.

This restaurant was a little hard to find but worth it.  It is located next to a tacos n beer bar.  My husband n I walked into the restaurant around 11p...its a dimly lit small place.  The servers are friendly.  They offer an all u can eat sushi (off the menu) for lunch n dinner.  We ordered ala carte n enjoyed our selections (sorry, writing this review 3 weeks after our visit so kinda forgot what we ordered).  I do know we left full n happy.  We will make it a point to revisit next time in lv

Found my new lunch spot! 

Tuesday's special is 50% off beer and sake. The AYCE pricing is standard- $21ish for lunch and $27ish for dinner. It's right next to the old Firefly.

Our waitress was the best! Didn't catch her name, but she was super on top of things- refills, taking away plates, etc. She was awesome (and Korean, like us :] ). The sushi chefs were extremely attentive and made great sushi. The fish was fresh and plentiful. They didn't skimp at all on the fish to rice ratio. Not everyone enjoys this, but the sesame seeds were a different thing from my usual and I liked it.

Warning; the tartare has a bed of artificial crab meat in the bottom.

Salmon skin hand roll is a must try!

As an obsessed sushi-eater, I had to try this new place in town and boy was I not disappointed! The fish is fresh, top-quality, and delicious! The appetizers were good and what I love the most about this place is that they offer great variety of delicious rolls, ordered as a full roll or half roll! My fave place in town do not allow us to order half rolls so I never got to try a variety of rolls and usually stick with the nigiri but now I can! Besides the food, the service was good and the place is clean (which is pretty important in my book!). This place has definitely become one of my top AYCE sushi restaurants. I will definitely frequent this place more, despite living in the other side of town!

I really really wanted to give them a 4 star rating but the food is the star and it wasn't even close to that so like 3.3 rating I guess. I'm basically rating this a 3 because of a couple things. AYCE sushi is one of my favorite things to eat and I always order the same things I would get at other establishments and compare them to each other. I feel like everything here is covered in eel sauce or yum yum or ponzu here. it's not a bad thing but it's also not a good thing. I really like those flavors but when every dish seem to taste the same it gets boring. rice doesn't stay together on the nigiri and that's a big no no. the fish quality was ok it wasn't the best. I also think that the people that are working here need to be a little more educated on sushi we asked the waitress if she knew what deep fried shrimp heads were and she acted like we were crazy to mention it like what is that? Lol kinda funny but I think they have the location to get the people in but I think there are many other sushi places that are way better than this place. oh I will say my favorite thing here was the salmon skin handroll.

OH SNAP!! 

I am not going to lie, my favorite food is sushi and I have gone to so many sushi bars including non-ayce AND ayce and this place has to be the BEST AYCE SUSHI I have ever had in 20+ years of my life. This is my REAL and HONEST review. It is so unfortunate that I cant express and write everything on here on Yelp. JUST COME AND TRY IT YOURSELF.

Warning though, I think this restaurant is pretty new. You know what that means? The waiters and waitresses are soooooooo new and they are DEFINITELY not fully trained YET so they are freaking slowwwww. I mean REAL slow and even if you are trying to get their attention, they are caught up with whatever they are doing so wont give all their time to you, which is a bit upsetting.

But, let me talk about sushi now, after all, this place is AYCE sushi restaurant. OHEMGEE, the freshest fish ever!! Every piece I had at the day of my visit, had AWESOME flavor, cut and presentation. I was very very impressed. One thing that I really admired about this sushi bar was that they cut the fish after they get your order. Why is that surprising? Well, many of AYCE places have cut their fish in advance so that they can make sushi a lot faster to serve a big mass of people. I guess it is convenient for them but its not necessarily good for us. Fish can get dry and the taste will definitely be different. I dont know if that played a big role but my sushi tasted GREAT! I loved it and I ate so much.  Their hamachi was seriously the best I have ever had at any AYCE places. To top that hamachi, their AMAEBI WAS BOMB. I seriously have NEVER seen this AMAEBI QUALITY ANYWHERE (AYCE) before. Period. It was HUGE, MEATY and SWEET! I dont remember every one of them but everything I tried was so good. Their special for the night included Salmon Belly and DEAR, it was fatty and it just melted in my mouth. I love SALMON and it was just PERFECT.

Now shifting to the appetizers, I only tried one, Coconut shrimp tempura and I am soooo glad I ordered that because it was amazingly good. The sushi chef actually recommended it and I absolutely devoured it. In fact, I ordered twice!! I really like that they come out warm and super crispy, fresh out of the fryer. Again, not many places do this. They usually have a lot of them fried, and just kind of give it to us, semi-warm and it is never crispy. Batter was ultra thin and shrimp was large. There were just the right amount of coconut on the outside batter, and it was just sooooo good!

They have honey bread as one of the options in the desserts, which is very rare to find elsewhere. It was pretty good but please order it without the ice cream, whip cream and chocolate drizzle. I only like to eat the honey bread. It was crusty and tasted good. It would have been a lot better if I knew it was coming out like that with all the extra that I dont care about.

To make things short, you will never find this quality at any other AYCE restaurants. They are at their best right now especially since they just opened. I hope they keep it the same and never downgrade. I will definitely come back whenever I am coming back to Vegas! You locals are lucky to have AYCE places like Sushi Way
Service was absolutely terrific and presentation on Sushi was second to none. Definately try the Whos Your Daddy roll!!

Got the AYCE dinner for 4 people. Everything was delicious. The service is fast and friendly. We were recommended a lot of good stuff from the menu. (Hint, if there's a star order it!) The desert is fantastic as well. For the price you'll be hard pressed to find a sushi place in or near Vegas that offers as much quantity and quality. Sushi Way is the only way.

I am reluctant to write this review knowing it will only raise their profile and more people will discover this restaurant... but it was that good, people deserve to know. The sushi and 'all you can eat' menu were just amazing. The server we had was great, helped with recommendations and was very accommodating. The sushi chefs were the fastest I've seen and their presentation was great. The selection was exactly what I was looking for in an 'all you can eat' too. This will be on my to-do list every time I visit! Wish I'd discover this sooner.

This one of my favorite spots I have ever been to. I love the appetizers, fresh food, and service. If your ever fresh off the plane and craving this don't make the mistake of continuing your search. Sushi Way stays open late, and opens pretty early to serve your appetite. I recommend the Burning Your Stomach every time if your into spicy food. Enjoy Yelpers!

I would give ZERO stars if I could,
We went there on a Wednesday night, by Friday morning everyone who went all had the stomach "flu" virus, which isn't a flu at all, but is cause by bacteria found in contaminated foods.
We were all sick, throwing up and all had diarrhea, I am never going back here again! Either Someone in the kitchen is not washing their hands, or they are not prepping their foods properly!! 
STAY AWAY!
The service here was wonderful. Very good food especially the side dishes. You have to try the bacon wrapped scallops! Definitely would come back here.

I love Sushiway! This is one of my newest late night sushi place in Vegas. I have been here 4,5 times. They provide a lot of nigiri and the eel hand roll is my favorites. The nigiri is very fresh also. Only complaint is one server she is really slow and  not really friendly. It took long time to serving our table.

It is a small place so come early for a table.  The place is packed by 12:30 pm.  Lunch took about 2 hrs to eat.  There are 2-3 waitress and they are running around to get to everyone.  For a party of 6 or more there is automatic service charged included on the bill.  It is clear on the bill, unlike some restaurants that does not point this out.  The variety of selection from cooked food, sushi and sashimi are great.  The desserts were good too:  Michu ice cream, friend banana & ice cream and tempura ice cream. There is also a frequent award cards to get you a free email after the 10 one.
All meal is great! I go for All-you-can-eat so I order almost everything. Sushis are all fresh especially oyster! It's a must! All red menu is worth to try!

Just called this place to ask a few menu questions and was instantly hung up on. 

Well fuck you too sir! I'll take my party elsewhere!
This place is bomb!! I love this fresh fish&love this kitchen food i will go here again for sure!^^

I was really craving sushi and came upon this place Friday night. It was not too busy and we were seated right away. Our server, Joy, was a delight. She was super attentive and helpful with everything on the menu. She even offered a few recommendations which ended up being my favorite thing we ordered. This place is definitely worth visiting if you're in the area!

If you're looking for a good sushi restaurant, you can't beat Sushi Way. Just off the strip and plenty of parking. All you can eat is available, but not necessary. The rolls are always good and they have a huge variety on the menu. Lots of tables and never overly crowded.

I started getting my sushi fix over here after Sin City Sushi closed down about 6 months ago. Sin City has since reopened, but I guess my heart is big enough for two sushi joints! Jun the owner is a friendly young guy who has been in here every time I've come in. The quality of fish is usually excellent and their servers are very friendly and on top of things. I recommend the white tuna topped with jalapeño and the Rock and Roll roll. The nigiri here is usually of excellent quality, though the last time I came in (my 4th or 5th visit) a few things felt like they were a little past their prime unfortunately. That was on a Sunday, so maybe it was right before their new order came in or something. Every other time it's been fantastic and the service is so good, I say keep them at 5 stars!
Wanted some sushi in Vegas so I yelped this spot and went for it! The sushi was delicious and the service was excellent! This place is located a bit off the strip but was definitely some good sushi!

I have fully committed to Sushi Way. I've been to almost all the sushi spots in town. I used to go to Yama all the time, and moved to Sakana a few months ago, but they can be kinda/really rude at times. Sushi Way is the best hands down

Ive been searching good sushi around my work at casino. Then i found it. I know there is kaisen sushi around here. They are not ayce.   but i like all you can eat sushi better. SUSHIWAY IS AYCE.!!! Awesome!!

Would not order from this place again, I ordered 3 different rolls for a to-go order and then it all came back completely wrong, called to see if they could correct the issue but nobody took accountability down to the owner who said that everything on their end was done correctly. I give the young lady on the phone a lot of credit for putting up with the bull**** because she didn't have to endure that flake from me. 

Given that my order was wrong I couldn't tell you what exactly I got, but the rolls we not as advertised and they only gave me 6 pieces for each roll, but I guess I can attrition that to it being a wrong order though. 

From the looks of it the portions are small and nobody has any regard to taking accountability if a phone order was done correctly. But the reviews stay high so I suppose the restaurant dinning experience might be better? Either way I wouldn't coming or ordering from this establishment ever again!
Best sushi ever !! It was so fresh and all you can eat . Was in vegas 5 days ate here for 2 days. Highly recommend

This place was great for all you can eat sushi! Everything was very delicious and the rolls are huge! Definitely my favorite sushi spot :) 
waitress was very friendly! Lots of variety in sushi! Definitely recommend

I'm surprised this place has such high ratings. The service was absolutely horrendous. I walked in with a group of 5 people and right when we walked in we were not greeted by any of the staff. I work at an AYCE sushi restaurant in Southern California and this type of behavior would never fly. Sushi Way is an AYCE restaurant and the server was writing down my tables order on a note pad. With that being said, only half of our items showed up that we ordered. They need to develop a better method for keeping track of the orders. At my restaurant, we have a sheet with all of the AYCE items and the customer can check the items they want, then the server picks up the sheet and inputs it into a POS system. On top of that, the food was not good. The fish was not fresh, and it was very inconsistent. Luckily I was only visiting Vegas for the weekend because I will never have to return to this place again.

Had good selection of sushi too choose from and open late! The sushi is nicely made and delicious. Was tired of Yama and wanted to try something new and if your looking to eat sushi this is a spot to drop by. Will be coming back sooner or later!
The sushi was so good and fresh I couldn't believe it was only 25 a person. Could've had more attentive service but overall awesome staff. Go try!

I really like this place!  Great sushi with lots of options on the AYCE menu that you don't find everywhere. Loved the coconut shrimp!  Richard was our server and he was super friendly!  Will definitely be back!!
The worst service ever. They messed up my order, and forgot my fiancés order. The avocado rolls have literally no avocados in them. I'm shocked by all the positive reviews.

Very nice rice to fish ratio if you like nigiri. Also very good selection of appetizers and rolls. The sushi chefs were very attentive. Of course at around 5pm on a Wednesday is when I entered the restaurant. Believe it or not I was the only one in the whole restaurant sitting at the sushi bar. 

Tho the sushi chefs were attentive to my needs the waitress for appetizers orders were not as attentive in my opinion. It started out as very attentive then shift changed the the new waitresses was not as attentive as the previous one. Otherwise it would have been a perfect 5 stars. 

I wanted to try all their nigiri to test out their freshness, it was a hit and miss. They had salmon belly for the special black board special and it was delicious and unlike some places they didn't limit you which was nice. The fish to rice ratio to me was right on very little rice.  

My favorite nigiri's that I tried
1. Squid
2. Octopus
3. Eel
4. Tomago
5. Plain tuna 
6. Halibut
7. Albacore
8. Yellow tail 

I also tried their gyoza, kalbi and pork belly all very delicious. 

I also tried few half rolls cow boy roll was ok, big easy special roll was delicious. I was by myself so it was hard to try many rolls but they did offer half rolls and it wasn't packed with rice but very tightly packed small amount of rice in the rolls. The rolls were very skinny compared to most places in Vegas .

I honestly would rate this place one of the top 5 best all you can eat sushi restaurants in Las Vegas.

If your not familiar with the area or just visiting it's very hard to miss the turn into park. The lot was spacious and you must turn into the "the park 3900" plaza on corporate st.

Very nice overall experience. 
Good price, it is all-you-can-eat lunch and dinner, but food quality is far beyond my expectation. Their sweet shrimp tasted very fresh, Uni has no good presentation but also fresh. Other foods we ordered are good too. I didn't really find anything bad. The only thing is they might need more waiters , as not in the peak time their place is still almost full of customers. 
Worthy to go their again.
Great quality AYCE! and they don't stuff you with rice.. They use very little rice I love it !
Amazing sushi! Fresh tasting and creative! Spicy Garlic Edamame was bomb!!!  Definitely coming back!

Went to Sushi Way last night for the first last night and am so glad I did.  Everything was fresh and tasty, the menu was overwelming even to a veteren ayce sushi diner.  So many rolls sounded so good I wish I could have tried more, but I did manage to try the Big Easy, sweet 16, spider roll, hamichi, salmon belly and super white tuna with jalapeño(chef special that day).  The list of appetizers was extensive as well.  The bacon wrapped scallops and kamakazi dynamite were recommended by our chef/owner, who was very friendly and was ready and willing to keep our sushi flowing.  I live in Reno and only get down to Vegas 4 to 5 times a year,  I cant wait to come back and try some more menu items.  I highly recommend having dinner here SO GOOD!

The best AYCE in town. I am a huge fan about ayce, i tried a lot but this one is completely different . It s more like a fine sushi place , the quality is definitely here. i tried so many dish , i will not able to do the list but a few are very remarquable : the cherry blossom is a peace of art and the sexy lazy special is very tasty and orignal ( if you like coconut).The service is very fast , that is not always common in a usual acye sushi.
Good all you can eat sushi! Liked the multitude of no rice roll options so you don't get too full on rice too quickly. The sea urchin was fresh and had lots of flavor as well. Service is quite fast.

Great sushi for a great price. They've got a huge variety of styles and flavors that kept me asking for more. Some friends and I went in the early afternoon and the place was quiet and gave the waitress time to make sure we had everything we needed. The nigiri was fresh and didn't need to hide behind anything. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in town!
The best sushi I've ever had!!! Get the super white tuna nigiri. We just got all you can eat and I'm pretty sure we are making a dent in the worlds white tuna population .

Best AYCE sushi in Vegas. That's a big claim, but I think it's spot on. Small place so hard to get a table on a Friday or Saturday for a big group, but worth the wait. All the rolls are delicious. You get oysters, mussels and galbi beef option, too! You can even order mini udon, shrimp tempura, etc. Goyemon and Sushi Mon are good, too, but everything is sitting on top of a California roll. This one actually has great rolls filled with all different things. Soft shell crab, tuna, etc. Also, the one thing I love is they have kids prices. $14.95 for kids! I'll pay that price as opposed to the other places where you have to pay full price for kids. And if you have a kid that doesn't want sushi, you can pay a la carte. Yeah!!! Love it here!

Sushi way is an awesome local find in vegas away from the casino monotony. Their all you can eat lunch menu is worth it and if you go on tuesdays they have happy hour drinks all day. ;) Our server was super helpful and friendly. She helped us pick out some great rolls and was very attentive. The place has a great mix of traditional and urban vibe.

Read all of the great reeviews on Yelp! And my wife and I decided to try this place out. I was celebrating my birthday along with my best friend who joined us as well. We walked into the restaurant and waited 15-20 minutes before a sushi chef greeted us and told us to have a seat at a 4 person table in front of us. As we began to sit, the waitress finally came over and told us that we'd need to wait an additional 10 minutes to be seated. As we all stood there confused as to the service or lack thereof, the guests of the entire restaurant seemed as though they were also very disappointed. We finally decided to just sit ourselves down after 15 more minutes of waiting and nobody caring to acknowledge us. We sat at our table for another 20 minutes and as we sat there, two other small parties came in and were seated. The parties of people that came in after us were brought water and greeted before us. When the waitress finally decided to come and greet us, we brought this to the her attention and she rudely said that they only had two people working and had no sense to respectfully apologize. Had she done that, it would have been different, but the fact that we were treated with disrespect, we got up and left this place that so many others have given 5 stars. So disappointing!!!! Good thing we were in Vegas and had so many other options to choose from! It did set us back and as a result, we were late to a show after finally getting something to eat.

Worst carry out sushi ever. Rolls were poorly made and tossed into the carry out box. Scallops smelled so bad the box and room were filled with a bad odor. The rolls were filled with fish that was not fresh and not sushi grade. The tuna negiri was not good either. Food was 20 minutes later than pick up. Cashier could not even print a receipt for me. The restaurant front door was open and the entire place stunk even though they were using a machine to pump in air. Would never go back to this horrible spot.

Our new go-to place for AYCE sushi.
Good selection, creative flavor, fresh sushi, and they serve alcohol.

This is a great AYCE sushi restaurant I'm surprised I haven't tried this place sooner!! We ordered a wide variety of nigiri sushi and they were all very fresh! They even have oysters on the half shell.. most AYCE places do not offer that. The salmon belly, Cajun albacore and seared tuna were simply amazing and are must haves. 

Our server Ploy was fantastic. She took our orders quickly and the food also came quickly. She was attentive and was also very nice. Our whole party ate a lot and definitely had a good time. 

I'd certainly come back in the future and I'd recommend this place to everyone.

I just back from this AYCE sushi resturant. The resturant was dark and seating was average in comparison to other sushi resturant. I did notice that there weren't any seatings for 2. Not a big deal but if you come with just one other person expect to have 2 empty seats next to you. (Kinda kills the romantic vibe). I came in during a slow time so I'm not sure how busy it gets but the store was basically empty for most of the time. There is also a bar where you can watch the chef crate the sushi right in front of you. WHAT! Pretty cool. We didn't sit there though we just sat at a table. There was only one waiter while we were there but another showed up as we left. The waiter that helped us was very attentive without being intrusive. It was a little hard to understand him but that wasn't a big deal. He was very nice.

The food. Only have one word for it... amazing. (The 5 stars probably killed the suspense of that but whatever). We had a lot of sushi rolls. Probably around 10. Needless to say we were pretty stuffed after we left. They were all good. Some better than others. The only one that I didn't particularly enjoy was the fat ass. They don't call it that for no reason. It was huge! However it did taste a little bland compared to the other rolls. It was still good though... I don't eat spicy food. Like at all and I was disappointed to see most of the menu items had some sort of spicy ingredient. I was a little turned off when I saw that the sushi I ordered had jalapeños... until I tasted it. FREAKING AMAZING! The spiciness wasn't overwhelming at all. It added a small zesty taste to the sushi. Coming from a person that hates spicy food. It was the best thing I have ever tasted with jalapeños on it. They do offer a fairly small desert menu. I got the green tea ice cream. It was good as expected. They offer one desert per person if you get the ayce deal.

They do have a few rules that actually didn't bother us at all. A common rule in most ayce sushi resturant is that if you don't finish the roll then you have to pay full price for it. This is the norm so it didn't really bother us. Also we saw that there was an hour time limit to eat on the menu. However it was slow and they didn't really hold us to that. I imagine during more busy time of day they might be more strict on this rule.

Decor average and no two table seatings 4 stars
     Add seatings for 2 and this will immediately jump to a five. They probably won't though because the resturant was a little small.

Service attentive without being intrusive 5 stars

Food amazing 5 stars

If you haven't been here. Definitely check it out. They gave us a coupon for free meal on our 11th visit. We will definitely be back and are looking forward to our future free meal and many more to come!

This is located where the old Firefly was. My husband bookmarked this place and we came after venturing to M&M world. We went on a weeknight around 730 and there were only a handful of people. It's hard to pass by if you do not know exactly where the place is, when I called to ask what shopping center the restaurant is located, the person who answered the phone seemed a bit confused lol. It's where Tacos & Beer is, if that makes it easier to find.

AYCE dinner was like $27 a person?! I thought the server was really nice (didn't catch HIS name though). Also I thought the restaurant was nice and clean. But, I have to say it's not better or worse than any other sushi restaurant, it's comparable to Goyemon, Osyhi, etc.

The one thing I have to rave about was the Sushi Nacho. Omg, YUM!!!!!!! That was the best thing they had. I would've ordered like 10 of those if I wasn't full from the other rolls. But honestly, I can't really remember the rolls being that great or special except for that one. Their Japanese lasagna was also good, they put a lot of cream cheese on it.

Fish seemed and tasted fresh. 

If you're in the area, go check it out. I just wouldn't go out of my way to eat there.
First time here. Unbelievably good. Had the all u can eat lunch. Excellent quality and great service. They have a huge selection of rolls.

Virakon was the person that helped us tonight and I must say this was one of the best sushi experiences we have ever had. Service was excellent, Sushi was fresh and we had an amazing time. These people know how important customer service is!
Thanks ploy and Michael for an amazing experience. The fish literally melts in your mouth. If you haven't tried this place then you're missing out !

I want to love this place; I really do. I absolutely love nigiri, so when someone tells me that there's an AYCE sushi place that serves fresh quality cuts, I come running. These tippers were right on the dart. 

Perhaps it was just my experience in particular that was bad. 

I came on a Wednesday, not quite yet during a rush period, but nearing. 

I started with my usual orders: uni, salmon, tamago, yellowtail, you name it. Everything had a refreshing taste to it, top notch quality that was almost on par with Sushi Koma. I particularly thought that their sweet shrimp was the best I've seen in an AYCE so far. 

I had a delightful time with the food but... not so much with the chefs. 

They took a long time, and when I say long, I mean a REALLY LONG time. I'm usually not so picky about the wait since I know that I happen to order a lot at a time. However, after waiting for over 10 minutes before the rush hour even began, I was starting to get suspicious. 

I timed them. 11 minutes, 14 minutes, a whopping 17 minutes. Even when my order just consisted of oysters, 13 minutes.

Perhaps making nigiri does take a long time, one by one, as my waitress assured me; however, in comparison to other sushi places in the valley, this is by far the slowest. Where is the competitiveness in that? 

I watched the chefs. I literally had my eyes hawking at them with laser focus. They were talking, chit-chatting, laughing, having fun amongst themselves, and NOT working on my order. 

Hm, maybe that's why.

There's a new kid in town for all you can eat sushi. 

There's a lot of these in Vegas and the quality is all over the place. This one is on point. 

Almost everything on the menu is included in the deal. Cool presentation in the little serving plates as well.  Our server Richard was very pleasant and helpful. 

Highly recommended.

The sushi was quite good... that's the only reason it didn't get one star. 

We sat down and got all you can eat... ordered a bunch of stuff and as it was ready we got our order one at a time... that's just fine with me.... we can eat while we wait.... well that's what I wanted to do.

It was 20 minutes before we got the attention of a waiter to get our second order of food... we placed our order and made it a little more substantial so we wouldn't worry about waiting so much.... I thought!

First: all but one of our half order of rolls came to the table as full rolls.... (we ordered half rolls) filling us up quickly...
Second: they started delivering food we didn't order to the table. 
Third: we ordered 7 orders of chef's choice "Omakase" after 40 minutes of waiting we finally got our omakase and it was 7 orders of the same thing.. not a variety even the waiter thought it shouldn't of been all one thing.... 

This was horrible... the service was astoundingly bad.

After whiting this review I can't even give it 2 stars
.... it just upset me that much more.... it felt like a scam... trying to fill us up with crap we didn't want and burn our time out with so much waiting.

This is a cool new place in town! The fish was fresh and full of flavors! The salmon is not a very big cut but the rice portion is small so it's balance! It's not busy for a saturday noon so the service was fast! Our waitress was really nice! She went back and forth to ask us if we need anything and she didn't forget our order! Definitely come back here soon

Another fantastic experience at this fine sushi establishment. This time I had more of the nigiri selections and they were fantastic. My favorites were the garlic tuna and seared salmon. Truly melt in your mouth delicious.

Other winners were the kamikaze dynamite, jalapeno poppers, wakame, and poke salad. I could easily eat this every day. Plus, the AYCE lunch is $21.95, a terrific value. Can't wait for my next yummy visit. Until then Sushi Way.
They have uni in their ayce menu, and the sweet shrimp is very big and fresh.  Good deal!  I will def come back again for my next visit to vegas
went there for my first dinner during my Vegas trip, all ingredients are so fresh n yummy! AYCE menu is in a such good value! would def recommended it! don't forget to order the salmon belly!!

Late review, came here over EDC weekend (woohoo what a weekend). Fish was just OKAY. I liked Yama more. There was no wait for Monday lunch time. Service was fine but I think the lower quality of the fish will deter me from coming back. I didn't get sick so that's good, right?

Our favorite AYCE buffet recently closed so needed to find a replacement.  We were pleasantly surprised with Sushi Way.  Great price for both lunch and dinner, great quality sushi, and servers were very nice.  As we researched different establishments, we read that this place had slow service, most likely due to being so new, so we were a little worried about that.  We arrived at 1:30 pm, so slightly after the main lunch time and had no issue.

Good, but not great. There are better ayce sushi joints around. Most popular items are limited to one per person, including dessert. I've tried a lot of menu items here. A few are tasty like their galbi and super white tuna special. But most of their rolls are forgettable and too similar, their screaming orgasm lacks complexity and their salmon tar tare is bland and just too much (it's a meal in itself). Mochi ice cream was bland, plus they need more variety.
Service was very friendly and helpful. 
They treat you good here, and the food isn't bad, but there's much better ayce in the area.

We took a nice walk away from the Strip and we are so glad we did. The only regret: our schedule didn't allow us to come back a second time.
The food is creative, fresh and tasty, everything is included in the all you can eat menu and it's a better value than a la carte.
The service was outstanding and attentive. Our bill came to be double but it was an oversights and the waiter promptly fixed it.

Sushi way is the way to go. Me and my girlfriend had all you can eat sushi. This restaurant is located right on the outside skirts of the strip on paradise road. When we came in its very slow and quiet for a friday. Its your typical ayce sushi menu. I tried their salmon belly nigiri and i was in-love with it. I always order salmon belly or garlic tuna nigiri. The nigiri was well made and tasted very fresh. 

The rolls were good but needed some more sauce in it. The service was fast, and friendly. I would say the quality of the fish is good and the service is great. I would come back again to this place to try more of their other dishes.
Definitely better than expected.  Super fast service and food is not bad.  The kids got a kick out of the of the sushi.

One again, I ordered delivery from this establishment. I have never visited the restaurant in person, and I will limit my review to order accuracy, presentation and food quality.

So, regarding order accuracy: FAIL
This is the oddest part of my whole experience. I ordered, among other things, halibut nigiri. Eat24 called me a few minutes after I placed my order and informed me that they were out. I asked them to replace it with an order of yellowtail. What I received, besides my tuna order, which was fine, was 1 order of unagi (which I did order), 1 order of yellowtail (I think), and one order of salmon!!! And I was billed for a yellowtail roll; 2 dollars more than the yellowtail nigiri that I ordered as a replacement! Eat24 did a great job repairing the mistakes, but it's quite clear that Sushi way is not yet prepared to accept delivery orders.

Presentation: D+
Not one effort was made to present an attractive delivery order. Plain standard styro boxes with no adornments; not even that annoying plastic grass! I ordered wasabi and ginger for three and only got a quarter-sized serving of each. They did have the more expensive throw-away chopsticks though; that got 'em from a "d" to a "d+." 

Food quality: C
My husband loved the tuna; deep red, with very little sinew, and generous fish slices. However, as I've said many times, the heart of sushi isn't fish, it's the rice. And Sushi Way's rice isn't good. No coherence, and if you order some sushi that has a special sauce, like a ponzu instead of the standard soy, they put it directly on the fish before sending it out. Guess what the rice is like when you finally get it! Yep, soggy, no cohesion, very difficult to eat. But again, the quality of the fish was very good.

The bottom line? Clearly, the person who was responsible for contracting with Eat24 didn't consider the ramifications of offering sushi for delivery. I hope the person who is in charge of social media will instruct the staff on proper delivery prep and technique. And yes, presentation. I will order from them again, with prejudice though.

Ahhhmazinggg!! We decided to check to check out Sushi Way because they have great reviews. Wow. They did not disappoint. We were greeted by Alicia and she was absolutely nice  and took care of our drinks. Then Jay came along... boyyyy.. did he take good care of us!! We let him choose everything. We were feeling quite adventurous and we are super glad we did. His selections were amazing!! His attention to detail was simply excellent. I can't stop raving. Kudos to the chefs! Worth the trip off the strip!!

Found a great new sushi place ... I had been looking for one for awhile, and was told by word of mouth by a friend about this place. I will definitely be coming back to this place to get my sushi fix. The portions are perfect not to big or small like at some other places. Definitely if you haven't tried this place I would give it a chance.

I went here with some co-workers for lunch around 3pm and we were the only ones there. We assumed the service would be quick since the place was empty but oh were we wrong.

First off, my friend ordered a roll without the rice and the waitress said that would be totally fine. They deliver the roll and it has rice in it so we told them we ordered it without rice and then the sushi chef said oh no we can't make that roll or any roll without rice....which I know isn't true because I've been to sushi places before where they just roll it in the seaweed. The waitress even explained it to him and he said it would be fine, but then told us he couldn't do it. 

We waited an extremely long amount of time for our food, especially my bento box. By the time I got it, my friends had finished eating. The chef (same one that said he couldn't make the roll without rice) didn't know what went in the bento box apparently, and just didn't make it based upon the conversation I overheard with him and the waitress. I don't understand why he wouldn't have just asked what went in it instead of not making it at all. 

The waitress was extremely nice and friendly, but was nowhere to be found most of the time. We had to get up and find someone to order more food and to ask for our check. She did give us a complimentary green tea ice cream for making us wait so long for my bento box, which was very nice of her. 

There are so many sushi places in Vegas and Henderson that are a million times better than this place. Needless to say, I won't be coming back here.

THE SUSHI AND THE FOOD WAS DELICIOUS! We had a party of 11. Of course we had to wait for awhile and they were SUPER busy & packed. It was definitely worth. Me and my family enjoyed everything we ordered. No complaint whats so ever. And the server assisting us.. she was wonderful. I believe her name was Jay, Jade... something that starts with a J. SORRY. She was chinese & vietnamese. But if you're reading this YOU'RE AMAZING! Thank you for being so patient and being such a hard worker. We appreciate you assisting our family.

I went here last night with my girlfriend and her friend for the first time. We have been to many sushi places in town, but this one was not very good. I can accept a little slower service on a Friday night, it was between 7 and 8:30 for our visit. It did take time to get our orders, they completely forgot one of our orders, but the worst part was the food. 

The sushi was warmer than it should have been. The baked green mussels were drenched in cheese, the rolls were very bland, the candy cane, a soft shell crab roll seemed to not have any crab. The jalapeño poppers were decent, but I suspect those were pre made. 

Over all not a place we will be returning too.
Awesome service.   Fresh product.  Visiting from Cali and would highly recommend!!!!   Great all the way around!!!

Ordered on grub hub for the first time, they said it'd be about an hour and fifteen minute wait, only waited about 30 minutes. Quick delivery and sushi was fresh and delicious. I recommend this place and look forward to future orders.

This place was amazing !!! All you can eat sushi for 27 bucks! Not a bad deal and that included appetizers and desserts too! 

What did I not try is the question! I went with a huge group as I was here for a convention and we all ordered multiple things and shared. I can't tell you a specific roll that was my favorite as there were a lot of favorites .. And worst case scenario if you didn't like anything it wasn't a waste of money since you can order something else. 

Service was great and friendly. 

The oysters how ever my managers complained about weren't they great .. I didn't try it so I can't say from personal experience. 

Otherwise I can see myself coming back if I'm ever back.

Great ayce sushi! Be sure to have Jay as your server, his suggestions were spot on.  The menu had so many great items and rolls, so go with a group so you can try different ones, but be sure to get the screaming orgasm app. You'll wish you could get multiples.

Well let me just say first that I would have like to give sushi way 4 stars based on the food, but it had to many other hang ups keeping me from giving it the 4 star rating. 

My wife, family, and I love to eat sushi. We usually find ourselfs in vegas 1 to 2 times a year. When we come to Vegas we usually eat sushi at least 2 times during our stay. We usually look look on Yelp for new AYCE sushi restaurants. This trip we tried island sushi, and sushi way. Island sushi was a great experience. When I found sushi way it had limited reviews, but the pictures looked great. We decided to go ahead and give it a try.

When we sat we were the only customers there. We put in our order very quickly. The appetizers came out pretty quick,and were very tasty. 

Sushi on the other hand was a different story. There was only one sushi cutter. More customers started to arrive. The sushi cutter looked like he was off in outer space. There was no sense of urgency. There was a 60 min time cap when eating. We were there for 2 and half hours.im guessing they let us go over the time limit because it was taking 10 mins in between half orders rolls.Sometimes when i would look at the cutter,  he would just be starring at the wall as orders were piling up. Maybe he was just ovetwhelmed, either way its made for a bad experiance. 

About 2 hours into lunch another sushi cutter comes frantically running in. It wasn't till he arrived that sushi started coming out.

Also the waiter and waitresses would walk away as you were trying to order. They would say that they had your order down as they walked away, however they would either forget items of bring out wrong items. 

Food was 4 stars, service was 1 star. I decided to go with 3 over all stars. All negative critique aside I will give it another try. If the service is corrected I see 5 star potential.
Vegas locals. Tried it for the first time Friday night. Good Sushi. Good AYCE. Not Yama.

I'm not one to make reviews but they have a little posting in the restaurant to write a review...so I will.   When we first got in they sat us right away and took our drink order.   The guy was very friendly and even gave a suggestion on what his favorite roll was.   So...I ordered that roll.   When we got our food that we ordered it was all very tasty.   The sweet shrimp was really good and a good size (according to my friend since I don't eat that).   Throughout our experience my friend kept ordering "hot" tea.   It was not hot.  Not hot at all.  So that was a disappointment.  It wasn't busy at all the entire time we were eating but they hardly checked up on us.  The ambiance was good, lighting was good with good music.  They switch servers in the middle of us eating which wasn't bad but we didn't know who to flag down when we needed to order something so it took longer than we would have liked to order and get our food.  I would say over all they get a 3.5.  I'm hoping the next visit I have will be better service since the food was pretty good.
The food was excellent and Jay was great and very attentive! The sushi chefs were excellent and catered to what ever your heart desires!

Went back twice in a week for AYCE...coming from chicago, we were skeptical about the ayce at first, but it was definitely a good value! The salmon (and if they have salmon belly on special, go all out!!), fresh oysters and uni were to die for...i am not a fan of rolls, but the Big Easy is a must! you can even do half rolls for varieties. 

3 stars is because we realized the consistency varies among the chefs...our favorite chef shift ended half way during our first dine-in, and the experience wasn't the same since then..
Sushi was amazing!!! Went for dinner before the watching the rebels play. Did AYCE and was able to do half rolls so I could try different roles. Great service.

Sushi was delicious but service was average. I would go back again. You can't beat the price and quality of food. Size of fish compared to rice was generous. All sushi was delicious. Most food came out relatively fast. A great way to try new sushi. Oyster was good for the first order but the next order was luke warm and had murky water in the shell. We told the waitress and she just took it away and probably didn't tell anyone. Kalbi was like warm but flavorful. Baked salmon roll was good. Screaming orgasm was just ok. We didn't think the special orgasm sauce was that unique. 

Service- waitresses were very nice but disorganized. Maybe there were new? When we reordered food from the waitress she told us she wasn't our waitress and to wait for ours. However she was the one who took our original order. She said she was just helping the other waitress out since it was busy and then she decided to take our order. Just odd but she was nice about it. We ordered uni for the table right when we arrived. when we were done and trying to figure what we had not received yet, we asked when it was coming and they said they were out. They should have told us that from the get go. So full but hot dessert since it was included. Mango mochi did not have any flavor. 

Overall good for sushi and would come back and recommend.

Sorry but I was not impressed with this place at all. 

Service was decent, nice people and pretty attentive.  Food was mediocre.  Didn't care for the rolls.  Rice was thick and not that good.  The only thing I thought was decent was the salmon sushi.  

Dessert wasn't that great either.  They only allow you to get only one dessert, which I didn't realize when I ordered it.
