I had the green tea ice cream, it was one little scoop and it was not a good, high quality green tea ice cream.  I also had the strawberry mochi, this was pretty good but it was only one piece cut in half. 

Definitely wasn't worth the all you can eat buffet price and the long walk from the Mirage to get here.
Amazing. Great staff, fast service, clean restaurant, bathroom had no paper but the rest of the experience was wonderful. The food was incredible, better than expected. Will definitely return.

Sushi here is average at best.   So disappointed.  After reading all the great reviews we were expecting better quality sushi.  Servers were fast getting our order and food. But sushi was just average. 
It took forever to get our bill. At least 15 minutes after we were completely done and no one had come over..  We kept trying to wave someone down but no one would make eye contact. My daughter raised her hand and waived and my husband stood up and walked to a waiter to ask for the bill. We had to ask one more time.
quite good food.  the waitress was funny and very attentive.  try the Japanese lasagna it was very tasty and I have never seen it before at a sushi restaurant.

My brother & I went on a Saturday around 7:30 pm, & it was PACKED. Litterally no where to sit but at the sushi bar. I thought to myself that we were going to be neglected for sure. I was so wrong. Our server was very attentive. Since we sat at the bar, we placed our orders directly with the sushi chef, who was unexpectedly friendly & funny. We both had AYCE dinner for $27. The chef was very quick with each item that we ordered, and the rolls, though prepared fast, were delicious & neat, not overly ricey. My brother paid the bill, & he was so impressed that he left a $24 tip. It's a good thing I live on the other side of town or else I would be there about every other week. I did, however, leave with one of those food card things, with the 11th AYCE being free. Although not every other week, I do see myself driving to that side of town every now & again specifically for Sushi Way.
Delicious fresh fish, fast and friendly service. Will definitely come here again, best ayce I've ever had
The volcano roll is different from back in 2015. But the rest of the food and the staff .....THANK YOU AGAIN!.WILL RETURN IN THE FALL!

DELICIOUS, creative, affordable sushi rolls! I am so glad I found this place. It was amazing. The service was also great. Very friendly staff...quick service. Everything was just superb. I will definitely come back to visit whenever I'm in LV! 
Also I had the Baked Salmon Roll and Big Easy Special :-)

"All-you-can-eat sushi.  What a wonderful thing.  It's the perfect mix of sophisticated and sloppy. It combines cultures and styles in a weird way that forces you to reevaluate what you're doing." ? Lev Novak, ThoughtCatalog.com

We tried a new place in Las Vegas for some AYCE sushi.  I must admit that it wasn't bad!  My favorite bites were the salmon belly, the uni, the sweet ebi, and the honey bread dessert at the end of our meal.  I also got my beloved unagi which they didn't drench in too much sauce.  Overall the quality was pretty average and I appreciated thst they didn't try to overload you with rice.

Sushi Way is a cozy little eatery with lots to offer.  The service is so-so and I had to remind our waitress a few times of forgotten items.  While I'm not sure if I want to replace my other AYCE sushi place [which starts with a "G" and sounds like a Pokemon], it's definitely a contender!

I was utterly disappointed with this place.  This is my second time at this place and it was a much different experience the first time.  I would have given it 4-5 stars the first visit but this second time was a very different experience.  We arrived for a 7:30pm reservation and got seated right away since it wasn't that crowded at all.  The place isn't that big of a place and only 4 tables were full when we got there so there was lots of empty tables.  

Our waitress took our first round order of white tuna, salmon skin salads, salmon kama, uni and 3 other rolls.  It took a very long time for the first dishes to come out even though the place wasn't packed...then another person comes and says that he will be our waiter and that our orders will be out soon.  Then he comes back and says that they ran our of uni cause another party ordered all the rest of the uni.  We waited for over 15 mins from placing our order and then they tell us that there is no uni!...Hmmm.  The main reason I came was to experience the uni as I did the first time.  

So we start to get our plates and they must have changed the Salmon skin salad cause it was not the same as before.  It was more like a wet salmon skin mix something...not too sure what it was.  It wasn't very tasty or appealing.  Most of the sushi rolls were decent to good and the salmon kama was actually really good.  So then we order another round of plates and they tell us they ran out of Kal bi or galbi as they call it on the menu.  So now the two most expensive things on the menu are out...okay.  The messed up part is that our waiter tells us that he's sorry but they ran out of Kalbi cause they got slammed with orders.  I looked at him and looked around at the half empty place and wondered how they got slammed with orders to run out when the place isn't even near full.  I thought he was actually joking at first but he was serious.  Keep in mind that this place is open till 2am and it was only 8:30pm.  

We continue with a few more orders and then decide to get dessert and call it a night.  So we order the Fried Ice Cream, Green tea ice cream, and Yuzu.  The waiter comes back and says that they are our of Green Tea Ice cream and also can't make the Fried ice cream cause they don't have the Green Tea ice cream for it.  At this point I just had to laugh cause they ran out of each of the most expensive items on the menu. 

So the lesson here is to make sure if you decide to go here, that they have the items you are most interested in and that AYCE only means it's AYCE of what they may have left.

Amazing AYCE right off the strip. Surprisingly large menu for an AYCE sushi place which also includes sides like dumplings, coconut shrimp tempura, and tuna sashimi (which was amazing). The quality of the sushi was excellent, wait staff was very responsive and friendly, and food came out quickly (sit at the bar if you can). For dessert try the Mochi ice cream and the Honey Bread. So good. Definitely worth a stop if you have a craving for affordable AYCE sushi near Vegas!
Overall good. Food came super quick. Service was good. All the waitresses were very nice. We came before 7pm on Saturday and it was almost empty. The only thing was oyster was not fresh enough.

Wow I have to say I am so happy for a friend from Yelp telling me about this place over a year ago and we kept talking about how we needed to go. We finally had a chance to meet and go here for lunch.
We love sushi and were not real big on eating just rolls. 
This place has a great selection not all just rolls but lots of items to choose from.
We tried so many different things.
The spicy tuna tare tar was so delicious as well as the salmon one, I was in heaven!!
Everything seemed very fresh and all the fish was cut in nice pieces. They did not skimp on the portions of fish. 
There were a few specials on the board we ordered to try and I highly recommend the boom boom special. What a taste and flavor. So many different textures , soft to chew but a little crunch to it with a sauce that I fell in love with! It had a light lemon flavor after taste but not over powering. I even tried eel for the first time! It wasn't bad!
I really enjoyed everything and we had so much on our table I never got any pictures to share.
I will for sure share pictures the next time we go which I hope is very soon again.
We are big fans of Yama Sushi but I really think we found a new place we will go to more often. 
Ended with some pineapple sorbet. 

Over all I highly recommend everyone to try this place. My Yelp Friend was right! So happy he suggested this place!!!
Looking forward to the next visit!!
This is a great all you can eat sushi place. There's a large variety of rolls that are to order and side dishes on the all you can eat menu. I'm definitely coming back next time I'm in vegas!
On point. Lots of really quality nigiri on the ayce menu. Decent pricing, and great service.
SO WORTH IT. The food's so fresh and the service is fantastic. Would definitely recommend this place. It's honesty with no doubt one of the best sushi places I've been to.

Very nice vibe and we were greeted as soon as we walked in by our server Andy. All you can eat shushi menu is awesome. Lunch $21.95 and Dinner $26.95. Excellent customer service and of course the food was delish! We yelp restaurants before we go out to eat and the reviews brought us here.
Great place to eat sushi at a convenient place. You are served quick, sushi is amazing and personnel as well. So glad I discovered this place.

Was  looking for something different and found it!    Very friendly and the food is great.  Had spider roll, OMG, baked green mussels, and garlic yellow tail
Niguri.   I have eaten lots of sushi and this is some of the best, from classic to edgy.   Plan to come back before leaving LV.

Amazing food, great service. I really don't know how they do it for $26 all u could eat. Had all the star items, most the nigiri sushi and I must say, I'm impressed, especially for the price, it's kinda insane if u ask me. I was expecting old low quality crap sushi but far from that! 100 times better than any Japanese buffet! Will most definitely return!!!

Update:
Been here again for our latest trip to Vegas, awesome food, fast service, we love this place! Can't wait to go back! Sit at the bar for even faster service! Wish u guys the best!
Great sushi and all you can eat so worth it :) Good fast easy service. I will come back again for sure.
It's off the strip a little way, but you will not be disappointed! Good food and way cheaper than the big hotels. We used LYFT to get there and back to the strip.

Wow I dont even know what to say. We have been out of the area for a while. I haven't had sushi in 9 months. The first thing on my list to do when returning home to Vegas was Sushi Way. What happened to this place. The server kept forgetting what we ordered. So much rice on the one roll I ordered and also on the nigiri. The screaming orgasm was two cuts of tuna nigiri thrown over some daikon. The salmon tar tar that used to have a nice presentation was some salmon cut and tossed over a pile of crab salad. It seriously looked like some ones left over picked at appetizer. We used to eat here once a week and thought I would be doing that again. We will not be eating there any more. What a let down for my first sushi in 9 months. Its really just too bad.

On our way back from Zion in Utah, we were craving a buffet as a reward for the drive and being out in the wilderness. This place had pretty good reviews so we stopped by Saturday night around 8pm. Despite the great reviews, the place was pretty empty - not sure if it was a good or bad sign (no clue when the Vegas dinner rush hours are) but I was starving so I took it as a good sign. 

AYCE is $22 for lunch and $27 for dinner. The menu is pretty huge and also has a good variety of cooked stuff. Can't compare to other AYCE sushi Vegas places since we weren't local. 

The good:
- Service was amazing! Not sure if it is because it was half empty but props to their team - plus the food came out super fast 
- The fish didn't taste fishy. The fish to rice ratio is a little higher than I would prefer...I would say that it is average. The uni and sweet shrimp was super tasty. 

The meh:
- Don't get their oysters...it was way sauced up and didn't look terribly fresh
- Don't get their Galbi/Kalbi: super chewy 
- Their rolls / Sushi Nachos were way too saucy. Would not recommend 

Stick with their nigiri and don't get any of the cooked stuff or rolls. This place is 3.5, rounded down because I'm a little weary of places that offer free stuff (in this case - a soda) for reviews (that you have to show on the spot). 

Parking: pretty easy in a strip mall - on the side of Citibank and Urban Turban.
Nice Sushi with generous pieces of fish. AYCE is good quality and reasonable. I will definitely visit again.

Not sure what happened with the staff but most of our orders were forgotten.  We had to re-order them.  The food was good but it felt like a hostage situation waiting to get all of our dinner for over 2 hours. Two parties left their tables out of frustration.  I am a pretty patient person but I started getting uncomfortable and embarrassed just only having drinks and nothing to eat in front of me for so long.  Even with nothing on our table the staff didn't bother checking in with us to see if we got our orders or wanted anything. To make matters worse it was a birthday dinner for my partner and I felt awful. 

I won't go back to this place.  I don't normally review places but the service here was just so bad and a waste of time.  If you do go here you'll probably enjoy the food but just make sure they don't forget about you.

One of the top AYCE sushi spots in town. We had a large group around 3pm, and opted for the dinner menu to get the few extra items.
 Great staff, relatively prompt with our orders. Fish tastes fresh, and good rice portions. Aside from the entrees, the dessert are absolutely delicious. The FBI (fried banana ice cream) is so awesome. Great thing is, the dessert items are unlimited too, so fill up to your heart's desire--other nice items include deep fried ice cream or mochi.  This is a great sushi spot, I'll definitely be back again.

My boyfriend and I always go there for the buffet! The food is excellent and they even serve oysters and sea urchins! And their coconut shrimp and green tea ice cream are the best! The service is excellent too. My boyfriend is not a huge fan of raw sea food and the staff patiently went through the menu with him. We always have a good time here.

This was just about the only AYCE in vegas that offered half price discount for my 9 years old twin. My lids are loving it. The place has great sushi and even Galbi was top notch. Definitely the place to go if you like sushi or Galbi
Very good sushi for an "all you can eat" place. Will definitely be back! Staff is very friendly and fun.

I have come here twice in the last two weeks while in the area, because I needed a place to work on my laptop. I didn't realize I would end up loving this place, food and service. The staff is so friendly and attentive and makes great recommendations. The lunch server not only remembered me when I walked in the door, but he also remembered what I ordered and gave me the space I needed when I received an important call. I appreciate attentive staff as well as staff that can sense a guests needs (as mine can be tricky when I have a call). At any rate, the food is always fresh and fast. I have several favorites and I love the AYCE here, more than any other place. I will continue to make this a regular lunch spot!

I have no idea why those people below wrote all the weird this as "I was waiting for food too long " or "waitresses wasn't nice enough " . The place is amazing!!!! The food even better than amazing, especially for 22 bucks!!!! As soon as I told Richard(waiter) that I like salmon he brought me the most delicious and tender salmon belly sushi. Thank you guys for everything.
Everything was amazing here from the sushi to the wine! Great fish quality and great service!! Richard and Jane were great servers and very attentive! Thank you very much

my husband and i were looking for a great sushi place for dinner and happened to find this place... it did not disappoint!!! richard was awesome and so were his recommendations!!! u have to try the salmon tartare (appetizer) and the honey toast (dessert)... as for rolls, they were all really good!!!
